loans.name: Augustine Sani

texts.en:
Augustine Sani is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Augustine Sani would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Augustine Sani can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Augustine Sani is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing  for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Mathew joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his child.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Mathew would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mathew can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Mathew spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his son: Anas. He eventually hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es una mujer de 50 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 hijo varón de 26 años, y 2 hijas mujeres de 29 y 14 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida rápida y refrescos.
Ella es buena madre, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, fuerte, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en el barrio ‘petrolero’ un área caracterizada por recibir la hoja de Coca procedente del poblado de los Yungas. De clima frío y seco, con fuertes vientos provenientes de la cordillera. 
Elena es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo amarrado, su lengua materna es le Aymará que habla en familia para el comercio habla español. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja vendiendo periódico y su hija menor porque los mayores son casados e independientes, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina, que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida rápida y refrescos, su menú diario consiste en; hamburguesas, salchipapas, sándwich de huevo sándwich de carne, gaseosas y jugos hervidos, labor que realiza todos los días de la semana durante el día. “comencé mi negocio por la necesidad de trabajar, luego con el tiempo conseguí este puesto de venta, mi ventaja es que al frente existe una parada de buses y constantemente se acercan a desayunar y comer…” comenta. Su sueño es ampliar su puesto de venta y ofrecer platos a la carta porque cada vez tiene mayor cantidad de clientes. Ella desea refaccionar el techo de una habitación para utilizarla como puesto de venta de comida para atender a mayor cantidad de clientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Elena solicita un préstamo para la refacción del techo de un cuarto para utilizarlo como puesto de venta y atender a mayor cantidad de clientes.
texts.en:
Elena is a 50 year old woman who lives with her husband. They have 1 grown son who is 26 years old and two daughters ages 19 and 14. She has a business selling fast food and soda pop. She is a good mother, patient, a good listener, supportive, strong, responsible and hard-working. Her business is located in "petrolero’", an area known for receiving coca leaves from the inhabitants of Yungas. The area has a cool and dry climate with strong winds from the mountains.

Elena has a dark complexion, long dark hair, of short height, wears glasses to read, and her first language is Aymará and her second language is Spanish, which she uses daily and for business. She shares her live with her husband who works selling newspapers and her young daughter as the older children are married and now self-sufficient. They live in a rented home built of brick with a laminate roof, and it has potable water, electricity, and a septic system. Her business is selling fast food and soda pop. Her daily menu consists of hamburgers, hot dogs and french fries, egg sandwich, meat sandwich, soda pop and juices. She works every day of the week during the day. She states, "I started my business out of necessity to work. Then with time I was able to get this sales stand. My advantage is that there is a bus stop out front and customers constantly come for breakfast and lunch..." Her dream is to expand her locale and offer dishes a la carte because her clientele is steadily growing. She wishes to remodel the roof of a room to use it as a sales stand and serve a greater number of customers.

This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the 15 years that she has been in business. For these reasons Elena seeks a loan to remodel the roof of a room to use it as a sales stand and serve a greater number of customers.

loans.use: to remodel the roof of a room to use it as a sales stand and serve a greater number of customers.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 31 years old, married, and has five children who are currently in school.

Luzviminda is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed and vitamins for her business.

Luzviminda has been in the pig fattening business for one year now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Luzviminda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila, 40, is a married woman with two children who currently attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Nila has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Nila has been in this business for one year. In the future, Nila would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Marlolito

texts.en:
Marlolito is 41 years old and single.

Marlolito is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. He requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs.

Marlolito has been in pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marlolito would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.name: Teodulita

texts.en:
Teodulita is 43 years old and has eight children. She is married and six of her children are currently in school.

Teodulita is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Teodulita has been in the pig fattening business for nine years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Teodulita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a 38-year-old married woman with three children who are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Violeta has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Violeta has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosa Estrella

texts.en:
Rosa Estrella is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 53 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Rosa Estrella has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like nail cutters, nail polish, etc. for her business.

Rosa Estrella has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like nail cutters, nail polish, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
Amada is 49 years old and has six children. She is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Amada is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Amada requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Amada has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Amada would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 55 years old and married with six children.

Teresita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Teresita has been in pig fattening for six years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Hassen

texts.en: Hassen is a 25-year-old married man with only one child who lives with his family in Haja city, Yemen. He runs a small grocery in the area where he lives with his family. He doesn't have a lot of customers, because there are not enough goods and merchandise inside the grocery. That negatively affects the living conditions of his family. Hassen wants to improve his business but he lacks money. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 500,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase food materials and merchandise for his small grocery. Hassen looks forward to expanding his business more.

loans.use: to purchase food materials and merchandise for his small grocery.

loans.name: Boshra Al- Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Boshra Al- Hodeidah. It consists of four women from Hodeidah city, Yemen. All of them work hard to provide their families with suitable living conditions. They applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB.

Boshra is the representative of the group. She is 34 years old and a mother of four children. They live in their own house in one of Hodeidah's poor areas. Making traditional incense is her sole source of income. She has operated her humble business for many years. Boshra works hard to grow her business, but she doesn't have sufficient money. Therefore, she applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase incense materials to make traditional incense. Boshra looks forward to exporting her products to all the governorates.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make traditional incense

loans.name: Al- Sorori Group

texts.en:
Al- Sorori is a group from Hodeidah city, Yemen. All the members of the group are neighbors who live in the same area. They asked for a loan of 130,000 YER from AMB.

One member of the group, Aisha, is the leader of the group. She is 36 years old and a mother of three children, all of them in school. She is a divorced woman who sells women's clothes. Selling door-to-door in her area is the main source of income for her children. The income from this humble business is not enough to cover the main expenses of her children because her capital still is very small. Aisha applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase new women's clothes to resell to women. Aisha's dream is to open a small store to sew and sell women's clothes.

loans.use: to purchase new women's clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement and bricks to renovate the house, as well as to build some extra rooms to expand the house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in chickens, chicken feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Youmna

texts.en:
Youmna is a 24-year-old, married Lebanese woman living with her single child and her husband who repairs cars. She is a hard-working woman and a great mother who is making a strong effort to meet the needs of her family.

For five years, Youmna has been working as a private teacher. She is a very welcoming person and treats her students in a friendly way. She is asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase a laptop, so she can extend her knowledge and widen her expertise. Youmna wishes to take a Kiva loan with the aim of enhancing her business.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop, so she can extend her knowledge and widen her expertise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soups, eggs, candy, fruit drinks, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Zenovia

texts.es:
La socia Zenovia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia hace platos como pollo al horno, sopas entre otros, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar verduras, pollo y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Zenovia continues to make a living from her business selling food. She wants to get ahead by means of her business; she makes plates like baked chicken and soups, among other things. Her dream is to expand her business selling food. She is asking for the loan to buy vegetables, chicken and beef. She is happy about the loan and promises to be punctual with her payments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, chicken, and beef

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Hajara joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Shu, Aibu and Rabi.

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hajara would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hajara can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Hajara spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nubia Idaisa

texts.es: Nubia es una mujer de 49 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos 2 menores de edad y un mayor de edad que le apoya económicamente. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de ropa y productos básicos actividad que le permite sostener a su familia. Nubia desea invertir en su negocio de ropa ya que en estas épocas navideñas se vuelve muy rentable, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pantalones, faldas, blusas, camisas, ropa interior, etc. Para ofrecer una mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en: Nubia is a 49-year-old woman who lives in a house she owns with her life partner and their three children, two of whom are young and one of whom is older and helps to support them financially. She is an enterprising woman who earns a living with her business selling clothing and basic products. This business allows her to support her family. Nubia wants to invest in her business, as doing so is very profitable during the Christmas season. For this reason she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in pants, skirts, blouses, shirts, underwear, etc. to offer her customers a greater number of products.

loans.use: to invest in pants, skirts, blouses, shirts, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Ali joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Jabiru, Aziza and Isari.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ali would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ali can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Ali spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.name: Al- Hashem Group

texts.en:
Al- Hashem is a group consisting of 4 women from the city of Hodeidah in Yemen. Together, they have applied for a loan of 180,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank.

Saeda is the leader of Al- Hashem group. She is married with 6 children and lives with her family in a rented house. She manages a humble business sewing women's clothing in her house, which she then resells to the women in her area. 

However, the income from Saeda's business is not enough to cover some of her family's necessary expenses. She cannot sew as many clothes as she'd like because she currently doesn't have enough fabric and equipment. 

Saeda wants to enlarge her business, and for this reason, she has applied for her 50,000 YER loan portion from AMB in order to purchase many new and stylish fabrics.

Saeda hopes to open her own store outside of her house in order to attract many more customers.

loans.use: to expand her business with the purchase of many new and stylish fabrics.

loans.name: Victoria Group

texts.es:
Para llegar al grupo “Victoria” se recorren varios kilómetros a pie debido a la falta de transporte, en el camino se puede admirar un paisaje impresionante, los árboles son enormes y muy frondosos ya que es una parte muy elevada de la comunidad, es un lugar muy tranquilo y y el aire ofrece un fresco aroma a campo.

Don Gerardo quien es el representante del grupo tiene 34 años de edad está casado con la señora Aurelia desde hace 14 años y juntos formaron una familia con cuatro hijos. Don Gerardo y Doña Aurelia han sido unos padres muy trabajadores que buscan superarse por el bienestar de sus hijos.

Hace siete años ambos salieron a la ciudad de México para trabajar y obtener ingresos para su familia. Don Gerardo trabajaba como albañil y Doña Aurelia como empleada doméstica. Sin embargo, el dejar a sus hijos a cargo de otros familiares durante tanto tiempo les hizo decidir regresar a su comunidad. Don Gerardo muy sonriente comentó “A mí nunca me ha gustado trabajar como albañil, lo que más me apasiona es estar detrás del volante”. Por esta razón, lo primero que hizo al regresar fue buscar empleo como chofer de taxis, actividad que desempeñó durante seis años, tiempo en el que además estuvo ahorrando para comprar un vehículo y trabajar por su propia cuenta. Cuando finalmente tuvo su auto, fue difícil conseguir los permisos adecuados para ofrecer su servicio. Todos los días Don Gerardo se esmeraba para obtener los suficientes ganancias, solventar los gastos del hogar y continuar rentando las placas de servicio de taxi.

Su esfuerzo y dedicación se han vistos reflejados en la estabilidad económica de su familia y de su negocio, ahora tiene su vehículo, sus placas y todos sus documentos en regla para poder transitar como taxista sin ningún problema. Ahora con su préstamo Don Gerardo podrá invertir en llantas nuevas y suspensiones para su automóvil.

Mientras tanto, Doña Aurelia también lo apoya trabajando en la venta de productos de belleza y al igual que su pareja, ella se ha esforzado mucho porque inició sólo ganando comisiones de venta, ahora como promotora tiene un sueldo base. Ambos están muy contentos y agradecidos con VisionFund y KIVA  porque los ha ayudado en sus negocios. Su meta es seguir mejorando su vivienda y ofrecelres mejores oportunidades a sus hijos. 

Araceli quien también pertenece al grupo necesita un préstamo para comprar más cerditos pequeños y Doña Aurelia en sus cosméticos.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el municipio donde viven Gerardo y Aurelia, detrás de ellos se puede ver el taxi*
texts.en:
To arrive at the “Victoria” group one has to travel various kilometers on foot due to the lack of transportation. Along the way there is impressive landscape, enormous leafy trees as the community’s elevation is very high. It is a very tranquil place and the air offers the fresh aroma of the countryside.

Gerardo is the representative of the group. He is 34 years old, married to Aurelia for 14 years and together they have formed a family with 4 children. Gerardo and Aurelia have been very hard-working parents who strive to provide for the well-being of their children.

7 years ago they both left to Mexico City to work and obtain income for their family. Gerardo worked as a bricklayer and Aurelia as a domestic employee. Nevertheless, leaving their children with other family members for such a long time made them decide to return to their community. Gerardo smiles and says, “I never liked working as a bricklayer. What I like the most is to be driving.” For that reason, the first thing he did upon returning to the village was seek employment as a taxi driver. He did this work for 6 years, during which time he saved money to buy a vehicle and work for himself. When he finally acquired his car, it was difficult to get the adequate permissions to offer his services. Every day Gerardo worked to get enough income, meet his household expenses, and continue renting taxi services.

His effort and dedication have been reflected in the economic stability of his family and his business. Now he has his vehicle, his credentials, and all the documents in order to be able to work as a taxi driver without any problem. Now Gerardo seeks a loan to invest in new tires and suspension for his car.

Meanwhile Aurelia also works selling beautify products and like her husband, she has strived a lot because she began only earning sales commissions. Now as a promoter she has a base salary. Both are very content and thankful to VisionFund and Kiva because they have helped their businesses. Their goal is to continue improving their home and offering the best they can.
Araceli also belongs to the group and needs a loan to buy more piglets and Aurelia her cosmetics.

*The photograph was taken in the municipality where Gerardo and Aurelia live, and behind them you can see the taxi.

loans.use: to buy new tires and suspension for his car.

location.town: San Miguel La Labor, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new computers and do some maintenance on the old ones.

loans.name: Om-Ghadar Group

texts.en:
Om-Ghadar is the same group consisting of five women: Elham, Samia, Nour, Nama and Nojod. After this group finished the repayment of all the installments of the first loan, which was given by Kiva lenders, it applied for a second loan of 350,000 YER from Kiva lenders.

Nama is the same leader of the first group. She applied for the first loan from Kiva lenders to buy cement and carpentry materials to renovate her house. She is very thankful for Kiva lenders for their first loan. In truth, the Kiva loan helped her very much in making necessary renovations to the house, but she couldn't complete the rest. For this reason, she applied for a second loan of 70,000 YER from Kiva lenders in order to purchase the amount of construction supplies that it will take to complete the renovation of the rest of the house. Nama hopes this loan will be funded too.

loans.use: to purchase the amount of construction supplies that it will take to complete the renovation of the rest of the house.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Haruna joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Musa, Esther and Favour. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Haruna would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Haruna can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Haruna spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alhaji Iliya

texts.en:
Alhaji Iliya is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Alhaji Iliya joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Magaji, Masaudu and Maharas.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Iliya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Iliya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Alhaji Iliya spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Markus Sabo

texts.en: Markus Sabo is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Markus Sabo joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Saminu, Asabe and Ifaiba.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Markus Sabo would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet for his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Markus Sabo can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Markus Sabo spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en:
Aminu is a maize farmer from Chino village in Kaduna state.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Aminu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Aminu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Aminu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell maize at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Om Amjad Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om Amjad. It consists of four women from Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 210,000 YER from AMB.

Kawkab is the leader of the group, a married woman with five children, living with her family in a very poor house which lacks of a lot of furniture. This miserable condition makes the family very cold, particularly these days. Kwakab's husband works and earns a small income that is not enough to purchase sufficient furniture for the house. Kawkab decided to help him. As a result, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase some of the necessary beds and blankets for the house.

Kawkab hopes to send her children to a private school.

loans.use: to purchase some of the necessary beds and blankets for the house.

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.ru:
Мархамат жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая женщина 57 лет. Она замужем и имеет четырех детей. Она очень любит своих детей и старается дать им всё необходимое для того, чтобы они могли расти, развиваться и реализовывать себя в обществе. Она занимается куплей и продажей мужской одежды на местном рынке. Она привозит оптом товар и сдает в розницу местным продавцам. Муж Мархамат занимается частным извозом. Он таксист. В день его доход составляет 60-80 сомони. 
Сейчас Мархамат желает расширить ассортимент своего товара, ей необходимо закупить товар, так как начинается весений сезон. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и желает получить кредит на покупку одежды. Мархамат очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Marhamat is an optimistic and hard-working woman, 57 years of age. She is married and has four children. She loves her children very much and tries to provide them with everything they need to grow, develop and find their place in society. Marhamat buys and resells men's clothing. She buys merchandise wholesale and delivers it to local resellers at retail prices. Marhamat's husband provides private taxi services. He earns about 60-80 TJS per day.

At present Marhamat would like to expand her merchandise selection. She needs to restock since the spring season will begin soon. This is why she has applied to Arvand for a loan to buy clothing. Marhamat really hopes for a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for its support.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Soud Group

texts.en:
This group is called Soud. It consists of four women from Taiz city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB.

Amina is the leader of the group. She is a married woman, 42 years old, living with her family in a small house that needs necessary expanding and renovation because it is an old house. She is an uneducated woman and works as a housewife. Her husband earns a small salary working in the private sector, but it is not enough to cover the necessary family expenses. 

The house where the family lives needs a renovation and needs to be expanded because there is not enough room for all the members of the family, and Amina doesn't have sufficient money. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction supplies and carpentry materials to renovate the house and to construct more rooms.

Amina looks forward to making all the necessary renovations and expanding the house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies and carpentry materials to renovate the house and to construct more rooms.

loans.name: Al- Somo Mosmi Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Somo Mosmi. It consists of four women from Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB.

Saida is the leader of the group. She is a married woman who is 57 years old. She lives with her family in very poor living quarters. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family and his income is very limited and unfixed. It is not enough to provide his family with money for necessary expenses and needs. The house where Saida and her family live lacks food most time and they live in very miserable conditions. Most days, Saida and her family go to sleep without dinner and that negatively affects their health. 

Saida decided to apply for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase food ingredients, such as sugar, flour, salt, etc., to make suitable food for the family. Saida hopes to see her family live in a better future.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients, such as sugar, flour, salt, etc., to make suitable food for the family.

loans.name: Usaini

texts.en: Usaini is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Usaini joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Jessy, Philimon and Mershark.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Usaini would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Usaini can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Usaini spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alejandra Ramona

texts.es: la señora Alejandra se destaca por ser una mujer con principios ejemplares , soltera, sin hijos a su cargo, de profesión maestra de educación primaria, pero se desempeña como Directora de un núcleo escolar de la zona donde vive, con 27 años de laborar en el sistema educativo,  esta señora tiene la necesidad de mejorar parte de su vivienda  por lo que visito a Ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el que utilizaría en la Compra de cemento, arena y mano de obra, con los que realizaría el embaldosado de su piso y crear mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Alejandra stands out as a woman of impeccable principles. She is single without children, and a primary school teacher by profession. After 27 years of work in the educational system, she is currently the director of a group of schools in the zone where she lives.

Alejandra needs to improve part of her house. She has requested from CEPRODEL a loan to buy cement and sand, as well as to pay for labor to install tile on the floor. This will improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand, and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Adrine

texts.en:
Adrine is a hardworking woman. She is 29 years old and married with one child, and lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

Adrine operates a retail shop, located in a rural community, as her main source of income. She has no additional income for her family. Her retail shop is located in a busy area where she is expecting to get many customers. Like any other small retail shop, she is challenged by competition from people with similar business and price fluctuations. She needs a loan to add to her inventory of items for sale.

loans.use: to add to her inventory of items for sale.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de pulseras y aretes,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere que su negocio quiere salir adelante,la socia es una mujer emprendedora.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pulseras y collares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Francisca continues to work selling bracelets and earrings.  She, through this business, wants that her business succeed.  She is an enterprising woman.  

Francisca is requesting the loan to buy bracelets and necklaces.  She is happy for the loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: To buy bracelets and necklaces.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in chickens, feed concentrate, vitamins and basic products.

loans.name: Om Ra'ad Group

texts.en:
Om Ra'ad is a group of six women who live in Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 270,000 YER from AMB.

Takia is the leader of the group. She is a married woman with four children. Her husband works as a soldier and earns a small salary. A long time ago, he purchased a piece of land and built a small house on it. Takia supported him with a lot of her own money. Due to his a small salary, Takia's husband couldn't finish building the house. His salary is not enough to cover the necessary needs of the family. 

Takia decided to complete the building and renovation of the house to make the house safe and spacious. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase some construction materials needed to finish building the house and renovating it. Takia hopes to finish the building and renovation of the house.

loans.use: to purchase some construction materials needed to finish building the house and renovating it.

loans.name: Gayratjon

texts.ru:
Гайратчон молодой парень 30 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Его жену зовут Зулхумор. Она домохозяйка. Она заботливая мама. Гайратчон очень трудолюбивый  парень.Он любит семью и старается для благополучия своей семьи. 
Он занимается куплей продажей мужской обуви на местном рынке. D месяц его доход составляет до 300 долларов. 
  Гайратчон хочет отремонтировать свой дом. Но для этого у него не хватает собственных средств. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и  хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Гайратчон надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд  за поддержку.
texts.en:
Gayratjon is a young man of 30 years who is married and has three children.  His wife's name is Zulhumor.  She tends to their home and is a caring mother.  Gayratjon is a very hardworking man.  He loves his family and does what he can for their benefit.  He buys and sells men's shoes at a local marketplace for a living, and his monthly income is up to $300 USD.  

Gayratjon wants to finish renovating his house, but lacks the money to do so out of pocket.  For that reason, he's turned to Arvand for help and is seeking a loan to buy building materials for his home renovation.  Gayratjon is hoping for a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: buy building materials to finish renovating his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more ready-made women's clothes, fabrics and incense for resale to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase some goats to raise them for resale.

loans.name: Clovis

texts.en: Clovis is a hardworking married man who owns a butcher shop in the rural area of Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has no additional income. He started this business as a main source of income. He is requesting a loan to buy goats for the butcher shop. He is also expecting to construct a commercial house from the proceeds of his business, but he is facing the challenge of defaulting customers.

loans.use: to buy goats for the butcher shop.

loans.name: Peter.

texts.en: Peter is a 46-year-old married man with five children and two dependents who are orphans, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. Peter is a secondary school teacher and has 13 years of experience. His main ambition is to sustain his family with quality education. He has a challenge of low salary, which cannot pay the medical bills for his sick son. Therefore, Peter wants a loan to pay medical bills for his son.

loans.use: to pay medical bills for his son.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Yolanda con su negocio, de fabricación de ropa infantil y venta calzado para damas, con su anterior credikiva logró invertir en insumos como telas, hilos, botones para la producción de sus productos, adquirió mas capital para invertir, cuyo beneficio se vió reflejado en el incremento de sus ventas y sus utilidades y con ello los ingresos de la microempresa y de su familia. "Muchas gracias por este apoyo, que me ha permitido progresar en mi vida familiar" son sus palabras para con los finaciadores de Kiva. En la actualidad requiere atender los pedidos de su clientela,porque son superiores en el mes de Diciembre y su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente para responder a esta oportunidad, por ello está aplicando a un nuevo finaciamineto, mediante el cual comprará, tela para elaborar ropa para niñas, vestidos para damas , comprará calzado y accesorios tambien . Asi estará satisfecha su clientela mientras ella aumenta sus ganancias, para lograr mayor bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Yolanda with her business making baby clothes and selling women's shoes.  With her previous Kiva loan, she was able to invest in supplies such as fabric, thread, and buttons, to make more of her products and acquire more capital to invest.  With this investment she saw an increase in her sales and profits, and so she increased her earnings from her business for her family. "Many thanks for this support, which allowed me to make progress in my family's life," are her words for the Kiva lenders.  
At this time, she needs to fill some of her customers' orders, because they are greater in the month of December, and her working capital is not sufficient  to respond to these opportunities.  This is why she is applying for a new loan to buy fabric to make children's clothing and women's dresses.  She will also buy shoes and accessories.  This way she will satisfy her customers while increasing her income, so that she can achieve greater well being for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothing, and to buy shoes and accessories

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Yahaya is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: juan de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijas, el se dedica desde hace varios años al cultivo de café, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que estan cerca de su casa, Juan esta solicitando un credito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc. para poder continuar con sus cultivos y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Juan, 42, lives in his own house with his life partner and his two daughters.  He has earned a living for several years growing coffee.  He sells his crops in a variety of markets near his house.

Juan's requesting a loan to buy soil amendments, fertilizer, pest control, etc. so he can continue with his crops and earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments, fertilizer, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is a small Mexican farmer who owns a few cows and poultry. He also cultivates corn for his family’s own consumption. He was very interested in investing in his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, which will allow him to take advantage of his animals’ manure to produce biogas and biofertilizer. The purchase of the biodigester will allow him to save money by displacing the expensive LP gas and chemical fertilizers, while protecting the environment as the waste will be treated and turned into a productive resource instead of contaminating underground water sources and emitting greenhouse gases. With the savings he will make, Ismael plans to buy new cows and improve the infrastructure on his farm. As his available income increases, Ismael might be able to focus only on his farm, whereas today he is complementing his income by working as a taxi driver.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 10m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Malami Lawal

texts.en: Malami Lawal is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Malami Lawal joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Jamie and Bashir.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Malami Lawal would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Malami Lawal can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Malami Lawal spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yusuf Rabo

texts.en: Yusuf Rabo is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Yusuf Rabo joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Ezekel, Saminu and Danjuma.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yusuf Rabo would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yusuf Rabo can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Yusuf Rabo spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a maize farmer from Tafki village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Emmanuel would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Emmanuel can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Emmanuel, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in chickens, concentrate, and vitamins.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 16m3 waste-to-energy system.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en: Yahaya is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Yahaya joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Esther, Rejoice and Musa.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Yahaya spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees and uniforms. thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en: Mathew is a maize farmer from Chino village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Mathew would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mathew can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Mathew, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: Rubén es un hombre trabajador que desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la crianza de ganado bovino y su pequeña tienda de productos básicos, actividad que le ha permitido sostener a su familia. Él habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Rubén desea invertir en comida y vitaminas para el ganado y en su tienda de productos básicos ya que desea ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: productos básicos, comida y vitaminas para ganado bovino, y así incrementar la producción de leche y las ganancias de su tienda.
texts.en: Rubén is a working man who from a young age has worked raising cattle and has a small store selling basic products. These businesses have enable him to support his family. He lives in his own home with his wife and two children. Ruben wishes to buy food and vitamins for his cattle and for his store some basic products as he wants to offer a great variety to his customers. So he is seeing a loan from FUSAI to invest in basic products, food and vitamins for cattle and in this way increase his milk product and the profits from his store.

loans.use: to invest in basic products for his store and food and vitamins for his cattle.

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
La socia  Margot pertenece al banco comunal LIDERNADO LAS PALMERAS, la socia continua dedicándose a su negocio de brindar servicio de transporte de turismo, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia continua transportando a sus turistas a los distintos tours, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas.
texts.en:
Margot is a member of the communal bank Liderando Las Palmeras [Leading Las Palmeras]. She is still running her business providing transportation to tourists, and is grateful for this loan and committed to repaying it. She is a very honest and industrious person who drives groups on various tours and is thus earning a living and improving her family's situation. 

She is applying for a loan for the purchase of tires.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in milk and necessary materials to make dairy products.

loans.name: Samuel Ramiro

texts.es:
Samuel tiene 54 años de edad es casado tiene 4 hijos vive en San Miguel en la comunidad Salado Chico pertenece a la ventanilla rural San Francisco.
El se dedica a la agricultura y a la cria de animales tiene una granja en la cual quiere invertir produce toda clase de hortalizas, solicita el credito para la compra de insumos y semillas para  sembrar en la granja.Realiza las compras en San Miguel cada jueves, su sueño es mejorar en la situacion económica para poder sustentar a su familia, el desafio al que se enfrenta es el riesgo que le caiga alguma enfermedad a los plantas.
En su tiempo libre le gusta pasearse.
texts.en: Samuel is 54 years old, married, and has 4 children. He lives in San Miguel in the Salado Chico community in rural San Francisco. He farms and raises animals. He has a farm into which he wants to invest growing all kinds of crops. He seeks a loan to invest in farming supplies and seeds to plant his farm. He makes purchases in San Miguel every Thursday. His dream is to improve his economic situation in order to support his family. His challenge is that there is risk that some infirmity falls upon the plants. In his free time he enjoys going for a walk.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Severiano

texts.en:
Severiano is a young and ambitious hog farmer who has been looking for a solution to reduce his costs and turn his farm into a more sustainable place. By investing in his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, he will now be able to displace the expensive LP gas by turning his hogs’ manure into a precious resource to produce his own biogas and organic fertilizer. The greenhouse gas emissions produced by the hogs’ waste will be eliminated, the farm will become a cleaner place and Severiano will save money, which he in turn plans to use to improve his farm’s infrastructure and buy more pigs. His living standards will improve as the whole family starts cooking and heating water with biogas, recycling and reusing the pigs’ waste and turning it into an integrated and productive asset for the farm. 

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester; the remaining part will be covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 40m3 waste-to-energy biodigester.

loans.name: Qendrim

texts.en: Qendrim is again asking for another loan for his business. This time, he would like to renovate his storage area, where he keeps the chestnuts and other equipment for his stand. The renovation would help him to ensure that his equipment and investments are safe and they are not in danger of spoiling or being ruined. In the long term, this is a worthy use of his money as it will prevent unnecessary extra costs and will last a long time. Qendrim is thankful for the continued support from the lenders and their willingness to always give him the opportunity to expand his business and give him and his family a chance for a better future.

loans.use: to renovate his storage area, where he keeps the chestnuts

loans.name: Rina Maribel

texts.es: Rina de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, ella quiere mejorar terminando de construir el muro que muestra en la fotografía, por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cemento, ladrillo,s hierro, arena y pago de mano de obra para que ella y su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos.
texts.en: Rina, age 40, lives in her own home with her two children. She sells products through a catalogue. With her sales, she is able to cover some household costs. She wants to finish building the wall shown in the photo. For this reason, she is requesting a loan for the purchase of cement, bricks, iron, and sand, and to pay the labourers so that she and her family can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, iron, and sand, and to pay the labourers.

loans.name: Ximena

texts.es:
Ximena es una joven mujer de 22 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos de 9, 7, 3 y 2 años, y su negocio es la producción de queso artesanal.
Ella es independiente, constante, emprendedora, buena madre, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la comunidad ‘Yaurichambi’ caracterizado por su cercanía al lago sagrado Titicaca, área agrícola dónde se cría ganado; vacuno, ovino y camélido, se vive de la pesca y también de cereales y vegetales del lugar, como la quinua, el chuño, la haba, la papa, etc. caracterizada por el clima frío, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 1-12 grados centígrados y donde los rayos solares golpean con mucha fuerza la superficie.
Ximena es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo trenzado, su vestimenta es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se encarga de la agricultura, los hijos mayores estudian en la escuela y los menores son bebes, viven en una casa construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con los servicios de electricidad y agua de pozo. Su trabajo es la elaboración y venta de queso artesanal; la variedad de quesos más producida y consumida en la zona, es el queso fresco, el quesillo, el queso doble crema, y el chaqueño, “la elaboración de quesos es totalmente artesanal, realizamos todo el proceso con materiales del lugar eso le da un sabor característico de la zona…” comenta. La experiencia en la elaboración de quesos es de toda su vida, ella creció realizando este proceso. Su sueño es producir en mayor cantidad, ella desea realizar la compra de ganado lechero para producir mayor cantidad de leche para su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Ximena solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero para incrementar su producción de quesos.
texts.en:
Ximena is a young 22-year-old woman. She is married with 4 children ages 9, 7, 3, and 2. She makes artesanal cheese.
She is independent, constant, enterprising, a good mother, responsible, and hard-working. She runs her business in the Yaurichambi community. This community is close to the sacred Lake Titicaca, an agricultural region where livestock (llamas, cows, and sheep) are raised. The people live off of fish and local grains and vegetables like quinoa, chuño, beans, potatoes, etc. The region is cold, with a daily temperature that varies between 1 and 12 degrees celsius. The sun's rays are harsh.
Ximena is dark-skinned, short, with long dark hair pulled back. She dresses traditionally (hat, shawl, full skirt). Her mother tongue is Aymara and she speaks Spanish because of the culture and for business. She shares her life with her husband, who works in agriculture, and their children. Their eldest children are in school and the youngest are babies. They live in an adobe home with a corrugated iron roof. Their home has electricity and well-water.
Ximena makes and sells artesanal cheese. The most-produced and most-consumed variety of cheese in the area is fresh cheese, cream cheese, double cream cheese, and chaqueño.
"Cheese-making is completely artesanal. We do the whole process with local materials, and this gives it a characteristic local flavour" she says. Her experience in cheese-making comes from her whole life; she grew up making cheese. Her dream is to produce in greater quantities. She wants to purchase dairy cows to produce more milk for her business.
This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the 20 years she has been doing this work.
For these reasons, Ximena is requesting a loan to purchase dairy cows to increase her cheese production.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows for cheese-making.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal, la joven vive en casa propia con su madre, ella esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar mas frutas y verduras por mayor para poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young woman with the blurred face is 29 years old and lives in a high-risk zone. She sells fruits and vegetables in her business located in the municipal market. The young woman lives in her own home with her mother. She is seeking a loan to be able to buy fruits and vegetables at wholesale in order to have better income.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia Bernardina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de granos secos como maiz,trigo y quinua,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere tener un negocio propio como una tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar maiz,trigo y quinua.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Bernardina continues with her business selling dried grains such as corn, flour, and quinoa. She is an enterprising and fighting woman. Through her business she wants to have her own grocery store. She is requesting a loan to purchase corn, flour, and quinoa.
She is happy about this loan and promises to repay her quotas.

loans.use: to buy corn, flour, and quinoa.
