loans.name: Ruzigul

texts.ru: Рузигул уроженка района Яван. Ей 49 лет. Она мать двоих дочерей и троих сыновей. Старшая дочь окончила школу, младшая учится в десятом классе, а сыновья работают в России. Рузигул сама занимается животноводством. Она в течение 5 лет выращивает крупнорогатый скот мясной и молочной породы, и тем самым обеспечивает семью доходом, а также молоком и молочными продуктами. Вести данный бизнес ей помогают дочери и невестка. Рузигул в данный момент хочет увеличить поголовье скотов, а также сделать ремонт в старом обветшалом коровнике. Для этой цели она просит кредит. Рузигул таким образом планирует расширить свой бизнес и создать благоприятные условия для продвижения деятельности. Поэтому этот кредит ей очень важен. Она полагается на вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Ruzigul is a native of the Yavan region. She is 49 years old and the mother of two daughters and three sons. Her eldest daughter finished school, while the youngest is in tenth grade. Her son works in Russia. 

Ruzigul works with livestock breeding. She has bred cattle for meat and milk for a period of five years, and thus provided her family with income, and also milk and dairy products. Her daughters and daughter-in-law help her with managing the business. 

Ruzigul would currently like to increase the number of cattle and also to repair the old, dilapidated cowshed. With this aim she requests a loan. Ruzigul plans to expand her business this way, and create favorable conditions for continuing her business. Therefore this loan is important to her. She relies on your support.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and repair her cowshed

loans.name: Juana Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia Juana Elizabeth se sigue dedicando al negocio de accesorios para carros,la socia es una mujre emprendedora y luchadora,la socia por medio de este negocio  quiere ahorrar y tener un negocio propio como otra tienda de venta de accesorios.La socia solicita el credito para comprar ventanas,parabrisas y llantas.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juana Elizabeth is continuing with her car accessory business. She is an enterprising and fighting woman. Through this business she wants to save up and have her own store to sell accessories. She is requesting a loan to purchase windows, windshields, and tires.
Juana Elizabeth is happy about this loan and promises to repay the quotas as established.

loans.use: to purchase windows, windshields, and tires.

loans.name: Fanny Flor

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS, la socia Fanny tiene 48 años de edad es casada y tiene 02 hijos, la socia se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte (movilidad escolar),la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de llantas.
texts.en:
Fanny Flor belongs to the Liderando Las Palmas communal bank. She is 48, married, and has two children. She provides a school transportation service. She is grateful to have this loan and promises to repay her quotas as established. She has had her business for some time now and it is going well for her thanks to her daily hard work. This is how she supports her family.
She is requesting a loan for the purchase of tires.

loans.use: to purchase tires.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гулсара женщина 36 лет. Она родилась в семье рабочего. Гулсара  замужем и имеет 4х детей.  Гулсара очень жизнерадостная и любящая мать. Гулсара очень трудолюбивая  женщина. Муж Гулсары работает охранником. У неё очень дружная семья. Она хочет получить кредит для оплаты обучения своего племянника в ВУЗе. Она заранее благодарит за поддержку МДО Арванд.
texts.en:
Gulsara is a woman of 36 years. She was born in a working family. Gulsara is married and has four children. She is a happy and loving mother, and a hardworking woman. Gulsara's husband works as a security guard. She has a very friendly family.

Gulsara would like to get a loan to pay for her nephew's university education. She thanks "MDO Arvand" in advance for the support.

loans.use: to pay for her nephew's education.

loans.name: Daniel Bawa

texts.en: Daniel Bawa is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Hosea, Mathew and Danjuma. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Daniel Bawa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Daniel Bawa spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a Babban Gona maize farmer. 

In the past, in order to cover his pending expenses, Michael would typically have sold his maize soon after harvest at a low price. However, now he is a member, and with help from Babban Gona and this loan, Michael can store his maize at harvest and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more. 

When asked about his goals, Michael expressed a desire to use the extra income to provide his family with food and clothing. And, in the long run, he wishes to ensure his 3 children - Ishaku, Mahamaya, and Peter - are all educated with professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Alicia Del Carmen

texts.es: Alicia, es una mujer emprendedora de 39 años de edad, a raíz de su trabajo como mercaderista en diferentes almacenes de cadena de la ciudad de Barranquilla, identifico una oportunidad de negocio, con las promociones de artículos que lanzan estos almacenes, ella comercializa perfumes, cremas, ropa, shampoo, zapatos y artículos que ella considere que pueda ofrecer a sus clientes. Ella está dedicada desde el año 2012 a esta actividad,  además de ser empleada en una empresa, estas dos actividades le han generado mayores ingresos para el beneficio de su familia y así mismo para encaminar sus esfuerzos a una meta familiar a futuro de tener su casa propia. Para cumplir con unos encargos que le han solicitado sus clientes y por tener escaso capital, en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará perfumes, cremas, ropa, shampoo, zapatos y otros artículos en promoción, para comercializarlos en esta temporada navideña. Alicia es madre de un hijo de 16 años y una hija de 10 años de edad, ellos son su motor motivacional, ella desea brindarles estudios y un excelente porvenir.
texts.en:
Alicia is an enterprising 39-year-old woman. As a result of her work as a sales representative for various chain stores in the city of Barranquilla, she identified a business opportunity. With the sales that these stores launch, she buys perfumes, creams, clothes, shampoo, shoes, and other items that she believes she can offer her customers. She has been pursuing this business since 2012 in addition to being an employee for a company. These two occupations have yielded a larger income for the benefit of her family and also to direct her efforts towards the fulfillment of a future family goal, which is to own her own home.

Because of her limited capital to fulfill the orders that her customers have requested her, she is currently applying for a Kiva loan—her first loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy perfumes, creams, clothes, shampoo, shoes, and other sale items to sell them during the Christmas season.

Alicia is the mother of a 16-year-old son and a 10-year-old daughter. They are her driving force, and she wants to provide them with an education and an excellent future.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, clothes, shampoo, shoes, and other sale items.

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru: Шахло жительница города Истаравшан. Ей 41 лет. Она родилась в семье рабочего. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Шахло работает  учительницей  в средней школе.  Она  преподавательница  начальных классов. Шахло очень трудолюбивая и спокойная  женщина. Она любит свою профессию. Её мужа зовут Ихтиер. У него есть своя столовая при центральной районной больнице.  Они живут  в доме который построили сами. Её сыновья студенты. Они учатся   Политехническом институте   города Худжанда.  Шахло хочет взять кредит для оплаты договора обучения своих сыновей. Шахло заранее благодарит МДО Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Shahlo is a resident of the city of Istaravshan. She is 41 years old. She was born into a working family. She is married and has two children. 

Shahlo works as a school teacher. She teaches in the initial classes. Shahlo is a very hardworking and calm woman. She loves her profession. Her husband is called Ihtiyor. He has his own cafeteria at the central hospital. They live in a house they have built themselves. 

Shahlo's sons are students. They study at the Polytechnic Institute in the city of Khujand. Shahlo would like to take a loan to pay for her sons' tuition. Shahlo thanks "MDO Arvand" in advance for the support.

loans.use: to pay for her sons' university tuition

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
Махбубе 49 лет. Она замужняя женщина и мать двоих детей. Махбуба добрая и гостеприимная женщина. Она около 6 лет занимается земледелием.
   В этом году Махбуба посадила капусту. Еще немного времени осталось до сбора урожая. На данный момент Махбубе надо обработать урожай минеральными удобрениями. Она планирует получить качественный и богатый урожай, поэтому она хочет купить качественные проверенные удобрения. Но на такое количество удобрений ей не хватает не большая сумма денег. Она запрашивает кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений. Она верит, что Вы внесете вклад в получение урожая. Она верит в Вас и Вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mahbuba is 49 years old. She is a married woman and the mother of two children. Mahbuba is a good and welcoming woman. She has worked with agriculture for around six years. This year Mahbuba planted cabbage. A few months still remain before the harvesting. 

Currently Mahbuba needs to process the land with mineral fertilizers. She plans to get a good and rich harvest, and therefore she would like to purchase proven fertilizer of high quality. However, she does not have enough money for this type of fertilizer. 

Mahbuba requests a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers. She believes that you will contribute to her harvest. She believes in you and your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers of high quality

loans.name: Rocio Gricelda

texts.es:
Rocio tiene 30 años de edad es soltera tiene 2 hijos vive en San Miguel provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad Porotobamba, pertenece a la ventanilla rural San Francisco.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y frejol, solicita el credito para la compra de fertilizantes y semilla para empezar a sembrar. Realiza las compras en San Miguel cada semana, su sueño es comprarse un terreno para sembrar mas y mejorar la produccion. El desafio al que se enfrenta es que caiga plagas en el maiz y perder los sembrios, en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Rocio is 30 years old, single and has two children. She lives in San Miguel provincia in Bolivar, in the community of   Porotobamba, and belongs to the San Francisco communal bank.

Ella farms, growing corn and beans. She is requesting the loan in order to buy fertilizers and seed so that she can start planting.

She makes her purchases in San Miguel each week. Her dream is to buy a piece of land so that she can plant more and improve her output. The challenge she faces are pests infesting the corn and destroying the plantings. In her free time she likes to play sports.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en: Yahaya is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Yahaya is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to ensure his children - Yusha, Ruth and Naomi - are educated and have access to professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en: Yakubu is a maize farmer from Ikara village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yakubu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Yakubu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Murtala

texts.en:
Murtala is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. 

In the past, in order to pay his pressing expenses, Murtala would typically have sold his maize soon after harvest, but at a very low price. However, now that he is a member of Babban Gona, with their help and this loan Murtala can now store his maize at harvest and sell it a few months later for a price up to 40% more. 

Like other members of Babban Gona, Murtala is looking to earn a better income and to provide more food and clothing for his family. He hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en: Samaila is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Samaila joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Salina, Nabon and Precious.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Samaila would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samaila can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Samaila  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: To pay for children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de cafetin,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere abrir otro cafetin,la socia es una mujer emprendedora.La socia solicita el credito para comprar tortas,empanadas y pasteles.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Marcelina continues to run her coffee shop. Through the success of this business, she wants to open another coffee shop. She is an enterprising woman. She is requesting a loan to buy cakes, empanadas and pastries.

She is happy for the loan and promises to comply with her payments.

loans.use: buy cakes, empanadas and pastries.

loans.name: Bahadur

texts.ru: Бахадур мужчина 45 лет ,женат ,отец пятерых детей. Он окончил высшее учебное заведение в России,учился в политехническом университете.Но в то время из-за болезни отца ему пришлось вернуться на Родину.Бахадур не нашел работу у себя в городе,и поэтому начал заниматься животноводством.Сейчас у него 10 баранов и 2 коровы.Бахадур любит своё дело,ему нравится с утра ,пока еще не вышло солнце , дышать свежим воздухом и пасить скот на поле.Также Бахадур на своем участке земли выращивает фрукты и овощи.Ему помогает его жена.Она доет коров , продает молоко и собранный урожай на рынке.Бахадур планирует закупить корм для скота на зиму,но у него нет полной суммы денег.Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.Он выражает благодарность и почтение  организации Арванд и надеется на положительный ответ.
texts.en:
Bahadur is a man of 45 years. He is married and the father of five children. He graduated from higher education in Russia, where he studied at the Polytechnic University. However, at this time his father got ill, and he had return to his native land. 

Bahadur did not find work in his city, and therefore he started working with livestock breeding. Currently he has ten rams and two cows. Bahadur loves his work. He likes the morning, when the sun is not yet up, and he can breathe the fresh air and the cattle is grazing in the field. Bahadur also has his own plot of land where he grows fruits and vegetables. His wife helps him. She milks the cows and sells the milk and the harvest at the market. 

Bahadur plans to purchase livestock feed for the winter, but he does not have the full sum of money required. Therefore he turned to "MDO Arvand" for financial support. He extends his gratitude and respect to "Arvand" and hopes for a positive answer.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en: Tomas is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Jibril, Alheri and Fatrisha. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Tomas would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Tomas spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Edith Del Socorro

texts.es: Edith es una mujer de 60 años de edad, residente del municipio de Soledad, esta emprendedora mujer por intermedio del comité cívico del barrio en el que reside, inició con la venta de comidas rápidas, helados y refrescos, en un kiosco ubicado en la zona recreativa del frente de su casa, alterno a esta actividad por intermedio de catálogos especializados en ventas de productos, ella comercializa joyería, cosméticos, perfumes y demás artículos que ofrezcan en la campaña.  Edith labora diariamente 5 horas, ella es muy dedicada con sus negocios, por eso ha logrado mantener su clientela fidelizada. Su negocio inicio en el año 1989, en todo este tiempo ella ha logrado mantenerse con su propio capital de trabajo, sin embargo ella siente la necesidad de solicitar un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual invertirá en los insumos necesarios para la preparación de sus comidas rápidas como panes, salsas, salchichas, así mismo comprará helados, refrescos, agua y artículos del catálogo para entregar unos pedidos.  Esta inversión fortalecerá las ventas, las utilidades y el capital de trabajo. Ella es madre de un hijo de 30 años y dos hijas de 38 y 32 años de edad. Aunque su gran desafío ha sido el escaso capital de trabajo, ella desea continuar trabajando con el mismo compromiso y dedicación, para cumplir con su meta de mejorar los ingresos familiares y fortalecer su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Edith is a 60-year-old woman who is a resident of the Soledad municipality. This entrepreneurial woman, through the neighborhood civic committee, started by selling fast food, ice cream, and soda in a stand located in the recreational zone in front of her house. She alternated this business with catalogues that specialize in selling products. She markets jewelry, cosmetics, perfumes, and other items that they offer in the campaign. 

Edith works 5 hours daily. She is very dedicated to her businesses. For this reason, she has been able to maintain a faithful customer base. Her business started in 1989. During all this time, she has been able to support herself with her own working capital. However, she feels the need to request a Kiva loan – the first loan that she requests from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo – which she will use to invest in the necessary supplies to prepare her fast foods such as bread, sauces, and sausages. She will also buy ice cream, soda, water, and items from the catalogue to complete some orders.

This investment will strengthen her sales, her profit, and her working capital. She is the mother of one son, who is 30 years old, and two daughters, who are 38 and 32 years old. Although her biggest challenge has been scarce working capital, she wants to continue working with the same dedication and commitment, in order to achieve her goal of improving her family income and to strengthen her working capital.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as bread, sauces, and sausages, and to buy ice cream, soda, water, and catalogue items to complete some orders.

loans.name: Alhaji

texts.en: Alhaji is a maize farmer from Ikara village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Alhaji, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Isiya

texts.en:
Isiya is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his 3 children: Istifanus, Hosiya, and Elisha.  

In the past, in order to pay his pressing expenses, Isiya would typically have sold his maize soon after harvest, but at very low prices. However, now that he is a member, with this loan and Babban Gona's support, Isiya can store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for prices up to 40% more. 

When asked, Isiya  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children. And he hopes to eventually become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Bulus Hassan would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, in order to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Bulus Hassan can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Bulus Hassan, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Ibrahim joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Musa, Dan'Asabe and Manasa.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, in order to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Ibrahim  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a maize farmer from Duna village in Kaduna state. 

In the past, in order to pay her immediate expenses, Victoria would typically have sold her maize soon after harvest, but at low prices. However, she is now a Babban Gona member. With their support, and help from this loan, Victoria can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more. 

Victoria, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for her family. She also hopes to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Malo

texts.en:
Malo is a 37-year-old mother of 1 child. She runs a small business selling taro and banana in her community to earn a living. 

Malo has requested a loan to buy taro root, banana tube, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and hand gloves to help her run the business. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy taro root, banana tube, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and hand gloves.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is 36 years old and runs a business selling taro and banana in her village. She has been doing this for more than a year to earn a living. 

Clara has requested a loan to buy taro root, banana tube, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and hand gloves to assist her with the business. She will expand her business in the future using her profits. 

Clara became a member of SPBD 2014.

loans.use: to buy taro root, banana tube, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, and hand gloves.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de medicina natural su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su casa, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas medicina natural por mayor para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young man, whose face has been blurred in the photo because he is 28 years old and lives in a high-risk area, makes a living by selling natural medicines. His business is located close to his home. The young man lives in his own home with his family. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more natural medicines on wholesale in order to have better income.

loans.use: to buy more natural medicines on wholesale.

loans.name: Nancy Estamilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS, la socia Nancy Estamilda, la socia tiene 53 años de edad es casada y tiene 04 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de  snak cafetería, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia desea que su negocio cresca, la socia vende cafes, hamburguesas, gaseosas entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de tortas, gaseosas entre otros.
texts.en:
This member, Nancy Estamilda, belongs to the communal bank “Liderando las Palmeras.” The member is 53 years old, married, and has 4 children. She alternates her daily activities with her snack bar business. 

She is very thankful for the loan and she promises to make all of the established payments. She wants her business to grow. She sells coffee, hamburgers, and sodas, among other items. This is how she gets ahead.

She is requesting the loan to buy pastries and sodas, among other items.

loans.use: to buy pastries and sodas, among other items.

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es: Sonia de 35 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura siembra maíz, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, Sonia es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografia para poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en: Sonia is 35 years old and has made a living for several years in the agricultural growing of corn. She merchandises her products in different market places located close to her home. Sonia is a single mother who lives with her four children in her own home. She is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, and improve the land shown in the photograph so that she can continue her work.

loans.use: purchase of seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, and land improvement.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 55 years old and is married with 2 children. She earns a living with her pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

Editha has requested a 22,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Editha has been running her pig fattening business for 6 years now. Though, she also earns additional income from buying and selling sea cucumbers.

Editha is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. She is married and has an ambulant rice-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years now. 

Josephine has requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Rahila joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children, Emma, Mika, and Ruth.

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Rahila would have to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to her immediate cash needs to provide food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rahila can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Rahila spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Kolopa

texts.en:
Kolopa is 19 years old and has 1 child. She owns and operates a small business selling ice cakes in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years.

Kolopa has requested a loan to buy ice bags, a sack of sugar, a cooler, plastic bags, and containers to assist her in running the business. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business and provide for the family needs. 

Kolopa joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy ice bags, a sack of sugar, a cooler, plastic bags, and containers for her ice cake business.

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en:
Makerita is a 50-year-old mother of 2 children. She has a business selling sandwiches, sausages, and fried chicken in her community to earn a living.

Makerita has requested a loan to buy bread, a box of sausages, a box of chicken, vegetable oil, a frying pan, and containers to assist her in running the business. She will expand her business using her profits. 

Makerita became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy bread, a box of sausages, a box of chicken, vegetable oil, a frying pan, and containers for her business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia Gloria se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia hace paltos como pollo al horno, sopas entre otros, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar verduras, pollo y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Gloria continues to run her restaurant business. Through the success of this business, she wants to get ahead. The member makes dishes, like baked chicken and soups, among others. Gloria's dream is to expand her food sales business. She is requesting this loan to buy vegetables, chicken and meat.

Gloria is happy for the loan and promises to comply with her payments.

loans.use: buy vegetables, chicken and meat.

loans.name: Yushau

texts.en:
Yushau is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yushau would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yushau can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Yushau expressed a desire to use the extra income to provide his family with food and clothing and, in the long run, ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una pequeña escuela de computación ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 3 años, tiene muchos clientes por el buen trabajo que realiza, el joven vive en casa propia con sus padres, el esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar una pizarra mas grande y darle mantenimiento a las computadoras y asi poder continuar con su trabajo
texts.en: The young man has his face pixelated because he's 22 years old and lives in a high-risk area. For three years, he's run a small computer school located in his home. His many clients are the result of his good work. He lives in his own house with his parents. He's requesting a loan to buy a bigger chalk board and provide maintenance on the computers, so he can continue his work.

loans.use: buy a bigger chalk board and pay for the maintenance of the computers.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia  Luz Marina se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este pequeño negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia ya tiene varios años, el sueño de la socia es tener otra tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar,galletas, leche .


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Luz Marina is still making a living from her grocery store business. She sells products of basic need like rice, sugar, milk and crackers. She wants to get ahead by means of this small business that she's had for a number of years. Her dream is to have another grocery store. She is asking for the loan to buy rice, sugar, crackers and milk. She is happy about the loan and promises to comply with the loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, crackers and milk

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Mathew joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Zakka, Hosea, and Saminu. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Mathew would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs for purchasing items such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mathew can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Mathew spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay his children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
A 39-year-old married woman residing in the town of Mayorga, Leyte, Shirly and her husband have four children ranging in age from 18 years to three months old. Shirly has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store for three years, selling various commodities such as cooking oil, noodles, seasonings, bread, candies, soap, toothpaste, shampoo, etc.

Shirly is requesting a loan to buy additional stocks for the store such as canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and toiletries. These purchases will help attract more buyers to her shop. In this way, Shirly will slowly recover from her current situation to earn higher income and provide her growing children with good food and a quality education.

Shirly hopes that she can operate her business successfully for a sustainable livelihood in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for the store such as canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and toiletries

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar is a maize farmer from Kadanya Biyar village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Abubakar would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abubakar can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Abubakar, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Lida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Lida; la socia continua con el negocio de snack cafetería, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma continuar  apoyando el a su familia.
 La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar gaseosas, tortas entre otros.
 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member is part of the communal bank “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS”. The communal bank is located in the Cusco district of the province and department of the same name.

This member is Lida. She continues to run her snack bar/café business. She's had her business for a while now and it is going very well thanks to her determination every day. She hopes to continue working in order to continue supporting her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy soda, cake, among others.

Lida is grateful to those who take part in her dream by funding her loan and she pledges to make her payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: buy soda and cake, among others.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virgininia, a 61-year-old woman with two young dependents living with her, resides in Dulag, Leyte. She has been raising and selling hogs for more than 10 years now. To augment her income, she also fishes, selling her catch in the nearby community. 

Virginia has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy additional pigs  and to use as capital for a sari-sari (variety) store start-up. These will help Virginia earn a higher income.
  
In the future, Virginia would like to expand both businesses to support the education of her two dependents and have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs to raise capital for her sari-sari store start-up

loans.name: Hieng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hieng, born in 1969, is Thai ethnic woman. Her family consists of four members, including her husband, her two sons and her. Her family lives in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her eldest son is studying at a vocational school, and her second son is studying at high school.
	
Her family’s main income comes from breeding and cultivation, so it is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and save a small amount. But the saved amount is not enough to cover her two sons' education fees. Therefore, she wants to take out a loan to pay for her children’s education fees.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her children have better conditions for studying and have bright futures after graduation from school. And for herself, she will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s education fees

loans.name: Ya Group

texts.en:
Ya is a 40-year-old widowed rice farmer who lives in the Prey Veng province of Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice since 1992. She has three children, of which two of them are working as construction workers in a nearby country and the other attends school. Together, they can make 19 USD a day.

Now Ya would like to request a group loan for three members, and she will use her portion to build a latrine. This loan will provide her and her family with hygienic living conditions and keep the environment clean.

As for her plans, she is going to build a stall for selling vegetables, meat and fish at her house. Moreover, she is going to build a new house next year and send her youngest child to earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité LA ESPERANZA,  es un grupo muy unido, la integran 22 mujeres humildes y trabajadoras, pasaron al  segundo ciclo del programa de comités, y se encuentran muy emocionadas por poder formar parte de este programa. 
La señora Clementina es una de las miembros, se destaca por su laboriosidad, es muy guapa, cría animales en su casa, y ahora también piensa vender productos animales y vegetales en una feria que quiere montar junto con sus socias de comité.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar balanceados para sus animales, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo, luchando por crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
The committee named “La Esperanza” (The Hope) is a close-knit group that consists of 22 humble and hardworking women. They have reached their second loan cycle with the Committee Program and are very excited about being part of this program.

Sra. Clementina is one of the members who is known for her industriousness. She is a very lovely woman who raises animals at her house. Now she plans to sell animals and vegetables at a fair where she can gather with the other committee members.

Clementina is requesting a loan so that she can buy balanced feed for her animals. This will enable her to continue her work as before. She is also striving to grow and improve.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Sovann

texts.en:
Sovann is a 40-year-old married factory worker who lives in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. She has worked in a factory since 2001. Her husband is 31 years old and he works in a beer company. Both of them can make 11 USD per day. 

To make more income, Sovann has decided to secure a loan for her husband to buy beer from his company to sell to clients who need beer for guests at wedding receptions. This loan will help her husband improve her family’s finances. In the future, she is going to help to expand the business and save money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy beer to sell

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny, 42 years old, lives in a small community of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has three independent children who are currently in school. To make a living, he has been working as a teacher since 1999. On average, he is able to make an income of USD 4.00 per day.

The earning that he receives regularly from being a teacher is very low. He wants to have one more business as a supplementary income. However, his limited capital doesn't allow him to do so. That is why he is applying for a Kiva loan to use as capital investment to run a sell-and-buy battery business. This loan will allow him to have one more source of income which will help to remove poverty from his life. He is thankful to all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to run a sell-and-buy battery business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a married woman with five grown dependents. She lives in the town of Dulag, Leyte. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household commodities like biscuits, noodles, candies, eggs, cooking oil, shampoo, powdered milk, and other goods. It has already been ten years now that she has had her business.
She is asking for a loan to buy assorted groceries like soft drinks, canned goods, beverages, and seasonings. These stocks will fill her store back to its normal operation. Her earnings will increase, thus setting aside some savings for emergency purposes.
She is determine that she will be handling her current livelihood successfully in order to have a stable source of income and improve her family's status of living.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries like soft drinks, canned goods, beverages, and seasonings

loans.name: Chien's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chien, born in 1966, is a Thai ethnic woman. She currently lives with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her son is studying at a university.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and animal breeding, so it is just enough for food, with a small amount left to save. But the saved amount is not enough to pay her son’s education fees, and she wants to invest more in her son’s education. That’s why she wants to take out a loan to pay for and invest in her son’s education.

She expects that this loan amount will help her son have better conditions for studying and give him a brighter future. She will work hard to get money to repay M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to pay for and invest in her son’s education

loans.name: Duyen's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Duyen, born in 1964, is a Thai ethnic woman. She currently lives with her husband in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her two sons are married and live separately from their parents.

Her family lives mainly on cultivation, so their income after deducting all costs is just enough to cover their living expenses and save a small amount.  She wants to buy fertilizer for growing coffee, but she doesn’t have enough money. So she wants to take out a loan to invest in buying fertilizer for her coffee field.
	
She will work hard to get money to repay the loan on time to M7-MFI. She expects the loan will help her family have a bumper harvest and will improve their living conditions next year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Esperanza Y Progreso De La Zona B Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Esperanza Y Progreso De La Zona B” y está conformado por 08 socios comprometidos y responsables. Yngri de 37 años de edad es soltera. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su negocio y le va bien. Así mismo se siente feliz porque ha logrado captar más clientelas lo cual ha permitido mejorar sus ingresos. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de pantalones, polos, camisas y bivirís. El grupo “Esperanza Y Progreso De La Zona B” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Yngri es la cuarta del lado derecho y viste casaca azul.
texts.en:
This is the “Esperanza Y Progreso De La Zona B” group. It's comprised of 8 committed, responsible associates. Yngri is 37 years old and single. She sells clothing. With much effort, she has been able to improve her business and it's going well. She feels happy because she has been able to retain more customers, which has enabled her to increase her income. She is requesting a loan to buy pants, t-shirts, shirts and tank tops. 

The “Esperanza Y Progreso De La Zona B” group is grateful to those who make this loan possible. Yngri is the fourth woman on the right, wearing a jean jacket.

loans.use: buy pants, t-shirts,shirts and tank tops.

loans.name: Martaba

texts.ru: Мартаба, 45 лет, вдова, 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, уже много лет в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Мартабы на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы. На участке мерою 0,52 Га она выращивает кукурузу для внутрихозяйственного потребления и яблоневый сад. Также Мартаба работает продавцом в магазине. Ежемесячный доход Мартабы составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS), этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь, поэтому она решила развивать свой бизнес и обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 коров. Доходы от кредита Мартаба планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, она хочет накопить на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Martaba is 45 years old, a widow, and the mother of three children.  She has a secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture for many years already, two activities which provide her family with its main source of income.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently owns two cows.  She also grows corn on 0.52 hectare of land and has an apple orchard.  In addition to farming, she works as a saleswoman in a store.  She makes a monthly income of about 10,000 som (KGS), which is vastly insufficient for a decent living.  For this reason, she has decided to expand her business and has turned to Bai Tushum for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy three cows.  Martaba plans to reinvest the earnings from her loan to further increase her number of farm animals.  She also wants to save some money towards her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase three cows in order to boost her income.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Fifty-three-year-old Sherlita  engages in a food vending business. She sells ballot (a developing duck embryo that is boiled alive and eaten in the shell). It is commonly sold as street food in the Philippines. She also sells barbecued meat, chicken and hot dogs. She is married and has a 13-year-old daughter. Her husband earns an income by driving a habal-habal (a motorcycle used to transport passengers in remote areas).

Sherlita is asking for a loan to buy additional supplies like balot, meat, chicken and barbecue sauce. These supplies are essential in her day-to-day livelihood activity. With these, she will earn more, and will start to pay her loan and other obligations.

Sherlita would like to expand her business to fully recover and to have a stable source of income, as well as to finance the schooling of her child for a better future.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies, like balot, meat, chicken and barbecue sauce

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic commodities like biscuits, candies, cooking oil, seasonings, sugar, noodles, toiletries and soft drinks. She is a 64-year-old married woman with five grown children. She is from Dulag, Leyte, and has been operating a store for ten years already.

Maria has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase grocery items like beverages, canned goods, noodles and soft drinks. These goods will be very important in her store, attracting more customers and catering to various customers' needs. This will create high sales and start to improve her livelihood.

Maria would like to handle her business productively to have a stable source of income and better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, like beverages, canned goods, noodles and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more supplies, like bananas, sugar and bamboo sticks

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 34-year-old married man and a father of two children.

He is in the poultry farming business that he has been running for the past five years.

This is his first loan cycle with VIsionfund Kenya. He plans to use the profits to expand his farming business.

His future hopes are to grow the business and improve the living standards for his family.

loans.use: To buy poultry feeds.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis is a 33-year-old man married to Jane, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with two children. Dennis has been operating a welding business for a period of eight years, earning himself an income of 10,000 KES at the end of every month.

Dennis was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing his first loan of 30,000 KES. He intends to use this amount to buy an additional welding machine.

Dennis plans to use the anticipated extra income to open up a workshop business or a hardware shop. He hopes to become a successful businessman with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy an additional welding machine.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is grateful that she was granted a 50,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her General Store. She is glad that through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would like again to apply for a 50,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like sacks of rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, and other grocery items which she sells at retail. 

She expects a higher demand for groceries this Christmas Season. Aside from her store she also has a tourist boat for rent. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her. She wishes everyone a Blessed Christmas!

Evelyn dreams of having a Grocery Store. She desires for her children to complete their studies and become professionals someday. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 35 years old, married to Alex, and blessed with two school-going children. She has been in the tailoring business for the past 10 years and earns a monthly income of about KES 20,000.
	 		
She has applied for her second loan of 20,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy the latest fabric materials for making dresses to sell to her customers.                                                                                        

Nancy will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy the latest fabric materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabric and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en:
Isiyaku is a maize farmer from Kadanya Biyar village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Isiyaku can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Isiyaku, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hob Al- Watan Group

texts.en:
This group is called Hob Al- Watan. It consists of seven women from Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 260,000 YER from AMB.

Salma is the leader of the group. She is 45 years old, married with one child, living with her family in a humble house in Sana'a. 

In (2011), Salma established her humble business of making bread in her house with a small oven. She began her business to improve her miserable condition. Her husband gave her some money to start the business. 

She works hard in order to earn a good amount of money. She has a lot of customers because of her hot and delicious bread. 

In order to expand her business more, Salma applied for a loan in the amount of 50,000 YER from AMB. She requires a loan in order to buy flour, sugar, milk, and other ingredients that she needs to make traditional bread.

In the future, Salma hopes to build a shop. The loan will help her to generate more income and improve her family's standard of living. She is hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, milk and other ingredients that she needs to make traditional bread.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en:
Ayuba is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ayuba would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ayuba can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Ayuba is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family. He hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Puthyda

texts.en:
Puthyda is a 20-year-old freshman who is studying public administration at university. She is from Svay Reang province in Cambodia. 

Due to the fact that she is lacking finances to pay her university fees for four years, she would like to request a loan. With the loan she will be able to gain skills for her future job. 

After graduation, Puthyda is going to find a job and then save money to run her own business. She also wants to have her own house.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS, la socia Esther, la socia tiene 41 años de edad es soltera y tiene 02 hijos, la socia se dedica a su negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas,perfumes,colonias entre otros, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia vende sus productos a sus amistades,familiares,clientes entre otros, la socia desea que su negocio cresca,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de  colonias y cremas.
texts.en:
This member is part of the "LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS" communal bank. The member is Ester, she is 41 years old and is the single mother of 2 children. She sells beauty products, like creams, perfumes and aftershave, among others. This member is grateful for the loan and she pledges to make her payments in a timely manner. This member sells her products to her friends, family, clients and others. Ester wants her business to grow so she can move ahead with her family.

Ester is requesting this loan to buy aftershave and creams.

loans.use: buy aftershave and creams.

loans.name: Tần

texts.en:
Mrs. Tần is 54 years old and she is married with 6 children. Tần lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province, and works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

In 2013, Tần joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tần has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Tần faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

In the future, Tần hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic goods like noodles, bread, biscuits, seasoning, soap and canned goods. She is a 52-year-old married woman with four grown children from Dulag, Leyte. She has been operating a store for five years now. 

Gloria is asking for a loan to buy assorted groceries for the store, like soft drinks, beverages and canned goods. These will attract more customers to visit her store and purchase her goods. Slowly, her earnings will increase and she can now start to pay for household expenses and other obligations. 

Gloria would like to expand her business to have a sustainable livelihood in the future.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries, like soft drinks, beverages and canned goods

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 30-year-old woman and is married to Fredrick, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with four children. Joyce has been operating a fruit and vegetable stall for a period of ten years, earning herself an income of 8,000 KES at the end of every month.

Joyce was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her first loan of 20,000 KES. She intends to use this amount to buy cabbages, green vegetables, kale, and cereals to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Joyce plans to use the anticipated extra income to pay school fees to her children, and hopes to open a general cereals store in the near future.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, green vegetables, kale, and cereals to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Hoàn

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoàn works in agriculture, farming food. Hoàn is 26 years old and married with two children. She lives and works in Bim Son district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Hoàn has been involved in this business for five years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet. This is Hoàn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Hoàn hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Eniego

texts.en:
Eniego engages in operating a store. He sells various merchandise like coffee, sugar, cooking oil, shampoo, canned goods, and soft drinks. He is a 30-year-old married man with two young children, aged three and one.
Eniego is asking for a loan to purchase assorted grocery items for the store and piglets for a hog-raising start-up. He can now start operating his store and cater to the needs of his customers. He can now also start to raise hogs as supplemental income.
He hopes that someday, he will expand both of his businesses to be able to help his family improve its status of living and also support the needs of his young children.

loans.use: to purchase assorted grocery items for the store and piglets for a hog-raising start-up

loans.name: Tanui

texts.en:
Tanui is a 27-year-old man married to Gladys, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with three children.  Tanui has been selling mobile airtime cards for a period of three years, earning himself an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Tanui was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer, and is now servicing his first loan of KES 30,000. He intends to use this amount to buy mobile and telephone airtime cards to sell to his customers on a daily basis.

Tanui plans to use the anticipated income to open a mobile phone shop and hopes to become a successful business man with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy mobile and telephone airtime cards to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Nua Ngam 11 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lien is 29 years old and is the mother of two, a girl and a boy aged 10 and 12. She lives with her children in a small temporary house and has brought them up on her own, having been divorced from her husband for several years. She works very hard at agricultural production with plenty of activities to provide a sufficient life for her children. Indeed, she grows rice, corn, and cassava and breeds cow, pigs, and chickens. 

Mrs. Lien is complimented by other villagers for being hardworking, with constant investment to expand cultivation and animal husbandry as well as increase production. This is the sixth time she has taken out a loan from the ACE Program and she will use this loan to buy corn seeds to expand cultivation and increase corn yield. She hopes her investment will produce high earnings so that she can provide better for her children and gradually stabilize their life. 

Mrs. Lien dreams her children will study in a good university and have a good job to have a more abundant life. In the picture, she wears the red coat and stands first on the right.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds to expand cultivation and increase corn yield

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a cupboard for the house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new refrigerator to keep the ice cream in a cold condition.

loans.name: Chhon

texts.en: Chhon is a 27-year-old university student who is studying banking in the second year. He is from Siem Reap province in Cambodia. Previously, he worked as a credit officer at a micro finance. He resigned from there because the company required him to work in a far province that is far from his university. Nowadays, Chhon works as a cashier at a shopping mall in a city, earning USD 5 a day. He doesn’t have enough money, so he has decided to get a loan to pay his university fees for three years. With this loan, he will be able to graduate and have a chance to get a better job. For his dream, he wants to work in a private company.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Kanaiym

texts.ru: Канайым 49 лет, замужем, есть 4 детей. У Канайым среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Канайым и ее семьи, в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 20 овец. На участке мерою 1,5 Га собственной и 1,5 Га арендованной земли она выращивает эспарцет и фасоль. На ежедневной основе Канайым реализует молоко. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Канайым обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Канайым планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Kanaiym is 49 years old, married, and the mother of four children.  She has the equivalent of a high school education.  She works in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities which constitute her family's main source of income.  She started in this field 14 years ago when she purchased her first livestock for 10,000 som (KGS).  Kanaiym and her family have worked very hard over the years and they currently own two cows and 20 sheep.  Kanaiym also grows hay and beans on 1.5 hectare of leased land and 1.5 hectare of her own land.  She sells milk on a daily basis and makes a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to Bai Tushum for a loan of 65,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy 10 sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount.  She is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further increasing her number of farm animals.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep to increase her herd.

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Soeurn, who is 51 years old, lives in a community in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has only one child, who is currently employed as a garment factory worker. To support the family, Soeurn works very hard on her own rice farmland by growing and selling the crop to the local dealers and to customers in the market. On average, she is able to make an income of 2 USD a day.

As a supplementary income, she has come up with a new business idea. She wants to raise cows for sale. However, her insufficient capital doesn't allow her to do so. Therefore, she is applying for a Kiva loan to buy cows. She hopes that this new trade will help to improve her living standard. She is thankful to all the lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Srean

texts.en:
Srean, a 26-year-old single lady, lives with her three siblings and their parents in Kampong Cham Province. To make a living and support this poor family, she helps to manage and operate a farming business with her parents, growing rice and selling the crop to local dealers. So far, she has been involved in this type of business for almost ten years. She is able to make an income of 3 USD per day, on average.

Srean wants to improve her family's living condition by having a tuk tuk (a motorbike with a cart attached for carrying people) and driving her family members to serve customers in Phnom Penh City. Because of insufficient money, she is now applying for a Kiva loan to buy a tuk tuk. This loan will allow her family to have one more source of income, which helps to remove poverty from her life. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a tuk tuk

loans.name: Heun

texts.en:
Heun, 55, is a married woman from Kampong Speu Province. She has three single children who live under her support. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crops to the local dealers. So far, she has been involved in this career for more than thirty years. She is able to make an income of 2 USD per day, on average.  

Recently, some parts of her house have deteriorated and they need to be fixed to provide suitable living conditions for the household. Due to a lack of funds, Heun has applied for a Kiva loan via HKL to pay for her house renovation. She and her family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them improve their living standards.

loans.use: to pay for her house renovation

loans.name: No

texts.en:
No, 29, is a married woman from Kampong Speu Province. She has one child who is currently in school. To make a living, she is employed as a garment factory worker. So far, she has been involved in this career for one year. She is able to make an income of USD 7.00 per day, on average.  

Recently, some parts of her house have deteriorated and they need to be fixed to provide a suitable living for the household. Due to the lack of funds, she has applied for a Kiva loan via HKL to pay for her house renovation. She and her family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them with the loan funding to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her house renovation

loans.name: Thương

texts.en:
Mrs. Thương works in agriculture, farming food. Thương is 25 years old and she is married with no children. Thương lives in Dong Son district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. This is Thương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thương has been involved in this business for less than a year. The main hardship that Thương faces in her life is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

In the future, Thương hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Liên

texts.en:
Mrs Liên works in agriculture, farming food. Liên is 58 years old and is married with two children. Liên lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. This is Liên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Liên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, ha utilizado los financiamientos para seguir con el cultivo de granos básicos, la crianza de cerdos y ganado, además su actividad de destazo continua en el mercado, las circunstancias familiares están mejorando.
El nuevo crédito que solicita será de ayuda para comprar cerdos, alimento para los mismos y para el ganado, ello le da oportunidad tener mejores ingresos para subsistir, espera sacar el mejor provecho del préstamo.
texts.en:
Carmen has used the loans to continue cultivating basic grains, breeding pigs and cattle, and the work butchering the meat continues at the market. The circumstances at home are improving.

This loan he is requesting will be used to buy pigs, and pig and cattle feed, which will give him the opportunity to increase his income so he can live. He hopes to take full advantage of the loan.

loans.use: buy pigs and pig and cattle feed, which will give him the opportunity to improve his income so he can live.

loans.name: Rizalyn

texts.en:
Her name is Rizalyn and she is 21 years old and a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Jonel, a fisherman, and has one child who is still in the Preparatory Level of school. 

Rizalyn works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs.

Rizalyn operates a small variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. 

It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 200 a day. 

To help her improve her mini-store business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as sacks of rice, canned goods, noodles and other grocery stuff. 

Rizalyn expects an increase in her sales this Christmas season. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her. She hopes to grow her business so they could have a better life. 

She prays for a happy and victorious life in the Lord. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 31-year-old who is married to Edwin and blessed with two school-going children. She has been in the tailoring business for the past two years and earns a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 		
She has applied for her second loan of 15,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya, and intends to use the loan to buy the latest fabric materials for making dresses, which she will sell to her customers.                                                                                        

Esther will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy the latest fabric materials for making dresses.

loans.name: Saroen's Group

texts.en:
Saroen, 41, is married with eight children, one of whom is still in school. Her family lives in a rural area located in Steung Treng province’s Steung Treng district. 

The main sources of her family’s income are from planting cassava and working as paid workers to earn additional income. 

She has been running her business for 10 years, earning about KHR 43,000 per day, and she is able to save about KHR25,000 each day.
 
This is the first loan for Saroen’s group with VisionFund. As a group representative, she is now leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. 

Saroen is going to use her loan portion to buy fertilizers and seeds to support her cassava. She hopes to harvest more crops from her plantation so as to earn more income to support her family’s needs. 

Note: Both of the group members are female.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds to support her cassava.

location.town: Steung Treng Province, Steung Treng District

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Mrs. Aisha sells tomatoes in a market around Mpigi. She plans to user her loan to buy five 20 kg baskets of tomatoes that she will sell during this Christmas season. She has a steady customer following because of the high quality of her tomatoes and, this being Christmas season, the sales will be much bigger. She sells mainly to female customers and restaurants, for cash and on credit, out of her home and at the market.

Mrs. Aisha anticipates earning an average monthly revenue of 500,000 UGX, a part of which will be used to pay off her loan with interest and the rest to pay tuition for her children. She is hard working and looks forward to many more partnerships.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes to sell at the market.

loans.name: Kristina

texts.en:
Kristina is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of International and Business Law. Here is her story:

“I’m applying for Kiva loan because my family is not currently able to pay for my study at AUCA. We live in a small town, where most of the people have very low income.
