My father works as a driver in a van in a route Karakol-Bishkek-Karakol. Usually his work depends on the season and he works mostly during the summer, when people travel to the Issyk-Kul Lake. But when the season is over, he has the chance to drive once a week. 

My mother has a small business on the leased space in our town. The main problem is that the level of purchasing power of our citizens is extremely low, and trade is the main thing that Karakol people do. Our people don’t produce anything, and due to it there is an aggravation of competition and market overstocking of products. During the summer, when some tourists come to the town, she is able to sell more than she does in winter or in spring. 

I have two grandmothers who financially depend on my parents too. They are 78 and 80 years old. They have a small pension, which isn’t enough even for their food. We have to take care of them and they often need medicaments and doctor visits, which also lies on my parents.

My main goal is to get the high quality education in English, which AUCA provides. In fact, many AUCA Alumni are prosperous and have implemented their ideas into reality. But without a Kiva loan my family can’t afford my tuition fees, and my situation lets me count just on Kiva lenders.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 32-year-old married man and a father of two children. He lives with his family in a rented house in Hodeidah city, Yemen. He studied to the secondary level but couldn't complete his studies. 

Fadi has a small shop for repairing motorcycles in the middle of Hodeidah. He can't attract a lot of customers because he doesn't have enough equipment. Fadi has applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to purchase the necessary equipment to expand his business.

Fadi hopes to open another shop for repairing all kinds of cars and motorcycles.

loans.use: To purchase necessary equipment to expand his business

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en:
Vanny, 41, lives in a rural area of Steung Treng district of Steung Treng province. She is married with four dependent children who are still in school. 

To make a living, Vanny has been struggling to grow cassava since 2008. To supplement this income, she also runs a small business at home as a grocery seller. 

The current businesses earn about 15,000 KHR per day and she can save 7,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. 

Vanny group’s consists of two members who are just with VisionFund for this cycle. Vanny, who is the group leader, will use her loan portion to pay labor fees for plowing the cassava field. She hopes to grow more cassava as well as to harvest more crops so as to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay labor fees for plowing the cassava field.

location.town: Steung Treng Province, Steung Treng District

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy stock for her food shop

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy is a 20-year-old daughter of a farming family from Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. Her parents cultivate corn and beans for a living. 

Sophy is also a freshman who is studying accounting and is a finance major at a university in a city. Due to a lack of finances to pay her university fees for four years, she has decided to take out a loan. This loan will help her graduate successfully and earn skills to build her future.

For her dream, she wants to work as an accountant with a decent salary so she will be able to help her parents.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Chamroeun

texts.en:
Chamroeun, who is 41 years old, is living in a community of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has three children who live under his support. To support the family, he is working very hard on his own farmland by growing rice and selling the crop to the local dealers and customers in the market. 

The net profit that he can generate is USD 2.00 a day, on average. As a supplementary earning, he has come up with a new business idea. He wants to raise pigs for sale. However, his insufficient capital investment doesn't allow him to do so. Therefore, he is applying for a Kiva loan to buy pigs. He hopes that this new trade will help to improve his standard of living. He is thankful to all the lenders for their financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Phương

texts.en:
Phương is 44 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Phương works in agriculture farming food. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Phương faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom. This is Phương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Phương hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an amount of perfumes and incense to resell.

loans.name: Cường

texts.en:
Mr. Cường has a manufacturing business, making iron furniture. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. 

He is 31 years old and married with 1 child. He lives and works in a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. This is his first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

The main hardship that he faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment for repairing a latrine/toilet.

With his business profits, Cường hopes for his child to find a good job, for his business to do well, and for his family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment for repairing a latrine/toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Hải

texts.en:
Hải is 54 years old, and she is married with two children.
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.
In 2013, Hải joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hải has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Hải has been involved in her business for more than ten years.
The main hardship that Hải faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to repair her latrine/toilet.
With her business profit, Hải hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick to repair a latrine/toilet .

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 36 years old, married to Nelson, and blessed with two school-going children. She has been in the farming activity for the past 15 years and earns a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 		
She has applied for her first loan of 30,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs of fertilizers and seedlings.                                                                                        

Rose will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Bahte

texts.en:
Bahte lives in the western part of Kosovo where her husband works in a bakery for a low salary. She is a mother of four children who makes a living by making handicrafts from her home for wedding celebrations and special occasions. She has been in business for more than ten years now and has been able to continuously contribute her profit to her family’s budget. She has always felt proud to be able to earn for her family while also caring for her home and family. 

For the first time, Bahte is requesting a loan in order to purchase materials for her work in order to meet the demands and orders of all of her customers. The loan will help her to be able to continue her business, hopefully to even expand and open her own workshop. She really appreciates all of the Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her business

loans.name: Noong Het 10 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa, 26, is a young Thai lady who has been married and has a son who is the age of 6. She lives happily with her husband and her child, along with her niece (who was abandoned after the parents got divorced), in a traditional Thai house. They rely on agricultural production for a living, including growing rice, raising chickens, pigs and musk ducks. 

Mrs. Hoa has constantly increased production through investment. This is the 3rd time she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program, and she will use it to buy piglets due to the success of the investment in pigs from the previous loan. She believes the investment will go well and she will gain high profit, especially with a great deal of support from ACE staff with regard to agricultural training and technical counseling. 

Mrs. Lien dreams her son and her niece will escape from poverty and have a bright future. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Thao's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thao, born in 1991, is a Thai ethnic woman. She lives with her husband and her lovely daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province. 
Her family lives mainly on cultivation and breeding, so the income is just enough for food and to save a little amount. But the saved amount is not enough to buy fertilizer for the coming coffee season. That’s why she wants to borrow a loan to buy fertilizer for coffee.
She will work hard to earn money to repay the loan to M7-MFI on time, and she expects the loan can help her family invest effectively in her coffee field.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for coffee

loans.name: Godard

texts.en:
Godard is 38 years old and married, with three children and two dependents. He  is a teacher by profession. Godard is an agriculturalist who deals in banana growing. He owns three hectares of banana plantation in his region. Godard has managed to look after his family through income from the sale of bananas from his farm. 

He is applying for a loan of UGX 5,000,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and tools for farm extension. His major challenge is banana wilt, which attacks his plantation, hence leading to poor quality of banana output to meet the demands of his customers. 

Godard's dream is to be the leading supplier of bananas in his region, producing 1000 bunches of banana every week. He is honest and hardworking and thanks the Kiva lenders for the generosity.

loans.use: Tpo buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Javier Amilcar

texts.es: Javier de 44 años de edad se dedica desde hace 20 años a la crianza de ganado, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde reside, Javier vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de una vaca para continuar con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Javier, age 44, has been raising livestock for 20 years.  He sells his products in the areas surrounding where he lives.  Javier lives in his own house with his wife and their two children.

He is requesting a loan to buy a cow in order to continue with his work.  This way he will have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Amena

texts.en:
Amena is a 27-year-old divorced mother of one child who has worked as a hairdresser for three years to cover the needs and expenses of her beloved kid. She is the breadwinner of her family and she is trying hard to develop her business and improve her family's living conditions, thus today she is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of beauty cosmetics and buy hair tools to facilitate her work and provide her customers with better service.

Amena hopes to open her own beauty salon in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of beauty cosmetics and buy hair tools to provide her customers with better service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep for his barn

loans.name: Savin

texts.en:
Savin, 44, is a married woman from Kampong Speu province. She has one single child who lives under her support. To make a living, she operates a farming business growing rice. She sells the crops to local dealers. So far, she has been involved in this career for four years. She is able to make an income of USD 2.00 per day, on average.  

Recently, some parts of her house have deteriorated, and they need to be fixed to provide a suitable living for the household. Due to lack of funds, she has applied for a Kiva loan via Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) to pay for her house renovation. She and her family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them by funding the loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to pay for her house renovation

loans.name: Virgen Purificada De Tupac Amaru Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA DE TUPAC AMARU”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Delia ella es soltera y tiene 40 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes , la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere que sus hijos terminen de estudiar y asi que sus hijos salgan adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche,galletas, azúcar, aceite y arroz.
 

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Virgen Purificada De Tupac Amuru communal bank.  This bank is located in the Urcos district, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department.

Delia, age 40, is single and has four children.  She works in her business, a grocery store.  She sells basic needs products like rice, sugar, milk, and cooking oil.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m.  It is through this business that she wants her children to finish their education.  This way her children will get ahead.  

Her dream is to expand her grocery store business.  She is requesting the loan to buy milk, cookies, sugar, cooking oil, and rice.

The other members devote themselves to the businesses of selling handicrafts, selling clothes, a grocery store, and selling animals.  

Delia is grateful to those who form part of this dream through these means.  She pledges to make her payments according to the established timeframe.

loans.use: to buy milk, cookies, sugar, cooking oil, and rice.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a 42-year-old woman married to John, who adds additional income to their family, and they are blessed with two children.

Nelly has been operating a timber sales business for a period of four years earning herself an income of 10,000 KES at the end of every month.

Nelly was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her first loan of 30,000 KES.  She intends to use this amount to buy additional timber to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Nelly plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: to add additional timber to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ngọc

texts.en:
Mr. Ngọc works in agriculture, growing/farming food. He has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Ngoc is 30 years old and he is married with 1 child. 

He lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. This is his first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Ngọc faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build a toilet and bathroom.

With his business profit, Ngọc hopes to maintain a successful business, for his business to do well, and for his family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Sáu

texts.en:
Mrs. Sáu operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. Sáu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is 52 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Sáu's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Sáu faces in her life is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build a toilet and bathroom.

With her business profits, Sáu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Chiến

texts.en:
Mrs. Chiến works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Chiến is 48 years old and she is married with four children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Chiến's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Chiến has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Chiến faces in her life is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Chiến hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Chung

texts.en:
Mrs. Chung operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. Chung is 48 years old and married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Chung's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Chung has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Chung faces in her life is not having money to build a toilet. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Chung hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build toilet.

loans.name: Shukri

texts.en:
Shukri comes from the Roma community. As with most families in the Roma community, Shukri’s family lives in very poor and terrible conditions. He is the father of four children between the ages of two and eight years old, with three of them currently attending school. In order to support his family, he works in construction, however his salary is very low and since his wife stays home to care for the home and the children, he is the main source of income. 

The house that they live in is very old and in need of renovations in order to be more livable and a healthier environment. The children are often ill and it becomes difficult to provide the proper health care and treatments to them, especially in the winter. Now, they have decided to improve their conditions to address this issue and take care of their health. He promises to pay on time and appreciates the support.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Retaj Al- Baydah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Retaj Al- Baydah. It consists of four women from Hodeidah city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB.
Neamah is a 35 years old with three children. The oldest one is a 19 years old and the youngest one is 8 years old. She is the leader of the group. Neamah works selling ice cream in the streets. The income from this humble business is small. She wants to buy ingredients to make ice cream to sell, but her income doesn't enable her to do that. Therefore, she will use her portion of the loan to purchase flour, sugar, and tangs to make ice cream to sell.
Neamah hopes to open a small shop to sell sweets in her area.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, and tangs to make ice cream to sell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan vive en la casa de sus suegros, Juan tiene dos hijos varones, uno de 4 años y el otro de 5 Juan es chofer de minibus desde hace 3 años, la esposa de Juan atiende un cafe internet Juan quiere un credito para la reparacion del motor de su minibus ya que en estos ultimos meses sus ingresos disminuyeron por  problemas mecanicos en su motor, muchas veces el vehiculo paraba y Juan tardaba mucho en hacerlo arrancar por lo que tenia que devolver los pasajes de los pasajeros  Juan agradece toda la ayuda que puedan enviarle
texts.en: Juan lives in the house of his parents-in-law. He has two male children, one is 4 and the other is 5. Juan has been a minibus driver for 3 years. His wife looks after an internet café. He wants a loan to repair the engine on his minibus, because in these last few months, his income decreased due to mechanical problems in his engine. Many times the vehicle would stop, and it would take Juan a long time to turn it back on, so he had to return the ticket money to the passengers. Juan is grateful for any help you can give him.

loans.use: to repair the engine on his minibus.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep for his barn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep for his barn.

loans.name: Jeandark

texts.en: Jeandark is a 46-year-old Lebanese woman. She is married and living with three kids and her husband, who has his own business. He is the main income source for the family. As for her, she has been working as a private teacher since 2008. With the loan she requested from Kiva's partner Vitas. s.a.l., she wants to purchase a laptop to extend her background and make her preparations easier to complete.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop to extend her background and make her teaching preparations easier to complete.

loans.name: Jaime Cecilio

texts.es: jaime de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su tres hijos, el se dedica desde hace 4 años a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maiz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas y mejorar el terreno para poder obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jaime, age 36, lives in his own house with his three children.  He has been farming for four years.  His mains crops are corn and beans.  He sells his products in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, and pesticides and to improve the land in order to be able to get better earnings.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, and pesticides and to improve the land.

loans.name: Hùng

texts.en:
Mr. Hùng works in agriculture, farming food. He has been involved in this business for more than 10 years

Hùng is 55 years old and he is married with 2 children. He lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hùng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Hùng faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build a toilet and bathroom.

With his business profit,  Hùng hopes to maintain a successful business, for his business to do well, and for his family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Hương

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. Hương is 26 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hương has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Hương faces in her life is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom.

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom

loans.name: Hương

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương has a service business shipping goods. Hương is 43 years old and married with two children. Hương lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2003, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid more than 10 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hương has been involved in this business for seven years. The main hardship that Hương faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom.

In the future, Hương hopes to maintain  a successful business, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom

loans.name: Bobomurot

texts.ru: Бобомурот мужчина 35 лет , женат , молодой и счастливый отец троих детей. Его детские годы прошли в селе,где он и проявил любовь к природе и работе на поле.Бобомурот окончив школу не смог поступить в ВУЗ,так как в то время его мать была больна и ей требовалась операция.Вместо подготовки к экзаменам Бобомурот работал на стройке,помогал родителям.В возрасте 25 лет он женился и остался жить с родителями.Сейчас на своем участке земли он ухаживает за крупным рогатым скотом.Во всех его делах помогает ему жена и старший сын.Его жена каждое утро доит коров и относит молоко на рынок для продажи.Бобомурот трудолюбивый и терпеливый мужчина,работает не покладая рук,чтобы обеспечить своих детей всем необходимым.Он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой,чтобы увеличить поголовье своего стада и закупить корм для скота.Бобомурот заранее благодарит МДО Арванд за помощь и доверие.
texts.en:
Bobomurot is 35, married, and a young, happy father of three children.  He spent his childhood years in a village where he showed a love for nature and farm work.  Bobomurot wasn't able to go to college after finishing secondary school as his mother was sick at the time and needed an operation.  Instead of preparing for exams, Bobomurot worked in construction and helped his parents.  At the age of 25, he got married and continued to live with his parents.  Currently, he raises cattle on a plot of land of his own, and is helped in everything by his wife and oldest son.  Every morning, his wife milks their cows and takes the milk to a marketplace to sell.  

Bobomurot is a hardworking and patient man who toils away to provide his children with all the necessities of life.  He's turned to MDO Arvand for financial assistance so he can increase the headcount of his herd and stock up on cattle feed, and would like to thank them in advance for their trust and support.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Biên

texts.en:
Biên is 25 years old and he is married with one child. He lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Biên works in agriculture farming food. He has been involved in this business for two years.

The main hardship that Biên faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet. This is Biên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With his business profit, Biên hopes to maintain a successful business, for his family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for his business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 35-year-widow with 4 children and 3 additional dependents. She has a retail trade business and also does agriculture.

She is an agriculturalist who deals in banana and coffee growing. Grace owns a 3 hectare banana plantation and a 3 hectare coffee plantation in her region. She has managed to look after her family as a single parent providing the basic necessities. 

Grace is applying for a loan of 4,000,000 UGX to buy fertilizers for her coffee and banana plantations. She also wants to buy more stock for her business in order to meet her client’s demands.

Her major challenge is raising the family as a single parent where all their needs are supposed to be met by her because she is a widow. She wants to see all her children get a formal education and graduate from Universities.

Grace is an honest and hardworking woman and is grateful for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of thread to make hammocks and clothing garments, to offer new products to her clients.

loans.name: Denis Esther

texts.es: Denis es una emprendedora mujer de 34 años de edad, madre de una niña de 11 años y un niño de 3 años de edad, se encuentra domiciliada en un barrio ubicado al sur occidente de Barranquilla, en donde funciona su negocio de elaboración y venta de almuerzos.  Este negocio es una herencia familiar, su madre siempre se dedicó a esta actividad y fue de quien aprendió, hoy en día cuenta con 10 años de experiencia y con una clientela estable, sus productos son ofrecidos en su local comercial, su horario laboral es de 9 a.m. a  3 p.m. de lunes a sábado y tiene una carta muy variada; sopas, arroces, carnes y ensaladas mixtas.  Sus compras de insumos las realiza de contado en Granabastos y Barranquillita, en la actualidad ella está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual invertirá en los insumos necesarios para la preparación de sus comidas, como arroz, aceite, sal, aderezos, carnes, verduras y frutas.  Esta inversión proporcionará mayores utilidades a su negocio por lograr ampliar la cobertura de clientes. La gran meta familiar de Denis es tener casa propia por eso ella trabaja con tanta motivación y dedicación.
texts.en:
Denis is an enterprising woman, age 34.  She is the mother of a little girl, age 11, and a little boy, age 3. She lives in a neighborhood that is located southwest of Barranquilla, where she has her business preparing and selling lunches.

This business is a family legacy, as she learned it from her mother who always had this occupation; and today she has ten years’ experience and steady customers. She offers her products in her local market, working from 9:00 A.M. to 3:00 P.M. Monday to Saturday.  She has a very varied menu that includes soups, rice dishes, meats, and mixed salads.  She purchases her supplies in Granabastos and Barranquillita.

She is applying for a Kiva loan. It is the first loan that she is receiving from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and she will invest it in the supplies that she needs for preparing her dishes—rice, oil, salt, seasonings, meats, vegetables, and fruit.  

This investment will bring her business higher profits, as she will be able to serve more customers.  

Denis’ great goal for her family is to have a house of her own; that is why she works with such motivation and dedication.

loans.use: to invest in the supplies that she needs for preparing her dishes, such as rice, oil, salt, seasonings, meat, vegetables, and fruit.

loans.name: Thuận

texts.en:
Thuận is 41 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Thuận works in agriculture farming food. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

In 2008, Thuận joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thuận has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Thuận faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Thuận hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Umoja Wetu Group

texts.fr: Siherya est commerçante, trésorière du groupe solidaire «Umoja Wetu», client de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un hôtelier, âgée de 49 ans, mère 9 enfants dont 3 étudient et 6 ont fini leurs études. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est propriétaire d’une quincaillerie sur la route principale de la ville depuis 6 ans. Elle va acheter des ciments, tuyaux, vannes, ficelles etc. Elle souhaite accroitre son chiffre d’affaire, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Siherya is a shopkeeper and is treasurer of Umoja Wetu Group, clients of the MFI [microfinance institution] Hekima. She is married to a hotelier, 49 years old, and the mother of nine children, three of whom attend school and six of whom have finished their studies. She started her business with funds received from her husband.

Siherya has been the proprietor of a hardware store on the town's main road for six years. She is going to purchase cement, pipes, valves, string, etc. She wishes to expand her business, and to educate and feed her children. Siherya would like to close by thanking Hekima for their support of entrepreneurs who lack access to finance through the traditional banking system.

loans.use: To purchase cement, pipes, valves, string, etc.

loans.name: Tằn

texts.en:
Mrs. Tằn works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is 57 years old and is married with 3 children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Tằn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tằn has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Tằn faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet. With her business profit, Tằn hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Dũng

texts.en:
Dũng is 53 years old and he is married with 2 children. He lives and works in the Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Dũng operates a food stall/restaurant selling meat. Dũng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

This is Dũng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main hardship that Dũng faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With his business profit, Dũng hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, for his children to find a good job, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is a 49-year-old married mother of seven children who works in Al Hojama, a cupping therapy that applies suction to rid the body of toxins through the use of cup glasses. It can be done in two ways: wet or dry cupping. It is an ancient medical method that was used for the treatment of many diseases. She has been doing this for fifteen years to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their beloved kids. At the beginning, Al Hojama wasn't familiar to the people in her region, but throughout the years she succeeded with her ambition and hardwork to gain loyal customers. May is always trying to develop her business and provide her family with better living conditions, thus today she is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to settle the remaining payments of her car and register it.
May hopes to open her own Al Hojama center in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to settle the remaining payments of her car and register it

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 28 years old. He is not married.  He is a farmer and has been farming for two years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers of beans and maize for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and buy food for home consumption. 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37 percent of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65 percent of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90 percent of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers of beans and maize for sale.

loans.name: Aigerim

texts.en:
Aigerim is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Economics. Here is her story:

“American University of Central Asia is a big chance for me to have a prospective future. Unfortunately, thousands of students can’t afford to study here themselves. Several years ago I began to learn English in depth and made an aim to do my best in order to enter AUCA. I have heard a lot of positive comments about this university and I am proud of the fact that it is situated in Kyrgyzstan, so it gives a lot of possibilities to our citizens to build a successful future.

I really want to study at AUCA, but the tuition fee is too high for my family, so that is why I need a Kiva loan. There are four children in my family, but my father is the only breadwinner in it. As my mother always used to be a housewife in order to look after us and pay more attention to our studies, she has never worked and has never got a salary. Thanks to her, I and all my siblings are well educated, and I was able to be one of the best school-leavers that received an honor certificate. With that certificate I was welcome to enter any university in Kyrgyzstan, but my dream was and is a degree from AUCA.

AUCA has progressive methods of educating, brilliant teachers and well-equipped labs and library. It will open a lot of doors of the best companies in the world for me, help me to join with my leadership skills and make me self-confident.

Thanks to the Kiva loan, I will gain my dream to be the prospective person and will serve as a good example for my other three siblings.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Sitani

texts.en:
Sitani is 53 years old. He is married with 5 children aged between 10 and 23 years, and both attend school.

He is a farmer and has been farming for 20 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers of maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers of maize to sell

loans.name: Maswabirina Group

texts.fr: Mulemeri est commerçante, présidente du collectif de crédits «Maswabirina», client de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un boucher, âgée de 43 ans, mère 8 enfants dont 4 étudient et 4 mariés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse de divers habits dans l’avenue du centre commercial de la ville depuis 25 ans. Elle va acheter de tissus dames et habits enfants. Elle  souhaite accroitre son chiffre d’affaire, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Mulemer is a shopkeeper and is president of Maswabirina Group, clients of the MFI [microfinance institution] Hekima. She is married to a butcher, 43 years old, and the mother of eight children, four of whom attend school and four of whom are married. Mulemer started her business with funds she received from her husband.

Mulemer has been selling various clothing on a street in the town's business district for 25 years. She is going to purchase ladies' fabrics and children's clothing. She wants to expand her business, and educate and feed her children. Mulemer would like to close by thanking Hekima for their support of entrepreneurs who lack access to finance through the traditional banking system.

loans.use: To purchase ladies' fabrics and children's clothing.

loans.name: Sahara Group

texts.en:
Gambhariguda is a remotely located rural village situated about 100 kilometers from the district headquarters of Nuapada in Odisha, India. In November 2014, ten active women from this village formed a Self-Help Group (SHG) named Sahara and approached Mahashakti Foundation to access a loan for expansion of their existing businesses.

Saubhagya, the 40-year-old cheerful lady sitting with a raised hand in the photo, is one of them. She lives with her husband and three children. Her elder son is doing his higher education in a private college 100 kms. away. The other two children are doing their schooling in the local school.

The main business of Saubhagya is vegetable cultivation and vending. She has been doing this business for the last ten years with the help of her husband. Her husband is a hardworking man who manages her cultivation farm. Traders from the nearest towns come to her farm for vegetables. She grows all types of vegetables such as tomatoes, brinjal, cabbages, chilies, radishes, etc. Now she is earning a monthly income of 6,000 INR. With this income, Saubhagya is managing her family expenses anyhow, but facing financial trouble for the educational expenses of her children.

When Mahashakti Foundation started working in that area, Saubhagya, along with nine other members of the Self-Help Group, approached Mahashakti Foundation and accessed a loan. With her 16,000 INR portion, Saubhagya is planning to pay the coaching fees of her son, and a small portion will be invested in purchasing seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for the cultivation farm.

Saubhagya hopes to save enough for the better education of her children and establish a private school in the future.

The other nine members of the group are managing general store, carpentry work, and vegetable cultivation businesses.

loans.use: to pay the coaching fees of her son and to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide for vegetable cultivation.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: Adolfo de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica desde hace varios a la siembra de maíz,  elotes, berenjenas y güisquil, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados, Adolfo esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de controles de plagas, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, etc. ya que le ha ido muy bien con las siembras y con las ventas últimamente y asi seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Adolfo, 52, lives in his own house with his wife.  He has been growing corn, eggplant, and chayote for several years, selling his produce in different markets.

Adolfo is requesting a loan once again.  It is for the purchase of pest control, fertilizer, compost, seed, etc., as his harvest and sales have gone well for him lately, so he will continue with his work.

loans.use: to purchase pest control, fertilizer, compost, seed, etc.

loans.name: Đức

texts.en:
Đức is 29 years old and is married with 2 children. Đức lives in the Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Đức operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. Đức has been involved in this business for 5 years.

This is Đức's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns him is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With his business profit, Đức hopes for his business to do well, for his children to find a good job, and for his family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Epa Faraja Group

texts.fr: Bakungu est une commerçante et membre d’un groupe d’affaires «EPA Faraja», entrepreneuse, âgée de 39 ans, mariée à un fonctionnaire de l’Etat et mère de 4 enfants tous étudient. La cliente est une vendeuse des fournitures scolaires. Elle étale sa marchandise dans une papeterie de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu son mari. Il y a 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter des cahiers, stylos, écritoires, gommes, ardoises, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneuses non bancables.
texts.en:
Bakungu is a shopkeeper and a member of EPA Faraja Group. She is a 39-year-old businesswoman, married to a government employee, and the mother of four children who all attend school.

Bakungu sells school supplies. She displays her merchandise in a stationery shop in town. She started her business with funds received from her husband, and has been running this business for 10 years. This new loan will allow her to purchase notebooks, pens, writing cases, erasers, slates, etc. By [selling them,] she wants to purchase a small plot of land and pay her children's school fees. Bakungu would like to close by sincerely thanking Hekima for empowering women entrepreneurs who lack access to finance through the traditional banking system.

loans.use: To purchase notebooks, pens, writing cases, erasers, slates, etc.

loans.name: Utaratibu Group

texts.fr: Madame MBILIZI est mariée à un homme sans emploi et mère de 4 enfants tous écoliers. Elle est présidente du groupe UTARATIBU à l’âge de 46 ans. Elle s’occupe de la vente des sandales pour hommes depuis 2007 au marché central de la place. Elle vient sollicter un prêt qui permettra d’acquérir un ½ sac de sandales usagées pour hommes. Malgré la mévente en cette période de pluie, elle compte devenir une vendeuse grossiste. Elle remercie HEKIMA de tout cœur.
texts.en: Mrs. Mbilizi is married to a man who is unemployed and is the mother of four children, all students. She is Utaratibu Group's leader and is 46 years old. Mrs. Mbilizi has been selling men's sandals in the central market since 2007. She is seeking a loan that will allow her to acquire a half sack of used men's sandals. Despite the [usual] slump in sales during the rainy season, she plans to become a wholesaler. Mrs. Mbilizi thanks Hekima with all her heart.

loans.use: To purchase a half sack of used men's sandals.

loans.name: Relampago Group

texts.es:
Pertenecer a una comunidad pequeña, alegre, rodeada de plantaciones de caña y contar con la presencia de World Vision  es lo que hace sentir contentos a los habitantes de la localidad. El grupo "Relámpago" cumple su segundo ciclo en VisionFund y el nombre lo eligieron por la rapidez con que se les otorgan los préstamos. Los integrantes son:

Elba - Venta De Postres, Servilletas Y Tamales.
Rolando - Venta De Abarrotes
Delfina - Venta De Mercería
Rogelia - Venta De Pollo, Cosméticos Y Frituras.
Maricruz - Venta De Comida
Judith - Venta De Perfumes
Lucia - Venta De Refrescos
Olga - Venta De Gelatinas
Agueda - Venta De Perfumes
Emilia - Venta De Refrescos Y Perfumes
Virginia - Venta De Refrescos

Doña Elba es una persona carismática, emprendedora, alegre y trabajadora, desde hace 17 años formó una familia con el señor Pedro quien trabaja en el campo cortando caña, son padres 1 adolescente y dos niños, uno de ellos patrocinado por World Vision. Los tres continúan estudiando y Elba trabaja para que esta situación no cambie.

Hace 6 años Doña Elba acudió a varios cursos de repostería donde aprendió a elaborar, pasteles, gelatinas, flan, carlotas y otros postres. Des esta manera, hace 4 años se animó a iniciar un negocio vendiendo pasteles por pedido así como gelatinas y flan todos los días desde su hogar. Además Elba borda y teje servilletas para vender en la misma comunidad y los fines de semana hornea y vende tamales rancheros. Lo más importante para ella es generar ganancias para el beneficio de su familia; con su ingreso puede apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y reinvierte en todo el material necesario para continuar con sus actividades.

Elba sueña con poner una pequeña pastelería más no lo ha podido lograr, recientemente su esposo enfermó y tuvo que dejar de trabajar como taxista, además sufrieron una pérdida familiar, mas eso no ha sido impedimento para que ella siga adelante “Sé que las cosas cambiaran lo que más me preocupa es mi familia y mientras estemos unidos todo se puede superar”. 

Con el préstamo que está solicitando, Elba quiere comprar harina, huevos, saborizante, grenetina, duraznos y gas debido a que sus clientes le han solicitado tres pasteles. “Gracias por brindarnos esta oportunidad para con el ir cumpliendo poco a poco cada uno de nuestros sueños”.

*Algunas integrantes del grupo en la fotografía muestran cosméticos de los que comercializan, Doña Elba viste una playera color azul marino.
texts.en:
To belong to a small, cheerful community, surrounded by cane farms, and to count with the presence of World Vision, is what makes the local citizens feel happy. The group “ Relámpago” is on its second cycle with VisionFund, and they chose the name because of the speed with which loans are granted. The members are:
Elba: sale of desserts, napkins, and tamales. 
Rolando: grocery sales 
Delfina: haberdashery sales 
Rogelia: sale of chicken, cosmetics, and fried food
Maricruz: food sales
Judith: perfume sales
Lucia: soda sales
Olga: Gelatin sales
Agueda: perfume sales
Emilia: sodas and perfume sales 
Virginia: soda sales 
Elba is a charismatic, entrepreneurial, cheerful, and hard-working. Seventeen years ago she formed a family with Pedro, who works in the field, cutting cane. They are the parents of one teenager and two children, one of them is sponsored by WorldVision. The three continue to study and Elba works so that this situation won’t change. 
Six years ago, Elba went to several baking courses, where she learned to make cakes, jelly, flan, carlotas (a dessert made with cookies, sugar, and fresh fruit), and other desserts. In this way, 4 years ago she found the motivation to open a business to sell made-to-order cakes, as well as jelly and flan every day in her home. On top of that, Elba sews and knits napkins to sell in the same community, and on weekends she bakes and sells ranchero-style tamales. What is most important for her is to generate income for the benefit of her family. With her income she can help her husband with the household expenses, and reinvest in all the necessary material to continue with her activities. 
Elba dreams with setting up a small bakery, but she hasn’t been able to do this. Recently, her husband got ill and he had to stop working as a cab driver, and they also suffered the loss of a family member. But this has not been an obstacle for her to keep getting ahead. “I know things will change, what worries me most is my family, and while we are together, we can face anything.”
With the loan that she is requesting, Elba wants to buy flour, eggs, flavoring, gelatin, peaches, and gas, because her clients have asked for three cakes. “Thank you for bringing us this opportunity, with it we can reach, little by little, one of our dreams.”

*Some of the members of the group in the photograph show the makeup that they sell. Elba is wearing a navy blue shirt.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, flavoring, gelatin, peaches, and gas.

location.town: ARROYO DE ENMEDIO, ACATLAN DE PEREZ FIGUEROA

loans.name: Mulangane Group

texts.fr: La cliente KAMWENDA, mère de 9 enfants tous écoliers et marié à un sans emploi, est présidente du groupe MULANGANE. Elle est vendeuse des produits divers à son domicile, il y a une longue période grâce au premier fonds reçu de IMF HEKIMA. Elle vient de solliciter un nouveau pret pour acheter 5 bidons d’huile et autres produits divers. Son vœu est de payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants et agrandir son entreprise. Elle remercie et bénit HEKIMA pour son soutien indéfectible.
texts.en: Kamwenda, the mother of nine children, all students, and married to an employed man, is the leader of Mulangane Group. She began selling various goods from her home a long time ago thanks to the first loan she received from the MFI [microfinance institution] Hekima. She is seeking a new loan to purchase five containers of oil and other various goods. Her wish is to pay her children's school fees and expand her business. Kamwenda thanks and blesses Hekima for their unflagging support.

loans.use: To purchase five containers of oil and other various goods.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients for her food stall

loans.name: Silveria

texts.es:
Silveria es una mujer de 38 años de edad, casada, tiene 5 hijos de 18, 15, 11, 8 y 1 años, y su negocio es la producción de queso artesanal.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, constante, emprendedora, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la comunidad ‘Karhuiza’ caracterizado por su cercanía al lago Titicaca, área agrícola dónde se cría ganado; vacuno, ovino y camélido, se vive de la pesca y también de cereales y vegetales del lugar, como la quinua, chuño, haba, papa, etc. caracterizada por el clima frío, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 1-12 grados centígrados y donde los rayos solares golpean con mucha fuerza la superficie.
Silveria es de tez morena, baja estatura, ojos obscuros, cabello negro largo trenzado, su vestimenta es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura, sus hijos mayores estudian en la escuela y el menor es bebe, viven en una casa construida de ladrillo con techo de calamina que cuenta con los servicios de electricidad y agua de pozo. Su trabajo es la elaboración y venta de queso artesanal; la variedad de quesos más producida y consumida, es el queso fresco, el quesillo, el queso doble crema, y el chaqueño, “nuestro problema más común es la escases de leche en temporada de invierno, hace que el precio del queso suba porque la leche es escasa…” comenta. Su sueño es producir cantidades mayores, ella desea realizar la compra de ganado lechero para producir mayor cantidad de leche para su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 18 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Silveria solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero para incrementar su producción de quesos.
texts.en:
Silveria is a 38-year-old woman, married, she has five children who are 18, 15, 11, 8 and 1, and her business is the production of artisanal cheese.
She is a good mother, independent, diligent, entrepreneurial, responsible, and hard-working. She does her business in the community ‘Karhuiza,’ characterized by its proximity to lake Titicaca, an agricultural area where cattle is raised: bovine, ovine, and llamas. People make a living fishing and also with the grains and vegetables of the place, such as quinoa, potatoes, beans, etc. It is characterized by its cold climate, with a temperature that varies throughout the day between 1-12 degrees centigrade and where solar rays reach the surface with a lot of strength. 
Silveria is brown-skinned, has short height, dark eyes, braided long black hair, her dress is traditional (hat, shawl, and pleated skirt), her mother tongue is Aymará, and she speaks Spanish as general culture and because of her business. She shares her life with her husband, who works in agriculture, her older children go to school, and the young one is a baby. They live in a house made of brick with an iron roof which has electricity services and water from a well. Her work is the making and sale of artisanal cheese. The most produced and consumed cheese varieties are fresh cheese, small cheese (sweet rennet curd), double cream cheese, and chaqueño cheese (semi-hard and ripened). “Our most common problem is the scarcity of milk during the winter season, it causes the price of cheese to rise because the milk is scarce…” she says. Her dream is to produce larger quantities, she wants to make a purchase of dairy cattle to produce a larger quantity of milk for her business. In the 18 years that she has had this occupation, this is her first loan sequence. 
It is for these reasons that Silveira asks for a loan, to purchase dairy cattle to increase cheese production.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cattle to increase her production of cheese.

loans.name: Lyda

texts.en:
Lyda works hard to support her family. Lyda is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Lyda has been in this business for years now.

Lyda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
Amjad is a 24-year-old married man from Yatta, a village near Hebron. He lives with his wife in a small simple house. 

Amjad works as a construction worker. He also has a barn, which he has been operating for the past two years, for raising sheep. He sells the meat and milk to the local traders. It is a good business but still needs some improvements.

Amjad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more sheep for his barn. By taking this loan, Amjad will be able to increase the barn productivity and also his income.

Amjad appears in the photo while he was taking care of the sheep.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for his barn

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim is 28 years old and married with two children. The family lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. For the past four years she has sold fish for a living.

In 2009 Kim joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She took out and successfully repaid a loan used to improve her business from the organization. She is now applying for a 15,000,000 VND loan to buy sand, cement and bricks to build a latrine. Poor hygienic conditions for her family are one of her most critical concerns.

Kim is working to build up her fish sales. With future profits from her business she hopes to build a new house in which her family will be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement and bricks to build a latrine.

loans.name: Ngân

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngân works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Ngân is 49 years old and is married with five children. Ngân lives with one dependent in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. This is Ngân's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Ngân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Ngân hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Vân

texts.en:
Vân operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. Vân is 23 years old and is married with two children. Vân lives with two dependents in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. This is Vân's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Vân has been involved in this business for five years.

The main hardship that Vân faces in her life is not having a clean water system and a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

In the future, Vân hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Hội

texts.en:
Mrs. Hội works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Hội is 41 years old and she is married with five children. Hội lives in Hau Loc district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hội's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hội has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hội hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Hushbaht

texts.ru: Хушбахт мужчина средних лет. Ему 46 лет. Он женат и имеет детей. У него высшее образование. Он работает врачом педиатром. Он трудолюбивый человек. В свободное от работы время он занимается животноводством. Это приносит дополнительный доход в его семью.  Хушбахт обратился в МДО Арванд  за кредитом для расширения свой деятельности в сфере животноводства. Он благодарит заранее за поддержку.
texts.en: Hushbaht is a middle-aged man. He is 46 years old. He is married and has children. He has a higher education. He works as a pediatric doctor. He is a hardworking man. In his free time from work he practices livestock breeding. This brings in an additional income for his family. Hushbaht turned to MDO Arvand for a loan to expand his livestock breeding business. He thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Muôn

texts.en:
Mrs. Muôn is an accountant. Muôn is 25 years old and she is married with one child. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Muôn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Muôn has been involved in this business for four years. The main hardship that Muôn faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Muôn hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима молодая 25-летняя девушка, начинающая свой бизнес. Она живет в городе Конибодом с матерью и братом. Фотима в настоящий ммоент работает тренером в спортивном комплексе. Она решила параллельно начать торговый бизнес вместе с матерью, чтобы улучшить финансовое положение семьи. Фотима планирует заняться купле-продажей сухофруктов. Так как ее начального капитала не хватает, она обратилась за кредитом. Фотима просит Вас дать им шанс начать данный бизнес и заверяет, что их новый бизнес будет успешным и прибыльным.
texts.en: Fotima is a 25-year-old young woman who is starting her own business. She lives in the city of Konibodom with her mother and brother. Currently, Fotima works as a trainer in a sports complex. She decided to simultaneously begin a retail business with her mother in order to improve the financial situation of her family. Fotima plans to buy and resell dried fruits. As she does not have enough start-up capital, she requested a loan. Fotima asks you to give her a chance to begin her business. She is certain that their new business with be successful and profitable.

loans.use: to buy and resell dried fruits.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru:
Назире 39 лет. Она мать четверых детей. Назира 3 года своей жизни продвигает торговую деятельность. Она решила заняться этой деятельностью, потому что ее мама работала именно в этой сфере деятельности. И мама научила ее правильно общаться с клиентами и вести данный бизнес.
   Назира занимается продажей шарфов, платков, хны, теплых жилеток и разной другой одежды. Назира решила расширить деятельность и увеличить товар. Она надеется с увеличением товара, увеличится доход и может позволить своим детям новые экономические возможности.
texts.en:
Nazira is 39 years old. She is a mother to four children. For three years of her life, Nazira has been running a retail business. She decided to take up this business because her mother also worked in the retail sector. Her mother taught her how to properly converse with customers and manage this business.

Nazira sells scarfs, shawls, henna, warm vests and other kinds of clothing. Nazira decided to expand her business and increase her merchandise. She hopes that, with the increase in merchandise, her income will increase and it will allow her children to have new economic opportunities.

loans.use: to buy vests and shawls in order to increase her sales turnover.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana is a 36-year-old married woman from Yatta, a village near Hebron. She lives with her husband and five kids, three sons and two daughters, in a small simple house.  Her husband works as a construction worker. Hana has a barn for raising sheep, which has been operating for the past three years. She sells the production to the local traders. It is a good business but still needs some improvements.

Hana took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more sheep for her barn. By taking this loan, Hana will be able to increase the barn's productivity and also her income. Hana appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more sheep for her barn

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 52 years old and is married with three children. For more than ten years, she has been a farmer who raises poultry and cattle. Hoa lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. She joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in 2007 to improve her business. Hoa has successfully repaid a previous loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of her most critical difficulties is not having a hygienic latrine. 

Hoa is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet. In the future, she hopes that her business will do well, her children will find good jobs, and her family will be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Aidana

texts.en:
Aidana is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Economics. Here is her story:

“Since the early childhood I remember that I was growing with my two sisters and my mother alone always was caring about us. That time I was too small to understand how hard it was for my mom to raise three daughters because my father had had left us. After the divorce he helped us neither morally, nor financially. 

At first we used to live with my grandparents as my mother was doing her best to earn some money for us. Time passed and she had a stable leased place at the market and we began to live together. Even though my mother was in a hard situation, she tried to give us as much as she could: we went to the kindergarten then to school. Nowadays she is still a seller at the market and we depend on her sales every day. Her earnings are enough to cover our daily necessities, but not enough for my university tuition fee that I am applying for a Kiva loan.

Having the opportunity to support my education, and my family with the KIVA loan is extremely important, and I am thankful to KIVA lenders all over the world for believing in me and investing in not only my future, but also in my family’s.  I am the eldest in my family, so my duty is to help my mother improve our family’s financial situation, which can only be achieved by getting a well-paid job after completing my education successfully.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: My Group

texts.en: My is 56 years old, and a married rice farmer with five children who lives in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. So far she has been cultivating rice for over 35 years. Her husband is 58 years old and he is also a farmer. Among all the children, three of them work as construction workers in a nearby country and two others are students. Together, they can earn around USD 36 daily. Now My, a group leader, would like to get a group loan with three members in the group. She will use her portion to build a latrine. With this loan, it will provide her and her family with hygienic living and help to keep the environment clean. For her plan, she is going to renovate her house soon and help her children to earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Sohila

texts.en: Sohila is a strong woman. She was born in 1991. She lives in a rural area, is married and has one child. Her husband works abroad. Sohila has a business of agriculture. Her husband helps her to do a business. She kept cattle, but the milk of the cattle was used by family. Now she decided to open a new livestock breeding. She is planning to earn additional income. That is why she is trying somehow to be helpful to her husband. She wants to enlarge her business. She is also working planting vegetables and crop agriculture. Sohila needs financial support to widen her activity.

loans.use: To buy seeds and vegetables for organizing her new business

loans.name: Orzuboy

texts.ru:
Орзубой активный молодой парень в возрасте 21 года, проживающий в районе Гончи. Он в настоящий момент является студентом и учится очно во втором курсе Худжандского Государственного Университета по специальности "Практическая математика". Орзубой хорошо учится, особенно ему нравится изучать математику. Родители Орзубоя являются животноводами. Орзубой в свое свободное время помогает им в деятельности, к тому же иногда он берет заказы на ремонт домов. 
Сейчас Орзубой нуждается в 550 долларах США для оплаты за свой учебный год в ВУЗе за 2014-2015 года. Поскольку у него на руках нет сбережений, он просит эту сумму в кредит. Орзубой ответственный молодой человек. Он обещает выплачивать кредит в срок и продолжать хорошо учиться, чтобы в будущем стать квалифицированным специалистом.
texts.en:
Orzuboy is an active 21-year-old young man. He lives in the Gonchi District. He is currently a second year student and studies full-time at Khujand State University. He is majoring in practical mathematics. Orzuboy is a very good student; he especially loves studying mathematics. Orzuboy's parents are livestock breeders. In his free time, Orzuboy helps his parents with this business. Sometimes he also takes orders for home repairs.

Now Orzuboy needs 550 USD to pay for his university tuition for the 2014-2015 academic year. As he doesn't have any of his own savings, he is requesting this amount as a loan. Orzuboy is a responsible young man. He promises to pay back the loan on time and continue to do well in his studies so that he can become a highly-qualified professional in the future.

loans.use: to pay his tuition for the 2014-2015 academic year.

loans.name: Winny

texts.en:
Winny is a 43-year-old single woman, who is blessed with four children. She has been operating a cereals business for six years, earning herself an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Winny is now servicing her second loan of KES 30,000, and intends to use this amount to buy additional stock of beans, maize grains and green grams to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Winny plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children, and hopes to become a successful business woman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy beans, maize grains and green grams to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase many kinds of incense and clothes to resell

loans.name: Pahhoi Group

texts.en: Themneivah, the profiled borrower of the group, is a resident of Tollen village, which lies at the outskirts of Churachandpur. The people of Tollen village are humble and earn their livelihood through daily wages in spite of the heat and the rain during bad weather conditions. There is not much opportunity for work and one is considered very lucky to even be employed as a daily wage earner. Themneivah is pictured with her hand raised. She has one son and the father works as a missionary. With a low income family, there is hardly savings for her variety store to keep running. Her variety store is on the verge of closing down due to a lack of items to be sold. She hopes to revive her store by buying more inventory items to be sold. But due to a lack of capital, she has to bear the consequences of providing for her family and the store. Hopefully, she will now be able to revive her store and save herself and the family through the Kiva loan. The loan will be used to buy stock of medicines, stationery items and groceries for selling purposes. She is very grateful to Kiva for giving her the opportunity to be back again on her own feet. She aspires to own a brighter store. Without the Kiva loan, her life was doomed. All the group members are very glad to get a loan from Kiva. They are engaged in similar businesses to help themselves and strive for financial independence.

loans.use: To buy inventory items including medicines, stationery items and groceries to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Ra'no

texts.ru: Раъно 46 летняя жительница района Варзоб. Раъно работает уборщицей. Параллельно она занимается животноводством у себя дома. Животноводческая деятельность является основной, потому что доход от этого бизнеса обеспечивает семью. Раъно обратилась за кредитом, потому что у нее осталось малое количество скотов, чтобы сохранить деятельность и увеличить поголовья скота Раъно необходимо определенная сумма денег. Она намерена на заемные средства приобрести скотов и сохранить бизнес.
texts.en: Ra'no is a 46-year-old resident of the Varzob District. Ra'no works as a janitor. She simultaneously practices livestock breeding from her home. The livestock breeding business is her main occupation, as the income from it provides for her family. Ra'no requested a loan as she only has a small amount of cattle currently. In order to save her business, Ra'no a certain amount of money to buy more cattle and increase the size of her herd. She is determined to buy cattle with the lent money and save her business.

loans.use: to increase the size of her herd and save her business.

loans.name: Keurn's Group

texts.en: Keurn’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Keurn makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a farm laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Cuatro Estrellas (Flat) Group

texts.es:
Yolanda es muy amable, siempre esta sonriendo y logra contagiar a las demás integrantes del grupo. Ella tiene 32 años de edad y vive en unión libre con el señor Juan quien trabaja en la construcción de casas; juntos han formado una familia con tres hijos de los cuales dos se encuentran estudiando su educación secundaria y uno en la primaria.

Con la idea fija en su mente de ayudar con los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus hijos, desde hace 15 años Yolanda comenzó a criar y vender borregos. Ella conserva a los animales durante 8 meses para asegurarse de que alcancen el tamaño y peso adecuados para tener más ganancias. Los animalitos los compra en la misma comunidad y cuando ya son lo suficientemente grandes, los ofrece a las personas que se dedican a preparar "barbacoa", un platillo tradicional preparado con carne de borrego. Todos los días, Yolanda se levanta muy temprano, lleva a sus hijos a la escuela y después les dedica aproximadamente cinco horas a los animales entre sacarlos a pasear y alimentarlos. “Para mí no es nada complicado cuidar de mis borregos porque así también puedo estar al pendiente de mis hijos sin tener que salir de casa para obtener un ingreso extra”. 

Yolanda está muy contenta y agradecida con su préstamo porque podrá comprar mas borreguitos, ella no invierte demasiado en alimento porque aprovecha el pasto y el zacate que hay en los campos de su comunidad. Sin embargo, una de sus dificultades es la falta de agua en su comunidad, no hay agua potable así que ella y sus niños deben recorrer varios kilómetros para llevar agua a su casa para darle de beber a sus borregos y también para uso propio. A pesar de ello Yolanda es una mujer muy trabajadora y no le preocupa caminar ni llevar el agua de un lugar a otro. 

Yolanda sueña con ahorrar dinero y abrir una pequeña tienda de abarrotes ya que sería de gran beneficio para ella y para sus vecinos. Por el momento, los habitantes de la comunidad también deben caminar largas distancias para comprar alimentos. También le gustaría continuar con la crianza de animales porque quiere apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios para que puedan terminar una carrera profesional.

Las demás integrantes también se muestran muy contentas y agradecidas por su préstamo porque podrán invertir en sus actividades económicas. Maria Isabel, Maria Petra y Felicitas tienen la misma actividad que Yolanda y necesitan comprar animales y alimento. Además, todas ellas también elaboran servilletas bordadas que venden para obtener un ingreso extra para sus familias.

*La fotografía fue tomada en la casa de Yolanda, muestran un mantel que ella misma elabora y está apunto de vender.*
texts.en:
Yolanda is very kind, she is always smiling and manages to pass it on to the other members of the group. She is 32 years old, and cohabits with Juan, who works in housing construction. Together they have formed a family with 3 children, 2 of which are studying secondary school, and one primary school.
With the idea in mind to help with household expenses and their children’s education, 15 years ago Yolanda began to raise and sell sheep. She keeps the animals for 8 months to make sure they reach an adequate size and weight to make more profit. She buys the small animals in the community, and when they are big enough, she offers them to people who prepare “barbacoa,” a traditional dish made with lamb meat.
