Every day, Yolanda gets up very early, takes her children to school, and later dedicates 5 hours to the animals, taking them out and feeding them. “For me it is not difficult to take care of my lambs, because in this way I can keep an eye on my children without having to leave home to obtain extra income.”
Yolanda is very happy and grateful for her loan, because she will be able to buy more lambs. She does not invest in food too much, because she takes advantage of the grass and the fodder in the fields of her community. However, one of the difficulties is the lack of water in her community. There is no potable water, so she and her children have to walk several kilometers to bring water to their home and give it to the lambs, and also for their own use. In spite of this, Yolanda is a hard-working woman, and she is not worried about walking or bringing the water from one place to another. 
Yolanda dreams of saving money and opening a small grocery shop, which would be very beneficial for her and her neighbors. At the moment, the residents of the community also have to walk long distances to purchase food. She would also like to continue raising animals, because she wants to help her children with their studies, so they can finish a professional degree.
The other members of the group are also very happy and grateful for their loan, because they can invest in economic activities. Maria Isabel, Maria Petra, and Felicitas also have the same occupation as Yolanda, and they need to buy animals and feed. Also, they all make embroidered napkins which they sell to obtain extra income for their families. 

*The photograph was taken at Yolanda’s house, they show a tablecloth that they also make, and are about to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more lambs.

location.town: Tres Estrellas, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is a 33-year-old married father of three children between two and ten years of age, two of whom go to school. A farmer for five years, Jean Claude will use this loan from Kiva to buy more fertilizers for his maize and bean crops. His profits will help pay school fees for his children.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for his maize and bean production.

loans.name: Letty Maria

texts.es:
Lety es una innovadora empresaria de 52 años de edad que al separarse de su esposo, encontró en la venta de un café diferente realizado con productos y nutrientes naturales la clave para generar ingresos tanto para sostenerse como para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Ella es una tierna, muy amigable, dedicada mujer que a través de un crédito quiere mejorar sus ventas, vender nuevos productos y lograr una sostenibilidad de su negocio y lo hará comprando insumos totalmente naturales para agregarlos a sus bebidas, y alimentos buscando un mejor flujo de clientes y acreditación en el mercado. 
Ella solicita tu apoyo solo le queda esto, a su edad es difícil encontrar trabajo por no decir casi imposible y en verdad le hace muy feliz ser independiente, apoyala.
texts.en:
Letty is an innovative entrepreneur. She is 52 years old. When she separated from her husband, she started selling a different type of coffee, which is made with natural products and nutrients. She found this to be the key to generating an income not only to support herself, but also to improve her quality of life.

She is an affectionate, very friendly, and dedicated woman who, with this loan, wishes to improve her sales, sell new products, and achieve sustainability of her business. She will do this by purchasing completely natural products to add to her beverages and foods. She is looking to better her customer flow as well as the accreditation of her business in the market. 

She is asking for your help, since this is all she has. At her age, it is difficult to find work, if not almost impossible. In addition, being independent makes her very happy. Support her!

loans.use: to buy completely natural products to add to her beverages and foods.

loans.name: Paula Andrea

texts.es:
Paula una joven de 21 años de edad, responsable, y muy independiente pues a su corta edad por amor tomo la decisión de casarse con su pareja y desde eso vive con ella y aspira a ser muy feliz y conformar una familia. Lo que paula no quiere es sentirse como un estorbo, convertirse en una mujer que solo espera que su marido le lleve la plata y ella en la casa sin hacer nada por ello tomo la decisión de acercarse a la corporación interactuar solicitando un préstamo para iniciar su propio negocio. 
Gracias al apoyo que puede recibir compra surtido en ropa para hombre y dama como jean, camisas, blusas, faldas, bermudas etc., con tu ayuda paula puede salir a ofertar sus productos a vecinos y toda aquella persona que quiera algún producto de los que venderá.
Para Paula es muy importante tu apoyo, pues la decisión de casarse no fue nada fácil y quiere hacer todo lo posible por hacer de su relación algo perdurable y que no lleguen a pasar necesidades.
texts.en:
Paula is a young woman who is 21 years of age. She is responsible and very independent for being so young. Paula decided to marry her partner who lives with her. They aspire to be very happy and to start a family. However, she does not want to feel like she is a hindrance. Paula does not want to become a woman who only relies on her husband to earn a living. Therefore, she decided to approach Interactuar about applying for a loan to start her own business.

Thanks to the support she will receive, Paula will be able to buy a stock of clothing for men and women such as jeans, shirts, blouses, skirts, Bermuda shorts, and other items. With this assistance, she will be able to offer merchandise to neighbors and every other person who wants to buy any product that she sells.

It is very important to Paula to have this support. Her decision to get married was not easy, so she wants to do everything possible to make her relationship last forever and feel that her needs are being met.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothing for men and women such as jeans, shirts, blouses, skirts, Bermuda shorts, and other items.

loans.name: Sainjargal

texts.en:
Sainjargal, 42, lives with his wife and three children in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He has been a running butcher shop since 1999. He himself takes care of the stock of meat and logistical issues while his wife sells meat to local people. Their eldest son is serving in the military. Their two daughters go to high school. 

He is requesting a loan of $2,625 USD to buy meat in large amounts for an upcoming national festival. During the festival, demand for meat increases tremendously so he wants to use this opportunity to increase his profit.

loans.use: to buy meat in large amounts for an upcoming festival

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos proviene de una familia de clase media, se desempeña como supervisor de una empresa, a la vez estudia la carrera de contabilidad.
Es una persona que está luchando y esforzando por poder crecer y salir adelante, e ir abriéndose camino.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Carlos comes from a middle-class family. He works as a supervisor for a company, but he is also studying for a degree in Accounting.

Carlos is a person who is striving and doing his best to grow and move forward so that doors will open up for him. He is requesting this loan so that he can invest in the payment of his degree fees. As a result, he can continue his studies just as before.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Yeimy Lucero

texts.es: Yeimy oriunda de la dorada un sector afectado por la pobreza y las pocos oportunidades que hay para emplearse, a sus 30 años de edad, cuenta con una modesta tienda donde oferta principalmente productos de la canasta familiar de primera necesidad, gaseosas, dulces, y frituras, es madre de 2 hijos a los cuales les quiere brindar esa posibilidad de estudiar y para ello solicita su apoyo para comprar y abastecer su tienda de más productos para tener un mejor flujo de ventas que le permita con toda tranquilidad tener la capacidad de ingresar a sus dos pequeños a la escuela y mantenerlos.
texts.en: Yeimy is a native of la Dorada an area affected by poverty and few opportunities for employment. At 30 years old, she has a modest store where she offers mainly basic food items, soft drinks, sweets and fried foods. She is the mother of two children and she wants to provide them the possibility to study. For this reason she is requesting help to buy more products to stock her store to have a greater level of sales. This will allow her to easily have the capacity to enter her two small children in school and keep them there.

loans.use: to buy basic food items to stock her store.

loans.name: Marta Gloria

texts.es:
Marta, por la facilidad de pago y los buenos resultados se ha decidido por un nuevo crédito para comprar semilla de marañón al por mayor, esto le respaldara la entrega de sus pedidos hasta que inicie nuevamente la temporada del marañón.
Actualmente se cambió de domicilio ya cuenta con casa propia, sus ingresos no han variado mucho pero son de mucha ayuda para dar a su familia lo básico y mantener una buena calificación crediticia, estos son resultados positivos que ha tenido al invertir el préstamo anterior en la venta de semilla de marañón y mariscos.
texts.en: Marta, because of the ease of repayments and the good results, has decided to take out a new loan to purchase cashew seeds in bulk. This will support the delivery of her orders until cashew season begins again. Marta recently moved houses and now owns her own home. Her income hasn't varied much, but is a great help to provide the basics for her family and maintain a good credit history. These are the positive results she has had upon investing her last loan in the sale of cashews and shellfish.

loans.use: to purchase cashew seeds in bulk.

loans.name: Cristian Andres

texts.es: Cristian es un joven que tiene muchas aspiraciones para bienestar de su familia, el está casado y tiene 2  hijos pequeños,   su esposa trabaja de vendedora en una panadería, Cristian anteriormente trabajaba de ayudante de venta de productos lácteos y en el transcurso de sus actividades vio que es  muy rentable este negocio y decidió ponerse su negocio propio de distribuidor de productos lácteos, el crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra mercadería en productos lácteos y así lograr mejorar sus ingresos  para juntar dinero y mas adelante comprarse un carro para que le sirva para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Cristian is a young man that has a lot of dreams for his family's welfare. He is married, and has 2 small children. His wife works as a salesperson in a bakery. Cristian previously worked as a sales assistant for dairy products, and in the course of his activities he saw that the business was very profitable and he decided to start his own business as a dairy products distributor.

He will use the loan to buy inventory of dairy products and in this way be able to improve his revenues so he can save money and buy a vehicle in the future. This will help him transport his products.

loans.use: to buy dairy products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase milk producing cows.

loans.name: Vivian Dariana

texts.es:
Viviana es toda un vendedora de mercancía como ropa, calzado, para dama y caballero, accesorios no solo en su región, ella se monta en le transporte público a recorrer, pueblos y zonas lejanas para vender sus productos, realmente hace un gran desgaste de tiempo y físico para sacar su negocio a delante y vale la pena apoyarla por la motivación y perseverancia que le pone a sus actividades.  
Viviana solicita un apoyo para seguir proyectando su actividad, invirtiendo en calzado y ropa para ambos sexos.
texts.en:
Viviana is a fine example of a saleswoman for merchandise such as clothing, footwear, and accessories for women and men, not only in her region. She takes public transportation to travel through towns and distant zones to sell her products. She truly spends a great amount of time and energy to move her business forward, and it is worthwhile to support her because of the motivation and perseverance that she puts into her activities.

Viviana is applying for support to continue moving her business forward by investing in footwear and clothing for both sexes.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothing for men and women, as well as footwear

loans.name: Alfonso Andres

texts.es:
Alfonso un responsable y trabajador hombre de 33 años de edad el cual se desempeña en una tienda que abastece a los confeccionista, el distribuye telas a un bajo costo, y su sueño desde que inició su negocio es poder un día comprar una casa o ir pagándola poco a poco y sabe que con la proyección que está teniendo su negocio muy pronto lo lograra. 
Es padre de dos hijos un pequeño de 9 años y una pequeña de 14 años de edad, se encuentran estudiando y pueden estar tranquilos que mientras se encuentran estudiando tiene un padre sudando y matándose por darles una buena calidad de vida. 
Alfonso solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de telas en grandes cantidades, tiene una parte del capital ahorrado y la otra lo solicita por medio de crédito, esto le ayudara a tener suficientes existencia para cubrir algunos pedidos y atender este primer trimestre del año.
texts.en:
Alfonso is a responsible and hard-working man of 33 who works in a store that provides supplies for sewing businesses. He distributes fabrics at low cost, and his dream since he began his business is to be able to some day buy a house or pay for one little by little. He knows that with the course that his business is taking, he will achieve this very soon.

He is the father of two children, a little boy of 9 and a little girl of 14. They are in school, and they can rest easy that while they are studying, they have a father who is sweating and working to his utmost to give them a good quality of life.

Alfonso is applying for a loan to buy a stock of fabrics in large quantities. He has part of the capital saved, and the rest he is applying for through the loan. This will help him to have sufficient stock on hand to cover some orders and serve this first third of the year.

loans.use: to buy a supply of fabric to provide stock for the sewing businesses

loans.name: Fantasía Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Fantasía” lo conforman 8 mujeres muy trabajadoras, entre ellas existe una amistad muy grande, se llevan muy bien quizás porque se conocen desde hace muchos años. Su carisma y alegría las distingue.

María Concepción o Mary, como le dicen de cariño, tiene 21 años de edad, vive en unión libre desde hace 2 años con Isaac, él no tiene un empleo fijo sino por temporada. La pareja aún no tiene niños, pero sí piensan formar una familia en algún momento. 

Desde muy pequeña Mary veía como su abuelo y su papá elaboraban adornos navideños como campanas, noche buenas, ángeles, piñatas, etc. negocio familiar en el que ella siempre colaboró, pero fue hace apenas dos años que también comenzó a invertir en él para tener un pequeño ingreso. En época decembrina este es un muy buen negocio, en casa de su papá ella y sus otros hermanos elaboran los adornos, mientras su papá y otros miembros de la familia viajan a otro Estado de la república mexicana para venderlos en los dos puestos que ya tienen bien establecidos. Mary y sus hermanos deben trabajar a marchas forzadas porque estos adornos se venden muy rápido y seguramente en algunos días su papá regresara por más mercancía. Mary necesita un préstamo para comprar materia prima como cartón, unicel, pegamento, escarcha, diamantina, hilo cáñamo, etc. Ella viajará a la cuidad de México para poder adquirir su material porque ahí lo puede conseguir a un mejor precio. Mientras tanto, guarda la esperanza de que su papá tenga muy buenas ventas para tener mejores ganancias. 

Además de la elaboración de adornos navideños Mary tiene otra actividad “Hace cinco meses con mi primer préstamo pude iniciar con la venta de artículos de fantasía” algunos días de la semana trabaja en la plaza del municipio ofreciendo sus artículos. Aunque Mary tiene mucha competencia sus ganancias también son buenas y disfruta mucho el tiempo de venta porque le encanta el contacto con las personas. Mary sueña con tener algún día un local propio para tener estar más segura y no tener que caminar entre las calles, así también podría tener más mercancía.

Las demás integrantes del grupo son Felipa quien invierte en ropa; Alicia, en tés; Delgadina en tortillas; María C. y María G., en artículos de fantasía; Ofelia, en artículos domésticos e Isabel, en verduras.

*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de Doña Felipa. Ellas aparecen con algunos bordados artesanales que elaboran para obtener un ingreso extra para su familia; los bordados son utilizados para envolver las tortillas y algún otro alimento. Mary es quien tiene la servilleta azul en sus manos y se encuentra de pie.
texts.en:
The group “Fantasía” is composed of 8 women who are very hard-working.  A very great friendship exists among them, perhaps because they have known each other for many years. Their charm and cheerfulness set them apart. 

María Concepción, or Mary, as they affectionately call her, is 21 years old.  She has been common-law-married to Isaac for two years.  He doesn’t have a permanent job, but works seasonally.  They don’t have children yet, but they plan to have a family someday.

Since she was very young, Mary saw how her grandfather and father used to make Christmas decorations such as bells, Christmas Eve decorations, angels, piñatas, etc.  She always contributed to the family business, but just about two years ago she began to invest in it in order to have a small income.  

This is a very good business in the holiday season. She and her siblings make the decorations in her father’s house, while he and other family members travel to another state in Mexico to sell them from two stalls that they already have well established.  Mary and her siblings have to work around the clock because these decorations sell very quickly, and her father will be returning within a few days for more merchandise.

Mary needs a loan to purchase materials such as cardboard, Styrofoam, glue, glitter frost, glitter, hemp thread, etc. She will travel to Mexico City to acquire her materials because she can get a better price there.  In the meantime, she hopes that her father will have very good sales in order to have better earnings.

In addition to making Christmas decorations, Mary has another occupation. She says, “Five months ago, with my first loan, I was able to begin selling costume jewelry”.  She works a few days a week in the town plaza, selling her items.  Although Mary has a lot of competition, her earnings are good; and she enjoys the time when she is selling because she loves the contact with people. Mary dreams of having a shop of her own someday so that she can be more secure by not having to walk along the streets, and also be able to have more merchandise.

The other members of the group are: Felipa, who sells clothing; Alicia, who sells tea; Delgadina, who sells tortillas; María C. and María G., who sell costume jewelry; Ofelia, who sells household items; and Isabel, who sells vegetables.

The photograph was taken at Doña Felipa’s house.  The ladies appear with some of the hand embroidered cloths that they make in order to earn extra income for their families. The embroideries are used to cover the tortillas and other foods.  Mary is standing, holding the blue napkin.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as cardboard, Styrofoam, glue, glitter frost, glitter, hemp thread, etc.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: Juan de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, el se dedica desde hace 10 años a la agricultura a la siembra de Chile dulce, pepino, berenjenas y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados y ya tiene clientes establecidos, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Juan is 38 years old. He lives in his own home with his mother. For the past ten years he has been in agriculture, growing sweet chiles, peppers, eggplants and beans. He sells his products in various markets and has loyal clients. He is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, compost, seeds and herbicides; and to improve the land, which you can see in the picture. In this way he will be able to have better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, compost, seeds and herbicides.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: A sus 53 años de edad Maria  es una señora casada, ella vive con su esposo que se dedica a  la agricultura y a la ganadería y tienen 7 hijos mismos de los cuales 2  vive con ella y también se hace cargo de 4 nietos, Maria necesita el crédito para comprar pollos, ya que este negocio le permite que mientras cría a sus animalitos  permanece en su casa para hacerse cargo de sus nietos, la aspiración de Maria es de seguir trabajando para apoyar a su familia y salir adelante juntos.
texts.en: At 53, Maria is a married woman. She lives with her husband who works in agriculture and animal husbandry. They have seven children, of whom two live with her, and she also takes care of 4 grandchildren. Maria needs a loan to buy chickens, because this business allows her to stay home and take care of her small grandchildren while raising her little animals. Maria's dream is to keep on working to support her family and move ahead together.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Sandra Llanet

texts.es:
Sandra es una viuda de 37 años de edad, y a pesar de los traspiés que ha tenido en su recorrido siempre se levanta pues sus 3 hijos son su fortaleza y razón de seguir siempre adelante, se desempeña como vendedora de productos por catálogo con esta actividad genera los ingresos para su hogar y ahora pide un apoyo para adquirir productos directamente que le salen más favorables y venderlos al precio del catálogo obteniendo una mejor utilidad.
Acude ante ustedes con el anime que le presten dinero para tener capital de trabajo y estar pendiente de las múltiples promociones que salen en las revistas.
texts.en:
Sandra is a widow of 37, and in spite of the stumbles that she has had in her trajectory, she always gets up, since her three children are her strength and her reason to continue forever forward. She sells products by catalog. With this business, she generates the income for her household, and now she is requesting support in order to acquire products directly, which will be more favorable for her to sell at the catalog price, obtaining a better profit. 

She is turning to you with the spirit that you will lend her money so that she can have working capital and be alert to the multiple promotions that appear in the magazines.

loans.use: to have working capital to respond to the catalog sales promotions that will bring her good economic profits.

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.en: Gulnoza is a responsive woman. She was born in 1988. She lives in a rural area. She is divorced. She has two daughters. She has a business keeping cattle. She buys feed and then sells the livestock. After her divorce, she decided to work and raise her children. She began to do a business in agriculture. She is planning to enlarge her activity and gain profit to benefit her standard of living. Gulnoza is in need of financial support for buying cattle.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio de 40 años de edad es casado, su esposa es ama de casa y juntos han procreado 3 hijos, él es comerciante de granos básicos y café, es muy conocido como persona y como comerciante por su vasta experiencia y por su carisma.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar café, ropa, queso, granos básicos y demás para mantenerse abastecido en su negocio y que por el incremento de la demanda no se vea afectado por falta de producto. Esperando que su negocio se mantenga creciendo y estable piensa seguir trabajando con la institución para seguir resolviendo sus planes.
texts.en: Rogelio is 40 years old and married. His wife is a housewife and together they have 3 children. He sells basic grains and coffee. He is well known for his ample experience and his charisma as a person and as a merchant. He is requesting a loan to buy coffee, clothing, cheese, basic grains and others. This way he will keep his business well stocked up, so that when the demand increases he is not affected by the lack of product. He hopes that his business keeps on growing and is stable. He plans to keep on working with the institution to keep on fulfilling his plans.

loans.use: to buy coffee, clothing, cheese, basic grains and other things.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis es chofer de trufi y trabaja de lunes a viernes, los fines de semana Luis le ayuda a su esposa a elaborar papas fritas Luis tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad y su esposa esta embarazada, ya lleva 8 meses de embarazo, ls familia vive en casa de los familiares de Luis, ocupan un dormitorio, una sala pequeña y una cocina Luis quiere un credito para arreglo de motor de su movilidad,  Luis es una persona muy trabajadora y se esfuerza para brindar las mejores condiciones de vida a su familia  por eso Luis agradecerá toda la ayuda que puedan darle En la foto aparece Luis con su esposa
texts.en:
Luis is a taxi driver, and he works from Monday to Friday. On the weekends, Luis helps his wife make French fries. Luis has a 4-year-old son, and his wife is eight months pregnant. The family lives in the house of Luis' relatives. They occupy one bedroom, a small living room, and a kitchen. 

Luis wants a loan to repair the motor of his vehicle. Luis is a very hard-working person, and he strives to offer better living conditions to his family. For this reason, Luis will be grateful for all the help that you can give him. In the photograph, Luis appears with his wife.

loans.use: to repair the motor of his vehicle.

loans.name: Koech

texts.en:
Koech is a 36-year-old woman married to Isaack who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with two children.  Koech has been operating a hotel (restaurant) business for a period of eight years, earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Koech was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbor and is now taking her first loan of KES 30,000 and intends to use this amount to buy maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and cooking fat to add to her current stock which is running out.

Koech plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to become a successful businesswoman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en:
Zuhro is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1977. She lives in a village. She is married. She has four children. She has had an agro-business for two months. Her husband and two sons are helping her to do a business. She is working in crop production. She plants crops and sells them in a market. Zuhro is supported by her family members. 

She wants to enlarge her new business by keeping cattle. She is needing financial support for buying cattle for her new business.

loans.use: to buy cattle for a new business

loans.name: Asma'u Bintu

texts.en: Asma'u is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Asma'u would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Asma'u can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about her goals, Asma'u expressed a desire to use the extra income to provide her family with food and clothing, and in the long run, make more money for herself and her family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hajara would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hajara can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about her goals, Hajara expressed a desire to use the extra income to provide family with food and clothing, and in the long run, make more money for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Tumur-Chudur

texts.en:
Mr. Tumur-Chudur, 26 years old, lives with his wife and child in Darkhan, which is the second largest city of Mongolia. He has recently begun to work as a physician in the town hospital in 2014. His wife used to be a nurse but left her job in order to look after her child.

Mr. Tumur-Chudur is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to buy a natural gas vehicle in order to visit patients at home. His work office is located in a small town and he doesn't have a car. The natural gas vehicle doesn't emit harmless pollutants into the atmosphere and also wastes less fuel.

loans.use: to buy a natural gas vehicle.

loans.name: Mercury Group

texts.en:
Jane, who is in her mid 30s, is single with one child who is still at school. She has been running a restaurant for one and a half years now. She works from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Jane's  second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the restaurant stock and has paid back her loan successfully. She is happy with the loan. She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses. 

She will use this loan to buy stock for the restraurant and meet her customers' demand. She dreams of owning a hotel.

Jane will share this loan with her loan group, "Mercury," which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock for the restraurant and meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Servilla

texts.en: Servilla always has the enthusiasm of gardening. She busies herself in Dapitan and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase potted and ornamental plants for resale.  Servilla knew that she has to get things right to yield more income. In the future, Servilla hopes to buy a hauling truck for easy transportation.

loans.use: to purchase potted and ornamental plants for resale.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 39 years old from Estancia, Iloilo. She is married with six sons, ages eight to twenty. Her husband is a driver. Emelita works hard to help him raise their children by selling home-cooked snacks and viand. She's had a food vending business for seven years now. She usually sells food such as cooked noodles and steamed rice with cheese.

Emelita is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy flour, sugar, elbow macaroni, rice noodles, milk, baking powder, sticky rice, cassava, vanilla flavor, and charcoal. Emelita hopes to increase her production with the availability of these ingredients. She is motivated to work hard for her children's education and dreamed of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, elbow macaroni, rice noodles, milk, baking powder, sticky rice, cassava, vanilla flavor, and charcoal.

loans.name: Risolat

texts.en: Risolat is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1990. She lives in a village. She is married. She has two children. She is a seamstress. For about three years, she has had a business. She sews traditional and national clothes for women. Risolat has a lot of clients. She sews attractive and modern dresses. All her clients are satisfied with her work. She is planning to widen her activity. She is asking for financial support to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre joven de 21 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es la artesanía en aluminio.
Él es independiente, emprendedor, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Chuquiaguillo’ un área caracterizada por el comercio mayorista; camiones cargados de frutas, verduras y carne llegan desde el norte para ser comercializados en el lugar y por mayor. De clima frío y seco con fuertes vientos que llegan de la cordillera.
Jose es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que se dedican al comercio, viven en una casa construida de ladrillo que cuanta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la fabricación de muñecos de aluminio para futbolín. Él aprendió el oficio realizando un curso de fundición en el colegio, consiguió algunos moldes antiguos y se contactó con los fabricantes de futbolines para ofrecerles sus muñecos. Actualmente se ocupa de proveer a clientes que elaboran las canchas de juego de madera. “es una lástima que este juego infantil vaya perdiendo popularidad ahora los niños sólo quieren juegos electrónicos…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un taller grande dónde poder realizar otras artesanías en metal. Él desea construir un taller en su domicilio para contar con un espacio donde poder trabajar cómodamente. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Jose solicita un préstamo para la construcción de un cuarto para utilizarlo como taller de artesanía en aluminio.
texts.en:
José, 21, is single and has no children.  His business is aluminum handicrafts.  He's an independent, enterprising, responsible, and hardworking young man.  He works in the Chuquiaguillo area, known for wholesale commerce: trucks filled with fruits, vegetables, and meat from the north to be sold in the area and wholesale.  The climate is cold and dry with strong winds from the cordillera.

José is short and dark and has short black hair.  His native language is Aymara and he speaks Spanish for cultural reasons and in his business.  He lives with his parents, who are merchants, in their brick house that has potable water, electricity, and a sewage system.

His business is making aluminum figures for foosball games.  He learned the trade in a welding course in high school.  He acquired some old molds and got in touch with the foosball manufacturers to offer them his figures.  Currently he supplies clients who make the soccer fields with wood.  "It's a shame that this children's game is losing popularity.  Now children only want to play with electronic games," he said.  His dream is to have a large workshop where he can make other metal crafts.

José wants to build a workshop in his home to have a space where he can work more comfortably.  This is his second loan sequence with the institution in the four years he has been in this line of work.

For those reasons José's requesting a loan to build a room to use as a workshop for aluminum crafts.

loans.use: to build a room to use as a workshop to make aluminum crafts

loans.name: Melody

texts.en: Melody is 37 years old and married with two children  in school.  She works very hard to provide for her family.  Melody runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell (shampoo, noodles, canned goods, sugar, etc.).  Melody has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, noodles, canned goods, and sugar.

loans.name: Maria Betis

texts.es:
María, toda su vida se ha dedicado a vender sandalias, cantaros, ropa y otros productos plásticos, cuenta con un puesto en el mercado municipal desde hace 23 años, trabaja de Lunes a Domingo, de ella dependen económicamente dos personas, hasta la fecha no representa dificultades.
Debido a la temporada navideña María cree que su inventario no cubrirá las necesidades de sus clientes, por lo que requiere un préstamo para comprar sandalias, nuevos estilos de ropa, adornos navideños, etc., de esta manera competirá mejor en el mercado, espera sacar el mejor provecho de la inversión.
Su objetivo es tener un negocio más surtido para tener clientes satisfechos y  mejorar su rentabilidad para que su familia tenga un nivel de vida mucho más confortable.
texts.en: Maria has worked her whole life selling sandals, jugs, clothing and other plastic items. She has had a stall at the municipal market for 23 years. She works from Monday to Sunday. Two other persons depend on her financially, which up to now has not been a problem. Because of the Christmas season, Maria believes her inventory will not cover the needs of her customers. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy sandals, new clothing styles, Christmas ornaments, etc. in order to be more competitive. She hopes to profit from her investment. Her objective is to have a better stocked business in order to have satisfied customers and improve her profitability so that her family has a more comfortable level of life.

loans.use: to buy sandals, new clothing styles, Christmas ornaments, etc., in order to be more competitive.

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Rahila would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rahila can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about her goals, Rahila expressed a desire to use the extra income to provide her family with food and clothing, and in the long run, make more money for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Malika

texts.en: Malika is a goal-oriented woman. She was born in 1996. She lives in a rural area. She is a very kind, generous and hardworking woman. She has a big family. Her grandfather and grandmother are living with them. They are pensioners and have some problems with their health care. Malika is excellent.at her studies. Her mother works hard in a secondary school. She tries to educate her children well. Malika participated in regional and district competitions. She graduated with excellence from secondary school. After graduation, she entered a university. She dreamed of becoming a professional economist. In order to realize Malika’s dream, her father decided to work abroad. But at the moment, she has to pay tuition. They do not have enough money in their savings. All of the savings are spent for everyday life and for the treatment of her grandfather. Her mother tries to work hard but it is not enough to feed the family. Malika needs financial support to pay for her tuition.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: A sus 76 años de edad Rosa tiene 3 hijos pero todos ya viven aparte, Rosa vive con su esposo y juntos se dedican  a la agricultura y la ganadería ya que comenta que fue con estas actividades que pudo criar de una manera adecuada a sus hijos, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca lechera para mejorar su negocio y por medio del ordeño y la venta de la leche percibe  sus ingresos, Rosa espera comprar más ganado y seguir trabajando de una buena manera junto a su esposo
texts.en:
At her age of 76, Rosa has three children, but they all live separately. Rosa lives with her husband, and together they work in agriculture and livestock raising, since she comments that it was with these activities that she was able to raise her children in a suitable manner. 

She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of a milk cow to improve her business. Through milking and the sale of milk, she receives her income. 

Rosa hopes to buy more livestock and continue working in a good way, along with her husband.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en: Zahra is a 48-year-old widow who lives in Southern Ghour, Jordan. She has six members in her family. After the death of her husband, she faced financial and economic difficulties. To provide a good life for her family, Zahra worked to set up a small project by buying metal barrels. The barrels are used to fill with water needed for construction processes. She rents the drums for construction of small projects. She is applying for a loan to help her pay for the metal barrels.

loans.use: To buy metal barrels

loans.name: Jose Tulio

texts.es: José, utilizo el préstamo anterior en cubrir todos los gastos relacionados con el cultivo de granos básicos, ha logrado tener una abundante cosecha, pero está solicitando ayuda con un nuevo crédito para pagar los gastos de la recolección de la cosecha, pues en este momento está enfrentado dificultades económicas y no tiene  los recursos necesarios para llevar a cabo dichos trabajos. Espera administrar bien el crédito para recuperar con ganancias la inversión.
texts.en: José used the previous loan to cover all the expenses related to raising basic grains. He has managed to have an abundant harvest, but he is requesting help from a new loan in order to pay the expenses of collecting the harvest, since at this time he is facing difficult economic conditions, and he doesn't have the necessary resources to finish these tasks. He hopes to administer the loan well in order to recover the investment with his earnings.

loans.use: to pay the expenses of collecting the harvest

loans.name: Sina's Group

texts.en:
A mother of five children living in Siem Reap province, Sina is 45 years old. For her family condition, she grows rice as the main source of income and raises pigs to supplement her income. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns about 30,000 KHR per day. This is her sixth cycle with VisionFund, as she has fully repaid her past loans.

She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy more land. She will use this to run a new business of growing cassava. She hopes that she can get more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more land for growing cassava.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab is a maize farmer from Kiyawa village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Zainab would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Zainab can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Zainab, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for her family, and hopes to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Clara Clemencia

texts.es: Clemencia tiene 43 años de edad,  ella es soltera y tiene 4 hijos, de 7, 13, 16 y 20 años de edad mismos de los cuales los 3 menores se encuentren estudiando, Clemencia se dedica al comercio de leche, a la agricultura, a la ganadería y a tejer prendas de vestir de lana, comenta que sus tejidos los realiza desde hace 15 años atrás, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de lana para repartirlo a otrás señoras que le ayudan a la elaboración de las prendas para después entregarlos a las personas que le hacen el pedido, Clemencia comenta que esta trabajando para mas adelante comprar su casa para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Clemencia is 43 years old. She is single and has four children, ages 7, 13, 16, and 20. The three younger ones are in school. 

Clemencia works in selling milk, agriculture, livestock raising, and knitting articles of clothing from wool. She comments that she has been making her knitted items for 15 years. She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of wool to distribute to other women who help her make the articles of clothing, to later turn them over to the people who placed orders with her. 

Clemencia comments that she is working so that in the future she can buy her house for her children.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Om- Solyman Group

texts.en:
This group, Om-Solyman, consists of four women from Hodeidah City, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 90,000 YER from AMB.

Samia is the leader of the group. She is a 20-year-old married woman with a secondary school education. Her husband works as a motorcycle driver with a daily wage and she works as a beautician in her house. She has been with this business for more than two years. The beginning started by one opinion from her girlfriend to take one course in this business and start working. She is now a professional but doesn't have enough equipment to attract more customers. As a result, she asked for a loan of 30,000 YER in order to purchase beautician materials to expand her business. Samia looks forward to opening a beauty Salon in her area.

loans.use: to purchase beautician materials to expand her business.

loans.name: Maria Aurora

texts.es: Aurora es una señora de 43 años de edad, tiene 3 hijas, una de 10 la otra de 14  y la mayor de 20 años, las 2 hijas menores se encuentran estudiando,  Aurora esta casadas y  junto a su esposo se dedica a la ganadería y a la agricultura este crédito lo va  a invertir en la compara de vacona para tenerla hasta que se haga vaca y luego realizar la venta de la leche, Aurora aspira de este negocio el mejorarlo y seguir trabajando para darles la educación a sus hijos y que lleguen a ser unos buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Aurora is a woman of 43. She has three daughters, one who is 10, another who is 14, and the oldest, age 20. The two younger daughters are in school.

Aurora is married, and along with her husband, she works in raising livestock and agriculture. She is going to invest this loan in the purchase of a heifer, to keep until it is a cow, and then sell its milk. 

Aurora hopes to improve her business and continue working in order to educate her children, and she hopes that they will become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Hannatu

texts.en: Hannatu is a maize farmer from Kiyawa village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hannatu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hannatu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Hannatu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for her family, and hopes to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Salamatu Samaila

texts.en: Salamatu Samaila is a maize farmer from the Kiyawa village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Salamatu Samaila would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest in order to cater to her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Salamatu Samaila can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Salamatu Samailai, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for her family.  She hopes to ensure that her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Saikal

texts.en:
Saikal is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Economics. Here is her story:

“My name is Saikal and I am 19. Nine years ago my parents divorced. I live with my mother and my sister. My father has another family and doesn’t keep in touch with us. My mother is such a person, who keeps the world turning. Not only was she able to raise us alone, but she also gave us an opportunity to go to the kindergarten and school. My mother is a teacher in our village and says that education promotes individual freedom and empowerment and yields important development benefits. Yet millions of children and adults remain deprived of educational opportunities, many as a result of poverty. That’s why she wanted to give us a good education and still does her best.

I studied at a simple school in the village, but had a great desire to enter one of the best universities in order to build a bright future. One year ago I was a finalist of AUCA’s full Scholarship for the one-year-study program at New Generation Academy. There were 70 students from different parts of Kyrgyzstan who, like me, came from a poor family but were lucky to win this award. It allows us to study, live, and eat for free. As a result, I understood the value of the education, which allows you to work where you want, travel where you want, and makes you confident of your bright future.

New Generation Academy made great changes in me and in my view for life. My big dream at the present is to get a degree, gain good knowledge in my sphere, and find my place in this huge world. AUCA is the place where I can get all of them, a place where I feel myself at home, a place, where I am respected by my lovely friends and brilliant teachers. I kindly ask Kiva lenders to help me with my tuition fee so that I may continue studying just as before.”

loans.use: to pay for higher education.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sugar, meat, etc.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
Gulchehra is a strong woman from the northern part of the country. She lives in a rural area and is divorced. She is a hardworking, responsive, generous, patient, and active person. She has worked in a factory for about three years.

Gulchehra is planning to renovate her house and make better living conditions. The annual income cannot cover all needed expenditures. Gulchehra is trying her best to be an exemplary worker. She requires financial support to buy building materials for repairing her house.

loans.use: to buy building materials for repairing a house.

loans.name: Hauwa Samaila

texts.en: Hauwa Samaila is a maize farmer from Kiyawa village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hauwa Samaila would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hauwa Samaila can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Hauwa Samaila, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for her family, and hopes to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en: Dauda is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Dauda would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Dauda can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Dauda expressed a desire to use the extra income to provide his family with food and clothing, and in the long run, make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Andrew

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ngọt

texts.en:
Ngọt works in the agriculture sector, farming poultry and cattle. Ngọt has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Ngọt is 56 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2015, Ngọt joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Ngọt has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Ngọt faces in her life is not having a water tank and water filter. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, water pipes, and a water meter to build a water tank and clean water filter.

In the future, Ngọt hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, water pipes, and a water meter to build a water tank and clean water filter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home to improve her family's sanitation.

loans.name: Irma De La Cruz

texts.es:
La venta ambulante de mercancía ha representado para Irma una manera de sacar su familia adelante, ella es muy rebuscadora y perseverante, es madre cabeza de familia y sostiene a su familia que la terminan de conformar sus dos hijos lo que la tiene tan motivada y alegre es que uno de sus hijos ha pasado a la universidad lo que representa para ella gran orgullo y un compromiso de mejorar su negocio para dar abasto a los gastos que requerirá esta nueva etapa para su familia. 
Irma solicita un monto considerable para la compra de mercancía en ropa para hombre y dama para salir todos los días a recorrer calles y almacenes buscando una venta.
texts.en:
Selling merchandise as a street vendor has allowed Irma to support her family. She is hardworking and has perseverance. She is a mother and the breadwinner of the family, and supports her family made up of two children. 

What keeps her motivated and happy is that one of her children has gone to college. This gives her great pride and means a commitment to improve her business in order to cope with the expenses that will be required in this new stage for her family. 

Irma is a requesting a considerable amount for the purchase of men and women’s clothing merchandise in order to go out everyday to sell on the streets and in markets looking for business.

loans.use: To buy men and women’s clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, beans, maize flour, bananas, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking .

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is a 25-year-old single factory worker who lives with her parents in the Kampong Chhnang province of Cambodia. She has been a factory worker since 2005. Her parents are rice farmers and they also make bamboo baskets and other containers to sell. Together, they can make an income of $10 a day.

This is Sokha's second loan cycle; she used her first loan to buy a motorcycle to commute to work with her brother. Since, in her present house, the palm-leaf walls are old, she would like to request a loan to buy zinc sheets to renovate the walls in her house. This loan will provide her and her family with better living conditions.

For her future plan, Sokha wants to buy piglets to fatten.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets to renovate the walls in her house

loans.name: Nhóm 05, Bái Đa, Vạn Hòa, Nông Cống Group

texts.en:
Phước works in the agriculture sector raising livestock. She is requesting a loan to purchase young livestock to raise and sell in the future.

Phước is 48 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the Nhóm 05, Bái đa, Vạn Hòa, Nông Cống solidarity group. 

In 2010, Phước joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Phước has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Phước has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Phước faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Phước hopes to maintain a successful business, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase young livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is from Estancia, Iloilo. She is married with three children: two are adults, while the youngest is nine.

Fifteen years ago, Liberty started financing a fishing businesses. She usually buys fuel for the fishermen's boats and, in return, she is given a share of their income as a form of payment. She is asking a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy more fuel to continue investing in them.

This will allow her to help the people in her community and, at the same time, she will also be able to earn a living. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and make it more successful.

loans.use: to buy fuel like gasoline

loans.name: Trung

texts.en:
Trung works in the agriculture sector, farming poultry and cattle. Trung is 50 years old and married with 3 children. She lives with 3 dependents in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Trung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Trung has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Trung has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Trung faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profits, Trung Dư hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family

loans.name: Osiel

texts.es:
Osiel, solicita un más capital que utilizara para comprar bujías, cables, pastillas para frenos, luces, entre otro tipo de repuestos para vehículos, de esta manera reparara su vehículo propio y los que ha adquirido para su negocio. 
Con la ayuda que ha recibido del proyecto Kiva sus ingresos son mayores, la familia se mantiene igual, pero con un nivel de vida más confortable y se ha ganado la preferencia de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Osiel is asking for more capital that he will use to buy spark plugs, cables, brake pads, lights and other vehicle parts, so he can repair his own vehicle and others he has acquired through his business. 

With the support he has received through the Kiva project, his income is higher, his family remains the same but lives a more comfortable life – and he has earned the trust of his customers.

loans.use: to buy spark plugs, cables, brake pads, lights and other vehicle parts.

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en: Rahila is a maize farmer from Kiyawa village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Rahila would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rahila can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Rahila, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for her family, and hopes to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en:
Ishrat is responsible mother of six children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilitation by driving a van for many years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. 

Her husband needs to buy a used new van because the current condition of his van is not good - it requires more maintenance work on daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to buy a used van for his transportation services. Therefore Ishrat has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan Ishrat's husband can afford the cost of purchasing a used van easily. In this way he can provide better transport services to earn a profitable income. Ishrat also plans to establish a savings with the profit of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future. Ishrat is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: buy a used van for her husband's transportation services

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Liliana es una mujer casada de 33 años de edad, honesta, honrada y trabajadora propietaria de una tienda donde tiene un flujo común de ventas, pero su idea es surtir más su negocio para no estar siempre esperando las mismas ganancias que es lo que le ha pasado últimamente, solicita un crédito para poder prosperar y llevar su tienda a otro nivel tanto en surtido como en ventas. 
Con la ayuda del crédito comprara surtido de víveres que anteriormente no vendía, refrescos, cervezas, dulces y chocolates.
texts.en:
Liliana is a 33-year-old, married woman who is honest, trustworthy and hardworking. She is the owner a store where she has a normal flow of sales, but her idea is to stock her business more in order to not always make the same profit – which is what has happened lately. 

She is asking for a loan in order to grow and bring her store to another level both in selection and profit. With the help of this loan, she will buy an assortment of groceries that she previously did not sell, soft drinks, beers, sweets and chocolates.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of groceries, soft drinks and beer.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a maize farmer from Kiyawa village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Mary would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs. Mary, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide her family with food and clothing, and hopes to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Binafsha

texts.en:
Binafsha is a strong woman. She was born in 1995 and lives in a rural area. Binafsha is married. She is a housekeeper, and wants to start a business. Her husband will help her to do business. 

Binafsha is planning to buy and sell livestock. She is an experienced woman, and can keep and feed cattle. She needs the start-up capital for opening her business and so is asking for a loan to buy cattle to start her activity.

loans.use: to buy cattle for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase their food stock.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is a 58-year-old married father of six children and a Palestinian man who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. He started working in farming 24 years ago to cover the needs and expenses of his family. He gained experience in this domain from his father. Abdullah has worked hard throughout the years to develop this business, but he is always suffering from the limited customers and the seasonal cultivation.

Abdullah is trying desperately to improve his family's living conditions inside the camp, thus he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate his house and make it a healthier place for his family. Abdullah hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and stay capable of providing his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his house inside the refugee camp and make it a healthier place for his family.

loans.name: Manuchehr

texts.en: Manuchehr is a handsome man. He was born in 1994 and is from the southern part of Tajikistan. He is single and he lives with his family. He studies at university, majoring in customs. Manuchehr is a third year student and actively participates in classes. He studies excellently, but he needs financial support for paying tuition costs for the third course. Manuchehr is asking for a loan to pay for tuition.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Lilybeth

texts.en:
Lilybeth, a hardworking widow and businesswoman is 50 years old. She lives in Dipolog, in the Philippines. Lilybeth has always dreamed of living with a simple yet decent house for her family. She used her small savings from her retailing business, from which she earns a good income, to start the renovation of her house. Lilybeth has had the business for 12 years now. 

She has recently signed up her membership in Paglaum MPC, after she learned that she can access insurance and financial assistance. She applied for a loan to purchase additional floor tiles and bags of cement for her house. She is now on her way to repaying the loan with her profit. Lilybeth wishes nothing more than to live  a comfortable and happy life with her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase additional floor tiles and bags of cement for her house

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda operates a motor transport business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. For her to continue her business, she availed herself a loan to pay for motor spare parts and engine overhauling. She dreams to own motor units and to be able to provide for the family.

loans.use: to pay for motor spare parts and engine overhauling

loans.name: Delyna

texts.en:
Delyna is 39 years old and married. She is from Dapitan, Philippines. Delyna has had a snack vending business for 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP each month doing this type of activity. This is how she has helped her husband in sustaining their needs. 

Delyna wants to provide her family with a simple yet comfortable living space for all of them. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase nails, additional sticks, and plywood for her house. Delyna recently became an active member of PMPC. Now, she is on her way to repairing her house.

loans.use: to purchase nails, additional sticks, and plywood for her house

loans.name: Caps Group

texts.en: Hmangaikim is the featured borrower of the group, pictured with her hand raised. She is 29 years old and a mother of one boy. She lives with her husband and in-laws in Churachandpur. As a hardworking mother, wife and daughter-in-law, she started running a business selling used clothes along the roadside in the hopes of building a better financial future for the family. Her husband is engaged in computer work and has been the main source of income for the family. Hmangaikim buys used clothes and resells them to customers for income generation, which supplements her husband’s income. Selling and buying used clothes is very popular in the area because it is cheap and people can easily afford to buy them. Winter clothes are costly and customers flock to buy used clothes, especially during this season. The income that she gets from selling used clothes is spent on providing the basic needs of her son and other household needs. Her in-laws are also supported by them. With the Kiva loan, she will buy stock of used clothes for reselling purposes. She is very glad to avail a loan from Kiva that can be repaid in affordable instalments. She thanks the lenders for their unending support and hope for success in her business. The rest of the group members are engaged in similar businesses to support themselves with the Kiva loan. They are all very excited and happy to avail a Kiva loan.

loans.use: To buy stock of used clothes to resell for income generation purposes.

loans.name: Maa Gaden Group

texts.en:
This Self Help Group (SHG) named Gaden was formed in May 2014 by 10 active and able women of Saradhapur village in the Nuapada district of Odisha, India. One of the members of this group is Dipika who has her hand raised in the photo. She is 24 years old and her family consists of her husband and a child.
 
Dipika has been running a mixture making and supply business in her house with the help of her husband for the last seven years. Mixture is possibly one of the most popular evening snack recipes in India. There are many variations to the classic mixture recipe with different ingredients that can be added. In a week, Dipika supplies around 100 kgs of mixture to the retailers. Her husband supplies mixture to the retailers of 10 nearby villages within a 10 km radius. Dipika earns a monthly income of 8,000 INR, which is not sufficient to materialize her dream. Dipika says looking into better quality and packing, there is a lot of demand from the locality but owing to less production due to the lack of stock of ingredients, she is not able to meet their demands. So by availing a loan of 12,000 INR through her SHG, she wants to buy more stock of ingredients to increase her production level to meet the demand and grab her customers.  Dipika will use the present loan to purchase raw materials like oil, besan (dough), peanuts, roasted gram, curry leaves, hing, soda, sugar, cashew nuts, etc. in bulk, which will reduce her purchasing and transportation costs. She can also produce mixture for a longer period.  Dipika is hopeful that this investment will definitely help her to get more income to materialize her dreams of the best education for her child, constructing a good house, purchasing some gold and helping her family to lead a better lifestyle. The other nine active members of the group are also doing small businesses like vegetable vending, Tiffin stall, poultry farm etc.

loans.use: To purchase oil, besan (dough), peanuts, roasted gram, curry leaves, hing, soda, sugar, and cashew nuts for mixture production.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra  is 45 years old and a married woman. The man shown in the photo is Azra’s son who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. 

He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Azra  has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR for her son. He wants to buy new tires with some auto spare parts. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Azra  is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some auto spare parts.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia  is a 31-year-old vigorous married woman. She is a mother of two children. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for many years with her husband who is also shown in the photo.  She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong.  

But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband does not earn enough to support his family well alone. Razia ’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household.  

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, pearls, and needles to meet orders time after time for gaining profits and covering household expenses efficiently.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, pearls, and needles to meet orders time after time for gaining profits and covering household expenses efficiently.

loans.name: Sara Yolanda

texts.es:
Sara de 39 años de edad estudió hasta 6°grado de educación básica, está felizmente casada, su esposo es agricultor de granos básicos, fruto de esa relación tienen dos hijos de 4 y 15 años de edad y ambos asisten a la escuela.

Sara es comerciante se ha dedicado desde tenía 12 años a la venta ambulante, su madre le enseñó y todos los días se dedica a vender casa por casa pan dulce, huevos, y frutas y verduras, negocio en el que con la ayuda de Dios le ha obtenido muy buenos resultados.

Necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para vender  así aprovechar la época de navidad y año nuevo en la que gracias a su experiencia consigue mejores ganancias que en cualquier otra época del año.

El sueño de Sara es seguir trabajando y así poder siempre obtener buenos ingresos que le permitan a ella y a su familia gozar de una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sara is 39 years old and studied through the sixth grade of her basic education. She is happily married and her husband is a farmer who cultivates basic grains. They have two children, ages 4 and 15. Both of them attend school.

Sara is a merchant who has been selling for 12 years as a street vendor. Her mother taught her this trade and now she spends every day selling sweet bread, eggs, fruits, and vegetables by going to house to house. With the help of God, she has been able to obtain good results from her business.

Sara needs a loan in order to buy merchandise that she can sell for the Christmas and New Years seasons. Thanks to her experience, she can achieve profits that are better than any other time of the year.

Sara's dream is to keep working so that she can always have a good income, which will allow her and her family to enjoy a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, and bread to sell for Christmas and New Years.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis trabaja como cocinero de pizza hace más de 1 año, está estudiando para ser maestro en ciencias básicas.
Comenta que su aspiración es seguir enriqueciendo sus conocimientos profesionales.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, y de esa forma seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Luis has been working as a pizza cook for more than one year. He is also studying to become a basic sciences teacher. Luis says that his aspiration is to keep enriching himself with professional knowledge.

He is requesting this loan so that he can cover his degree expenses. As a result, he will be able to continue his studies.

loans.use: to pay his degree expenses.

loans.name: Najam Unnisa

texts.en: Najam Unnisa is a 46-year-old married woman. She is involved in the stitching business, and she is famous for her stitching within her community. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She has accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their household and the educational needs of their 4 children. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors to meet the increasing demand of her business. Najam Unnisa hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad  is a 40-year-old married woman. She is running a business of milk selling with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. 

Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  Shamshad’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. 

However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Shamshad  has requested 45,000 PKR  to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers and earn a good amount of revenue for providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers and earn good amount of revenue  to provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.name: Abdel Azeez

texts.en:
Abdel Azeez is a 31-year-old married man from Deir el Balah city. He is a father for one son and one daughter. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income is barely cover all the family needs.

He took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. By taking this loan, Abdel will be able to provide hot water without using electricity. 

Abdel appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for his house

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 59 years old. He is married with 7 children between the ages of 11 and 33 years, and all of his children go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 7 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for his maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers to increase his maize production.

loans.name: Gaj Laxmi Group

texts.en:
In November 2014, 11 active ladies of Sinapali village of the Nuapada district of Odisha, India came out with an intention to add some extra income to their families through their efforts and formed a Self Help Group named Maa Gajlaxmi. Chanchala (B) is one of them. The lady with the red-colored sari sitting in front with her hand raised in the photo is Chanchala (B). She is a very active and cheerful woman of 26 years age. Her family consists of her husband and two children.

Chanchala (B) is running a tailoring center with the help of her husband for the last eight years. Her husband stitches ladies and gents dresses and school uniforms. She also helps her husband in hand stitching and other works. The neighbors and the local community are the regular customers of her tailoring center.
