She earns a minimum of 200 INR every day, which is not sufficient for managing the day to day expenses of her four-member family along with family expenses. So Chanchala (B) wants to raise her income by increasing the volume of the tailoring center by adding two sewing machines. With the present loan, she plans to purchase a pico machine, one sewing machine and sewing materials such as fabric, some zippers, buttons, threads and hangers. This loan will provide the necessary resources to complete her work on time to meet the customers' demands and also add some extra income for her family. Chanchala (B) has a strong desire to give a better education to her children and construct a separate cabin for her tailoring center. She has a dream of giving her family a bright future through her hard work.

The other 10 members of the group are also running small enterprises like tailoring, carpentry, puffed rice selling, general grocery shop and vegetable cultivation.

loans.use: To purchase a pico machine, one sewing machine and sewing materials such as fabric, some zippers, buttons, threads and hangers.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en: Artur previously borrowed money from Kiva lenders to renovate his bar-cafe (see "previous loan details" below). He has successfully repaid that loan, so he is now seeking a loan to make basic repairs to the existing family home. Artur has been photographed with his wife Pranvera or "Spring" in English.

loans.use: to make basic renovations to the family home.

loans.name: Salima

texts.ru: Салима женщина 62 лет. Она жительница сельской местности кишлака Сугдиён Шахристанского района. Она пенсионерка. Салима женщина трудолюбивая занимается животноводством. Она сотрудничает с МДО Арванд с 2012года. Она хочет развести несколько крупно рогатых скотов, но для этого не хватает собственных средств. Она подала заявку на кредит и надеется на благополучный результат.
texts.en: Salima is a 62-year-old woman. She is a resident of a rural area, Sugd province of the Shahriston district. She is retired. Salima is a hardworking woman, involved in animal husbandry. She has been partnering with MDO Arvand since 2012. She wants to fatten up several cows, but does not have enough of her own means to do so. She requested a loan and hopes for a positive result.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening up

loans.name: Maa Maheswari Group

texts.en:
Maa Maheswari Self Help Group (SHG) was formed in November 2014 consisting of 12 rural poor women who belong to the Below Poverty Line category. This group is located in a remote rural village named Sagunbhadi in the Nuapada district of Odisha, India. As this village is situated on the riverbank, vegetable cultivation and vending is the primary source of livelihood of most of the members of this group. Kasturi is also one of them. The lady sitting in front with her hand raised is Kasturi. She is a very energetic lady of 31 years.

Kasturi has a vegetable cultivation farm of one hectare. She and her husband manage the farm. Her husband is an active and cheerful farmer. They produce vegetables like brinjal, cauliflower, carrot, cabbage, chili, cucumber, papaya, ladies finger, onions, etc. on the farm. She sells her products to the traders of the nearest town who come to take vegetables from her farm. Kasturi says that she earns a minimum of 5,000 INR per month from this business, which is insufficient to meet the day to day expenses of her family as well as the farm expenses. Kasturi wants to expand her business by taking a loan from Kiva through Mahashakti Foundation. She will use the present loan to buy a water pump to lift water from the river, fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for her farm. She expects a good return from her business by expanding her cultivation. Kasturi dreams of constructing a house and purchasing a bike for her husband, which will help him to do the business very efficiently. She also hopes to give her whole family a bright future through her hard work.
 
The other 11 members of this group are also involved in businesses like vegetable cultivation, general grocery shop, vegetable vending, puffed rice business, etc.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump to lift water from the river, fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: This loan will be used to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home to improvement of access to water and sanitation their family

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem  is a 45-year-old married woman doing a business of animals’ purchase and sale with the help of her husband for many years. 

Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food, and clothing.  She also sells milk in her locality to generate an extra amount of income. 

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount  to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater for more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater for more customers.

loans.name: Bakht

texts.en:
Bakht  is 57 years old; she is a married woman.  She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. 

She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. 

For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000  to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales and expand her business and income level.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz is 44 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking, and she happily supports her family with the income she generates. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo in order to inflate her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to inflate her milk sales.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida  is a 47-year-old hardworking woman who has four children. She has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality with the support of her husband who is also shown in the photo.

She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Sajida’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. 

Sajida  has requested a loan amount 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan  to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en: Tasleem is a 47-year-old married woman who has been running a school for fourteen years. After years of struggle and hard work, today her school boasts over 300 students. Tasleem has always emphasized the quality of education imparted at her school and goes to great lengths to ensure that the children at her school are learning. Tasleem needs a loan of 100,000 PKR to buy chairs and desks for her students and to repair her existing furniture to provide her students with a comfortable learning environment. Tasleem believes the key to success is hard work, and that is something she is used to.

loans.use: to buy chairs and desks for her students and to repair her existing furniture to provide her students with a comfortable learning environment.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
Muhabbat is a strong woman. She was born in a rural area. She lives in a village. She is married. She has four children. Her husband works abroad as an emigrant.

 Muhabbat is starting an agro-business. For opening a new business she was supported by her husband. She wants to enlarge her activity. She was taught in training how to run a business. 

Muhabbat wants to help her husband and invest her gain in the  budget of the family for the future to give education to her children and earn a stable income. She is asking for financial support for buying livestock for increasing working capital.

loans.use: To buy livestock for increasing working capital

loans.name: Nafisa

texts.en:
Nafisa is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1967. She lives in a village. She is married. She has four children. Her husband is an entrepreneur. She is a sewer. Her daughter-in-law helps her to do a business. She sews traditional dresses for women. She has satisfied clients. 

Nafisa wants to widen her activity. She is planning to buy a new sewing machine. She tries to gain a good income, in order to make better her standard of living. By the way Nafisa thinks that her activity will help the prosperity of her family. She is asking for financial support to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Sadfinaz

texts.en:
Sadfinaz is a 40-year-old married woman and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a small house inside the Palestinian refugee camp  with her husband and his parents. She opened seven years ago a grocery shop to help her husband who is suffering from weak eyesight in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Sadfinaz is working hard to develop her business and improve her family's living condition; thus she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new requested products to satisfy her customers' needs. This loan will help Sadfinaz improve her social and financial living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with new requested products to satisfy her customers' needs

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida  is 54 years old; she is a married woman.  She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. 

She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. 

For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase more animals to inflate her sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales and profits.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is thankful that she was granted a PHP 20,000 loan which she used to buy clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics that she sells. She is glad that through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. Delia is also into "ube" ( yam) making business which is a favorite native delicacy among the Filipinos.

She would like now to apply for PHP 25,000 which she will use to buy large quantities of yam to cook sweet ube to sell. Part of the loan she will use to buy some personal products such as clothing, footwear and cosmetics. She has to meet the increased orders for her "ube" and her personal products especially this Christmas season. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her. She wishes everyone a Blessed Christmas!

Delia believes her business will continue to flourish to uplift and improve their lives. She prays for financial freedom and a quiet life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for  "ube" (yams) to make and sell cooked sweet ube and pay for personal products that she directly sells.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: María de 53 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de piñatas, centros de mesa, recuerdos para eventos como quince años, bodas, bautizos, etc., además vende productos como papelería, pegamento, alambre, etc. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y su nieta de 14 años de la que es responsable, ya que su hija se encuentra en el extranjero para tratar de darle mejores condiciones de vida. María desea invertir en su negocio ya que en época de fin de año se celebran muchos eventos y ya cuenta con encargos de recuerdos y centros de mesa que son algunas de las manualidades que vende, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: papel, alambre, figuras de novios, bebés, quinceañeras, entre otros productos para poder elaborar las diferentes manualidades que le solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria, 53, is an enterprising woman who earns a living selling 'piñatas', table decorations, and souvenirs for special occasions such as 15th birthday parties, weddings, christenings, etc.  She also sells stationery goods, glue, wire, etc.  

She lives in her own home with her husband and their 14-year-old granddaughter.  She is responsible for her at the moment as her daughter is currently abroad trying to make a better living to support her.  

Maria would like to invest in her business as at this time of year there are many special celebrations and she already has orders for souvenirs and table decorations.  These are some of the crafts that she sells.  

She is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy paper, wire, figures of the bride and groom, figures of babies, 15th birthday goods, among other things so that she can make the different types of products that her customers are asking her for.

loans.use: to buy paper, wire, bride and groom and baby figures and other similar products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a water source at their home to improve her family's access to water and sanitation

loans.name: Njei

texts.en:
Njei is a widowed woman who has no children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are  household consumables.

For over ten years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a divorced woman with four children, all of whom attend school and are under her care. They live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Jennifer has operated a clothes selling business for the past three years. She sells at the market to her town dwellers and her neighbors. She cites her major challenge as competition and seasonality. 

With the loan she is requesting of 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of Khangas (African traditional cloth) for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khangas for resale

loans.name: Muhayanti

texts.en:
Muhayanti is 29 years old and married. She lives with her husband and her children. She is a chicken farmer and her husband is driver. She was pleased to be able to help her husband to improve and have a better life.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 2,500,000 rupiah. This loan will be used to buy and build a water source at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family. She wants to have access to safe sanitation for her family. Her family income is still not enough to build toilets and water resources with cash, but they are able to repay loans received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of lenders.

loans.use: to buy and build a water source at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Layal Al- Anoor Group

texts.en:
This group is called Layal Al-Anoor. It consists of four women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 90,000 YER from AMB.
Safia is a 49-year-old divorced woman and the mother of 11 children. She lives with them in a simple house in Hodeidah city. She is an uneducated woman but is very active and dynamic. After she got divorced, she became the sole breadwinner for her children. In order to provide her children with their daily needs, she decided to start her own business through selling women's clothes door-to-door. She has been in this humble business for more than two years. The income from this business is very low and not enough to cover the necessities of her large family. She wants to enlarge her business but she doesn't have enough money to do so. Therefore, she applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to buy stylish and new fabrics and ready-made women's clothes to sell to her customers. With this loan, Safia hopes to improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: to buy stylish and new fabrics and ready -made women's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Inga

texts.en:
Inga, a 40-year-old married woman, lives in the village of Vashlevi, Georgia. She and her husband have three, and her husband is a private worker and earns a small salary. In addition, the family earns a living with agricultural activity. Inga takes care of the milk cow, produces milk products for local trading, and also cultivates a family-owned land. Even so, the family doesn't have enough income to meet normal living conditions and cover even basic needs. 
As a result, Inga requested a loan from local financial institutions several times to help her expand her agribusiness, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because the creditors did not find the existing family income to be sufficient to approve the loan. According to Credo's estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The startup loan program gives provisions for business startups and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who, regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income, do not have access to credit products. With the receives credit, Inga will purchase bulls and make them work for barging the firewood. The family will provide their and nearby villages with firewood and will be able to generate more income, especially during the season. The loan will be great support to this hard-working couple as the family members will increase their living condition.

loans.use: to purchase bulls and start selling firewood.

loans.name: Valbona

texts.en: Valbona added some sheep with your previous help and now she is requesting your help again but to add another dairy cow instead. She's been trying to establish a mini-farm.

loans.use: to add another dairy cow to her herd of dairy cows

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen  is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting business of tailoring at her home as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. 

Parveen  is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. 

Therefore, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000. With the requested loan, she wants  to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.name: Marthan

texts.en:
Marthan  is a 61-year=old married woman. She is a mother of four children. She has been doing a business of animal sale and purchase for many years with the support of her husband. She earns a good amount of income through her work to meet her family expenditures. 

Now, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount  to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living through all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.ru:
Хафиза проживает в городке Душанбе. У нее трое детей, два сына и дочь. Дети учатся в средней школе. Воспитанием детей занята Хафиза. Ее муж находиться на заработках в Российской Федерации. Хафиза 6 лет назад научилась кроить и шить женскую одежду. Научиться этому делу ей далось нелегко, но она быстро освоила, чтобы скорее начать зарабатывать и улучшить финансовое состояние семьи. Хафиза ждала когда муж отправить им денег. Сейчас Хафиза сама зарабатывает, немного, но хватает для покрытия не предвиденных расходов детей.
   На данный момент Хафизе необходимо поменять машинку, чтобы не потерять источник дохода. Нынешняя машинка не выполняет свои функции достаточно хорошо. Она просит кредита для купли швейной машинки. Также на оставшуюся часть денег Хафиза купить ткани для шитья.
texts.en: Hafiza lives in the city of Dushanbe. She has three children - two sons and a daughter. Her children attend a secondary school. Hafiza is involved in raising her children. Her husband works in the Russian Federation. Hafiza learned how to cut and sew women's clothing 6 years ago. It was not easy for her to learn this trade, but she learned it quickly in order to start earning money sooner and improve her family's financial situation. Hafiza used to wait for her husband to send them money and now Hafiza earns money by herself, some, but enough to cover her children's unplanned expenses. At the present time, Hafiza needs to replace her sewing machine to retain her income source. Her current machine does not perform all the functions well. She is requesting a loan to buy a new sewing machine. Hafiza also wants to use the rest of the sum to buy fabrics for sewing.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabrics for sewing

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 44 years old. He is married with 5 children between the ages of 7 and 26 years, and all of them go to school. James is a farmer and has been farming for 6 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for his maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers to increase his maize production.

loans.name: Fabiola Rosario

texts.es: Fabiola es una señora muy alegre,  ella vive en el campo y se dedica a la crianza de animales, su esposo trabaja de conserje en una escuela,  Fabiola tiene  4 hijos mismos de los cuales 2 aun viven con ella y están estudiando,  ella va a invertir el crédito en la compra de terneros, Fabiola espera de este negocio mejorarlo y trabajar duro para que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y asi tengan un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Fabiola is a very cheerful woman who lives in the countryside and raises animals.  Her husband works as a school caretaker.  

She has four children; two of them are still living with her and are studying at the moment.  

She wants to invest the loan in buying calves.  She hopes to improve this business and work hard so that her children can finish their studies and have a better future.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Muzamil

texts.en: Muzamil is a 32-year-old married woman who has been successfully running a school for 2 years. Motivated and hard working, Muzamil wanted to contribute to the cause of education at a young age. Today, there are over 150 students in her school. Muzamil wants to grow her business and invest in her school to make it a place where students can learn and grow. She has requested a loan of 100,000 PKR to purchase furniture and stationery stock in order to provide better facilities for her students.

loans.use: to purchase furniture and stationery stock in order to provide better facilities for her students.

loans.name: Fadya

texts.en: Fadya is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Gaza. To increase the family's income, she started to work as tutor at home and she has been doing that work for five years. She is one of the affected people from the last war in Gaza. Her house was destroyed, and she would like to repair it again. For these reasons, she has requested a loan from Ryada to purchase cement, other building materials, and paint the house. Fadya is very grateful to everyone who helps her. She hopes to be able to return to her normal life again with her family, and to provide good living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase cement, other building materials, and to paint the house.

loans.name: Diana Marcela

texts.es: Ella es Diana una joven muy trabajadora, tierna, humilde y sencilla que a sus 21 años de edad asume los gastos de su hogar, los cuales lleva con la venta de mercancía como lo es ropa, artículos de decoración, calzado, ropa interior y conjuntos deportivos, su sueño es que su negocio le permita mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y poder estudiar que es su gran sueño pero seguirá trabajando para en un futuro estudiar y poder comprar una vivienda.
texts.en: Diana is a very hard-working, humble, simple young lady who at the age of 21 covers her household expenses with her merchandise sales.  She sells clothing, decorative items, shoes, lingerie and sportswear.  Her dream is that through her business she is able to improve her home and to study.  She will continue to work toward her goal of a future education and of buying a house.

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothing.

loans.name: Inobat

texts.en: Inobat is an active woman. She was born in 1964, she lives in a rural area, and she is married with two children. Her husband works abroad. Inobat sews dresses for women and has had this business for almost four months. She is a sewer, and all her clients are satisfied of her work. She tries to do well-made, attractive and up-to-date clothes. She wants to enlarge her business, but she needs to buy an additional sewing machine.Inobat is asking for financial support to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Sokhean

texts.en: Sokhean is a 35-year-old married mother with three children. She lives in Kampong Chhnang province in Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables since 2009. Two of her children attend school. Her husband is 35 years old and he has a motorcycle with a trailer to run a taxi service. Together, they can make approximately USD 13 per day. Now she would like to request a loan to buy a new door and windows to renovate her house and buy more vegetables to sell. This loan will help her have a nicer house to live in and earn more income from the business. For her children, she will help them to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a new door and windows to renovate her house and to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: María de 34 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida vendiendo ropa para dama, caballero y niños, además vende productos como arreglos para eventos y papelería en su vivienda y lugares cercanos a la misma desde hace 5 años. Ella es una mujer casada que vive con sus 2 hijos de 13 y 9 años de edad y su esposo el cual le apoya con los gastos económicos de su hogar. María desea invertir en su negocio ya que en la temporada navideña las ventas incrementan y ella desea tener la mercadería suficiente para cumplir con la demanda de productos que solicitan sus clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ropa para dama, caballero y niños y de esta manera mejorar sus ventas en esta temporada navideña.
texts.en:
Maria, 34, is an enterprising woman who earns a living selling clothes for women, men and children.  She also sells products as decorations for events and stationery products from her home and also in places nearby.  She has been doing this for five years now.  

She is married and lives with her two children aged 13 and 9, and her husband who she helps take care of the household expenses.  

Maria wishes to invest in her business as during the festive period sales increase and she wants to have enough merchandise to satisfy the customer demand.  That is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy clothes for women, men and children, so that she can improve her sales over the Christmas period.

loans.use: to buy women's, men's and children's clothes.

loans.name: Philip's Group

texts.en:
Philip is a 67-year-old proud father of 6 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very reliable person, and is representing his group of 7 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Philip has noticed that he has learned a lot from the farming trainings provided.

Philip described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, in addition to fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge his phone. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Philip’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en: Shamshad is 52 years old, married, and she has 2 children. Shamshad is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hands, and her skill is known throughout the town. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. This loan will enable her  to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet the orders of her customers on time to earn good amount of profit. This monetary help can take Shamshad closer to her dream of providing a high quality life style for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Noshaba

texts.en: Noshaba is a 32-year-old married woman. Seven years ago, she started her own school. Noshaba's dream is to educate all the children in her community. She continued running the school after getting married, and her husband now helps her with the management of the school. Today, her school has over 150 students. In order to buy and repair chairs and desks for her students, Noshaba has requested a loan of 110,000 PKR. She has worked hard to bring her school to the level it is at today and wants to continue to strive to make her school even better. She does not shy away from the hard work and dedication required to do so, both for her students and for her family.

loans.use: to buy and repair chairs and desks for her students.

loans.name: Salem

texts.en: Salem is 33 years old, married and a father of five children. He lives with his family in a rented house in Sana'a city, Yemen. In the same area where he lives with his family, he has a piece of land on which needs to build. Salem is the sole breadwinner of the family and his income is not enough to build a house on that land. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 400,000 YER  from AMB in order to purchase carpentry and construction materials to build the house. Salem looks forward to building the second floor in his house to enhance his family's life with better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry and construction materials to build a house.

loans.name: Nooran

texts.en: Nooran is 38 years old. She is a housewife and looks after her family, which is comprised of six people. She is well-trained in cloth stitching. She provides stitching services to other people, at her own house. She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for her work, including thread, needles, and cloth. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult. So Nooran is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan, as she requested. Nooran is very thankful to Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and stitching materials for her stitching work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheets, doors, iron bars, floor tiles, cement, etc.

loans.name: Iffat

texts.en: Iffat is a 46-year-old married woman. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. Some years ago, she started her business of tailoring in order to earn income to run her household activities. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She has now requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase spools of threads, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for stitching up more dresses on time. This loan will boost her earnings and Iffat wishes to spend the profits to provide a high quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase spools of threads, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for stitching up more dresses.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 47 years old. She is married with 5 children between the ages of 10 and 27 years, and all of them go to school. She is a farmer and has been farming for 7 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizer for her maize to increase its production. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in same business.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to increase maize production.

loans.name: Malika

texts.en: Malika lives in a rural area of Shahrituz. At the age of 55 years old she is engaged in animal husbandry. She has a husband and three children. Her husband is a farmer worker and her children are studying at school. All members of her family are helping Malika in her business. For three years they have been breeding cattle in their barnyard. The purpose of getting a loan is that Malika would like to increase the quantity of livestock and receive more income. She can realize her goal only with your help.

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora de 48 años de edad que desde muy joven aprendió el arte de bordar manteles con hilos de colores dibujando diferentes formas y figuras, además elabora platillos típicos los cuales vende en su vivienda y son muy buscados por sus clientes por lo deliciosos que son. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos ya mayores de edad. Dora desea invertir en su negocio ya que en estas fechas le buscan bastante los manteles bordados con figuras de pascuas, árboles de navidad entre otros alusivos a la época navideña, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tela, hilos de colores, agujas, etc. Para cumplir con los pedidos de los manteles y de esta manera obtener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Dora, 48, learnt at a very young age how to embroider tablecloths with different colored thread, decorating with a variety of figures and shapes.  She also makes small meals which she sells from her home.  They are very popular with her customers as they are delicious.  

She lives in her own home with her husband and two children who are now adults.  

Dora would like to invest in her business as the Christmas period generates a lot of orders for tablecloths decorated with different images typically representative of this time of year.  

Therefore, she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy cloth, colored thread, needles, etc. so that she can meet the orders and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy cloth, different-colored thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Deysi Patricia

texts.es:
Deisy es una joven brillante, sonriente y energética, que tiene 28 años de edad y un pequeño de tan solo 3 añitos, inicio a mediados del 2014 un negocio de miscelánea ofertando cosméticos, artículos de belleza, de papelería y decoración. 
Como inicio con un capital bajo, en el momento no tiene para surtir su negocio, y al ver que ha tenido buena acogida con el cliente, quiere tomar un riesgo que no había hecho el cual es solicitar un préstamo para la compra de mercancía de papelería y cosméticos.
Soñando poder tener un 2015 lleno de éxitos y buenas ventas.
texts.en:
Deisy is a bright, smiling, energetic young lady who is 28 years old and has a three-year-old son.  In mid-2014 she started a business selling a variety of goods including cosmetics, beauty products, stationery goods and decorative items.

Since she started with only a little capital, for the time being she does not have enough to stock her business.  Having seen an increasing demand she wants to take the risk she had not before and is requesting a loan to buy stationery goods and cosmetics.

Her hope is that 2015 will be bring her success and good sales.

loans.use: To buy stationery goods and cosmetics.

loans.name: Ana Judith

texts.es:
Judith es una empresaria, de gran bagaje que en sus años como independiente ha trabajo siempre promocionando sus productos de aseo y ropa para la familia promocionándolas ah, amigos, allegados y generalmente en su en su barrio, esta actividad le ha permitido apoyar a su esposo en los pagos de los gastos de su hogar, también apoyar en momentos difíciles a sus dos hijos que ya son mayores de edad.
Esta actividad ha significado un impacto emocional enorme pues la hace sentir útil, y ocupada, aparte de que se ejercita y tiene constante movilidad.
A través de un crédito Judith busca consolidar su negocio, comprando mercancía en productos para el hogar y variedad de ropa íntima para hombre y aún más para dama.
texts.en:
Judith is an experienced entrepreneur who throughout her years of independent work has always sold personal care products and clothing.  She has sold to friends, relatives and, generally, in her neighborhood.  This activity has allowed her to support her husband with the household expenses.  She also has been able to help her adults children in times of need.

Her business has had an enormous emotional impact on Judith, making her feel useful and busy.  It also keeps her constantly active.  Through a loan, Judith wants to consolidate her business and buy home products and a variety of men's underwear and more women's lingerie.

loans.use: To buy personal products to improve her lifestyle.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 27-year-old married man from Dier Al-Balah city. He is a father of one son, and he works as an employee in the public sector. There, he earns a low income that is barely able to cover all of the family's needs.
Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to provide hot water without using electricity. Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a water source at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz is 45 years old and is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Shehnaz needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is 24 years old, single, and he lives in a family house in Gaza.  He was able to finish his education to earn a BA, but the weak economic conditions at Gaz don't help to find a job easily, so he works at a mini market in his town. 

Amer is asking Ryada for this loan for maintenance work.  He is one of the affected people from the last war in Gaza, so one side of his house is fully destroyed, and other effects appear when we visit the house. He wants to rebuild the damaged walls and the ceiling and paint the house, install electricity, doors and the windows. Amer is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to rebuild the damaged walls and the ceiling and paint the house, install electricity, doors and the windows.

loans.name: Ronal Enrique

texts.es:
Ronal es un hombre apasionado por los conocimientos, el aprendizaje y la enseñanza, desde hace 15 años es docente de una escuela primaria, donde ha crecido profesional y espiritualmente, pues ha visto como ha dado fruto su trabajo. Él cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa y con la inspiración de su hijo de ocho años de edad, quienes lo han acompañado en su trayecto como profesor y como futuro licenciado en pedagogía. A pesar de todos los años trabajando con niños, desafortunadamente no ha podido obtener su título debido a problemas económicos. 
Pero eso ya no es un obstáculo, a sus 35 años de edad no se da por vencido y actualmente está en quinto año de la universidad, donde ha aprendido nuevas estrategias metodológicas para una enseñanza eficaz. Por lo que solicita un crédito para pagar su título y su graduación. Esto le permitirá convertirse en un licenciado en pedagogía. Entre sus planes está estudiar otra carrera relacionada con la educación y establecer un pequeño negocio para generar otros ingresos.
texts.en:
Ronal is a man who is passionate about learning, knowledge and teaching.  He has been a primary school teacher for 15 years, during which time he has grown both professionally and spiritually, as he has seen how his work matters.  

He has the support of his wife and the inspiration from his eight-year-old son, as he has developed as a teacher and studied to become qualified in teaching.  

Despite working with children for many years, he has never had enough money to pay for his studies in the past.  However, this is no longer an obstacle and at 35, after refusing to give up, he now finds himself in the fifth year at university.  Here, he has learnt new methods for better teaching.  

He is asking for a loan to pay for his final degree and his graduation.  This will allow him to become qualified in teaching.  He also has plans to study another degree related to education and also to set up a small business to generate more income.

loans.use: to pay for his degree and graduation.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en: Marhabo is a strong woman. She was born in 1973, lives in a rural area, and is married with two children. Her husband helps her to do a business. She worked with small cattle (sheep) before, but now she has another business. She has been working in milk production for 3 months now, and she sells milk to people. Selling milk is more profitable than small cattle. In order to increase production of milk, she needs to buy additional big cattle. Marhabo needs financial support to buy a milk cow to improve her new business.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow to improve her new business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 21 years old, single, and a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She has an entrepreneurial spirit and is already doing business at her young age to help her parents support her school needs.

Elena has a direct selling business in which she sells natural health drinks. Filipinos are now more aware about the benefits of natural food and have become health conscious. They are learning to take natural vitamins to support their well-being for the love of their family. Aside from selling vitamins, she also makes and sells cupcakes which have become a favorite snack of the Filipinos. Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, family and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,500 PHP in sales every week.

To help her sustain her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan which she will use to pay for Vita-Plus vitamin drink and to pay for ingredients needed for her cupcake-making business. She has to meet the increased orders of her vitamin drink and cupcakes this Christmas season. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return of her investment and for the financial help that will be given to her. She wishes everyone a Blessed Christmas!

Elena aims to grow her business and pursue her College Degree. She dreams to put up her own bakeshop someday and help her parents support her other siblings in school. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for a natural health drink and ingredients to bake cupcakes to sell.

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es:
Desde muy temprano Rafael sale de su casa a ofrecer productos de limpieza en todo su sector así también los aledaños, con este negocio ha podido sobrevivir y ha podido ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. El crédito anterior le fue de gran soporte ya que lo invirtió en el mismo negocio el cual le permitió incrementar sus ventas, mejorar sus productos y potencializar su clientela. Rafal siempre ha contado con el apoyo de su esposa quien le ha ayudado en manejar las finanzas de su negocio. 
Rafael además de ser emprendedor, trabajador y responsable, también es padre de familia el cual con las ganancias que obtuvo con el primer crédito ha podido mejorar su vivienda por lo tanto le puede garantizar seguridad a sus hijos, así como una mejora calidad de vida y de educación. Rafael solicita su segundo crédito para adquirir más producto de limpieza  de esa manera podrá aumentar sus ventas y así ofrecer más variedad al cliente. Como metas futuras Rafael anhela ser autosuficiente, así como trabajar con su propio capital.
texts.en:
Rafael leaves home each day very early to sell his cleaning products in his own and neighboring areas.  This business has allowed him to survive and offer his family a good standard of living.  His last loan helped him a lot as he was able to invest in his business and increase sales, offer better products and attract more customers.  

Rafael has always had the support of his wife who helps him look after the business accounts.  Apart from being hard-working, enterprising and responsible, he is also a father.  For this reason, he used the profits from his first loan to improve his home so that his children were better protected and could enjoy a better quality of life and education.

He is asking for a second loan to buy more cleaning products so he can increase again his sales and offer a wider variety of products to his customers.  

His future goals are to become more self-sufficient and be able to generate his own capital.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products.

loans.name: Las Innovadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Innovadoras está en su ciclo 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un comité muy unido que quiere salir adelante. Forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde a través de la encuesta de los 50 indicadores irán conociendo su nivel de vida y a partir de ahí ir mejorando.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sonia, quien tiene un kiosko donde vende todo tipo de productos, ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que todos los días se sacrifica desde muy temprano hasta muy entrada la noche. Quiere ir creciendo en su negocio, y de esa forma poder seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder surtir su negocio con bebidas, comestibles, golosinas y demás. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda para continuar.
texts.en:
The solidarity group 'Las Innovadoras' are in their first cycle in the Women's Committee program.  They are very united and have a strong desire to progress.  They are part of the Poverty Elimination Program, in which a survey of 50 factors shows them their standard of living so they can make plans to improve.  

One of the members is Sonia, who has a kiosk where she sells all types of products.  She is a very hard-working woman who gets up early every morning and works until late at night.  

She would like her business to grow so she can have a better standard of living for herself and her family.  She is therefore asking for a loan to stock her business with drinks, snacks, sweets and other things.

She is grateful for the help this gives her to continue in business.

loans.use: to buy drinks, snacks, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Guillermina Elena

texts.es:
Hacer bella a otras personas es el trabajo de Guillermina una estilista de 39 años de edad que gracias a unas capacitaciones adquirió los conocimientos con los que tiempo después monto su negocio, es madre de 2 hijos y no solo los mantiene en ocasiones les brinda trabajos menores para que cojan bagaje y tengan su propio presupuesto.
Para mejorar su negocio, abastecerlo, mejorar su empresa, Guillermina necesita algunos insumos como lo son tintas, tratamientos, alizantes de cabello, ampollas, shampoos, un secador y una plancha para el cabello por ende requiere de un crédito para comprar estos implementos pues no dispone del capital y es más cómodo pagarlo por cuotas.
texts.en:
Making others beautiful is Guillermina’s job. She is a 39-year-old stylist who, thanks to some training, acquired the knowledge she needed to start her own business. She is the mother of two children. She not only supports them, but sometimes gives them little jobs so they can gain experience and have their own budget.

In order to improve her business and restock it, Guillermina needs some supplies, such as tints, treatments, keratin hair straightening treatments, hair ampoules, shampoos, a dryer, and a hair straightener. She needs a loan to buy these tools as she does not have the capital available and it is easier to pay it off in instalments.

loans.use: to buy treatments, keratin hair straightening treatments, hair ampoules, shampoos, a dryer, and a hair straightener

loans.name: Yamile Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ella es Yamile una luchadora mujer cabeza de familia que ha base de ahorros logro consolidar una papelería donde también oferta el servicio de impresión y fotocopias, inicio empíricamente, aprendiendo sola, preguntando a vecinos y personas que han manejado antes esta maquinaria en la cual quiere formar y realizar los sueños que se ha propuesto para su familia como lo es mejorar sus condiciones de vida, realizar algunas reparaciones a su vivienda, brindarle estudio a su pequeño hijo de 7 años de edad.
La actividad principal de su negocio es la fotocopiadora debido a que no tiene mucho capital para comprar surtido de papelería, pero gracias a que encontró en interactuar un amigo, solicita un crédito para comprar artículos para la temporada escolar.
texts.en:
This is Yamile. She is a determined woman and the head of her family. With some savings, she managed to establish a stationery store where she also offers printing and photocopying services. She started empirically, learning by herself and asking neighbours and people who had previously used this machinery.  With the help of this work, she wants to achieve the dreams she has set for her family, which are to improve their living conditions, make some repairs to their home, and give her seven-year-old son some education.

Her business is mainly focused on photocopying since she does not have much capital for stocking up on stationery; however, thanks to finding a friend in Interactuar, she is requesting a loan for buying items for the back-to-school season.

loans.use: to have the capital she needs to buy stationery for the back-to-school season

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana es una mujer de 36 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos y su negocio es la venta de Api (jugo de maíz caliente)
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Batallas’; caracterizado por su cercanía al lago sagrado Titicaca, área agrícola dónde se cría ganado; vacuno, ovino y camélido, se vive de la pesca y también de vegetales del lugar, como la quinua, el chuño, la haba, la papa, etc. caracterizada por el clima frío, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 1-12 grados centígrados y donde los rayos solares golpean con mucha fuerza la superficie.
Susana es de tez morena, baja estatura, viste de forma tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar, también habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica a la construcción y con sus hijos que estudian y el mayor terminó el cuartel obligatorio. Viven en una casa propia construida de adobe que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de Api; El api es una bebida típica del altiplano andino, La elaboración de esta bebida es en base a los granos de maíz morado y a esto debe su color. El maíz proviene de los valles, La preparación de esta bebida se hace a través de maíz morado y/o maíz amarillo molidos, azúcar, además algunos tallitos de canela y clavo de olor. Generalmente se sirve bastante caliente para mantener su sabor, aunque también existe una versión fría. Un acompañante para el api es el buñuelo o sopaipilla y pastel. Los días fríos son propicios para disfrutar una deliciosa y humeante bebida de maíz, acompañada de su exuberante pastel. “el clima frío del lugar se combate con mi delicioso Api, tengo muchos clientes diarios y constantes que desayunan desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana…”comenta. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio. Ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la refacción de un cuarto para utilizarlo como puesto de venta. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Susana solicita un préstamo para la refacción de un cuarto para utilizarlo como puesto de venta y servir muchos Apis con buñuelos.
texts.en:
Susana, 36, is married and has four children.  She sells 'Api' which is made from the juice of hot corn.  She is a good mother and is enterprising, independent and also a consistent and responsible worker.  She has her business in the area called 'Batallas' which is close to the sacred Lake Titicaca.  This is an agricultural area where people raise livestock such as cattle, sheep and camelids.  There is also a dependence on fishing and growing local produce such as quinoa, freeze-dried potatoes, beans, potatoes, etc.  The area has a cold climate with a temperature which goes between 1 and 12 degrees centigrade during the day, although the sun's rays often shine on the land.  

Susana is dark-skinned, quite small, and she dresses in traditional dress (hat, blanket and blouse).  Her native tongue is Aymara which she speaks at home, but she also speaks Spanish, both as a cultural benefit and for her business.

She shares her life with her husband, who works as a builder, and her sons who are studying at the moment.  The eldest has just finished his obligatory military service.

They live in their own home, which is built from adobe and has drinking water, electricity and drains.  

She sells 'Api' which is a typical drink of the area.  This drink is made from purple or yellow corn, which comes from the valleys.  It is crushed and then you add sugar, cinnamon and cloves.  It is normally served hot so that it maintains its flavor, although some people also drink it cold.  It can be enjoyed with 'buñuelos or fried pastry. It is delicious served on a cold day with one of these pastries to go with it.

Susana says: "the cold climate can be overcome by drinking my delicious 'Api'.  I have a lot of customers who come to me every day and have breakfast here in the early hours of the morning".  

She dreams of improving her business.  To do this she would like to remodel a room so that she can use it as a selling point.  This would be the second loan from this institution in her seven years in the business.  She hopes that she will be able to have a nice room where she can sell her 'Api' and snacks.

loans.use: to remodel a room so that she can use it to sell food.

loans.name: José Obdulio

texts.es:
José, de 44 años de edad, estudió hasta 5° grado, está acompañado y su pareja es comerciante en pequeño, tienen 2 hijos que estudian 6° y 1° grado.

José es el encargado de cuidar una ganadería de la comunidad desde hace 10 años, le otorgaron este cargo ya que él comenzó como jornalero y se desempeñó muy bien;  ahora es quien hace las planificaciones y comercializa el ganado, el horario de trabajo es por turnos, el cubre el turno de 2:30 p.m. a 6:00 a.m. y de 11:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m. viaja en bicicleta y tarda 10 minutos en llegar. 

El necesita el préstamo para comprar ganado, crecerlo y engordar  para luego venderlo, el préstamo le ayudará para que su calidad de vida cambie.

José, desea tener buena salud para seguir trabajando y ganar el dinero suficiente en la venta de animales, para invertirlo en la familia y la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose, 44, studied until fifth grade.  He is married and his wife has a small store.  They have two children who are studying sixth and first grade at school.  

He has been responsible for looking after livestock in the community for ten years,  He started as a laborer, and due to his hard work, he was given this job.  He now manages the livestock and sells it.  

He works shifts, on duty between 2:30 pm and 6:00 am and from 11:00 am to 3:00 pm.  He goes to work by bicycle which takes him ten minutes.  

He needs this loan to buy more cattle so he can raise it and fatten it before selling it on.  The loan will help him change the quality of his life.  

He hopes to have good health so he can continue working and generate an income from the sale of animals which will allow him to provide for his family and pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy cattle so he can raise and fatten it before selling it on.

loans.name: Mirna Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Mirna es una señora que junto a su esposo ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos, en la actualidad vende maíz en granos y alquila un pequeño lote de terreno con estos ingresos cubre los gastos principales del hogar y la familia, con su crédito anterior logro invertir en su negocio, ahora solicita el crédito para comprar materiales como laminas de zic para cambiar el entechado, ya que este se está deteriorando con el pasar del tiempo y en tiempos de lluvias se introduce el agua a la vivienda, Mirna tiene como planes futuros seguir mejorando las condiciones de su humilde hogar.
texts.en:
Mirna is a woman who has been able to raise her children with the help of her husband.  She currently sells corn and rents out a small piece of land.  With this income she is able to cover the general household expenses. 

She used her previous loan to invest in her business.  She is now asking for a loan to buy building materials such as metal sheets so that she can change the ceiling as it is in a state of deterioration.  When it rains, water leaks into the home.  

Mirna would like to continue improving her housing conditions in the future.

loans.use: to repair the ceiling in her house so she can improve her living conditions.

loans.name: Vilma Dolores

texts.es: Vilma de 48 años de edad es una mujer admirable que desde muy joven aprendió a ganarse la vida trabajando duro, en el campo, pero actualmente cuenta con una pequeña granja de pollos la cual le permite salir adelante y sostener la economía de su hogar. Ella es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos de 21 y 14 años de edad, aunque también tiene 2 hijos que ya tienen sus propios hogares. Vilma desea cercar la pequeña granja donde resguardar los pollos y comprar concentrado y vitaminas para los mismos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: concentrado, vitaminas, tela metálica, madera y clavos para alimentar sus pollos y terminar de cercar la pequeña granja.
texts.en: Vilma is 48 years old and an admirable woman. From a young age she learned to earn her own living working hard in field. Now, however, she has a small chicken business that allows her to get ahead and to support her household economy. Vilma is a single mother and lives in a house that she owns with her two children, ages 21 and 14 years old. She has two other children who now have their own homes. Vilma wants to put a fence around her small farm in order to keep the chickens safe. She also wants to buy feed and vitamins for the chickens. Vilma is applying to FUSAI for a loan in order to buy feed, vitamins, metal sheets, wood, and nails to feed her chickens and finish building the fence on the small fence.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, metal sheets, wood, and nails.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina de 46 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que se desempeña como panificadora de su propio negocio ya que elabora pan dulce y francés en su horno artesanal desde hace 8 años, contando con una gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus productos, además vende platillos típicos y tamales de gallina para obtener mejores ingresos económicos. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijas de 22, 13 y 10 años de edad que se encuentran estudiando con su apoyo. Reina desea invertir en materiales para la elaboración de pan dulce y francés ya que en época navideña el pan francés es muy buscado para la cena navideña, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: harina, azúcar, manteca, queso, crema, levadura, etc.
texts.en:
Reina is 46 years old and an enterprising woman who works as a baker. She has her own business where she has been producing sweet and savoury bread in her oven for eight years. Reina has a large number of customers who look for her products. She also sells traditional meals and chicken tamales to earn a higher income.

Reina lives in a house that she owns with her partner and three daughters, ages 22, 13 and 10 years old. With her support, Reina's daughters are in education.

Reina wants to invest in supplies to make sweet and savoury breads as, at Christmas time, her products are much sought after. Reina is therefore applying for a loan from FUSAI in order to buy flour, sugar, butter, cheese, cream, yeast and more.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, butter, cheese, cream, yeast and more.

loans.name: Vírginia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Virginia de 46 años de edad, está casada y han procreado cuatro hijos, todos son mayores de edad y siempre han coordinado para brindarle a sus hijos la educación y los buenos principios morales, dos de ellos le ayudan a su padre en los trabajos de mecánica automotriz y las hijas le ayudan a su madre en su trabajo de venta de ropa.

Ella utilizara el préstamo para invertir en su tienda y apoyar a su esposo con unos trabajos pendientes que tiene en su taller, con lo que espera se vea beneficiada la familia.
texts.en:
Virginia is 46 years old, married and has four children, all of whom are now adults. Virginia has always sought to give her children a good upbringing and good morals. Two of Virginia's children help their father's work as a mechanic, while her daughters help her in her work selling clothes.

Virginia will use this loan to invest in her shop and to support her husband with some jobs pending at his workshop. Virginia hopes that this loan will be of benefit to the family.

loans.use: to buy different styles and sizes of clothes for different sexes.

loans.name: Ivan Marcelo

texts.es: Marcelo es un joven de 25 años de edad,  el vive con sus padres y con un hermano, el se dedica a trabajar en una panadería y los días que tiene libre  de este trabajo se dedica a vender zapatos, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de zapatos que comenta que se traslada a otra ciudad para conseguirlos mas baratos y asi al momento de venderlos quedarse con la ganancia y lograr seguir mejorando su negocio y a futuro ponerse un almacén de zapatos.
texts.en: Marcelo is a young man of 25 years of age. He lives with his parents and one brother and makes a living working in a bakery. On his free days from the bread shop, he works selling shoes. Marcelo is going to invest this loan in shoes. He brings them from another city where they are cheaper.so that he can make a profit to improve his business. In the future, Marcelo wants to set up as a shoe wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 42 years old and is married with 7 children aged between 8 and 27 years, all of whom go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 4 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers for maize which he will sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumptions. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for maize.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark is in his early 60s and is a married father of five children.  They all live in the northern part of the country. The amount of 150,000 Albanian Lek that he is requesting from you will be used to pay for the past 11 years of pension contribution of his wife. Kindly note that since the collapse of the previous regime; almost all rural people who had no other jobs but government jobs were left to pay themselves for their pension contribution. Some of them never managed to pay due to the fact that they never made enough. In our case, Mark and his wife had not made enough so that his wife could have paid the contribution. In order to pay without much of a penalty, they must pay the contribution lump sum as early as January. 
They have livestock to earn a living: two dairy cows from whom they sell roughly two baby calves a year, specifically in the month of August. Their youngest son who still lives with them works as a reinforcing iron worker.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's pension contribution for the past 11 years.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 50 years old. He is married with 6 children aged between 5 and 20 years, all of whom go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 20 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers of maize for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers of maize for sale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 52 years old and is married with 5 children aged between 6 and 20 years, all of whom go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 2 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers for maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay for his employees.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for maize to sell.

loans.name: Adriana Marianda

texts.es:
Comprar vivienda se ha convertido en la obsesión de Adriana una carismática, responsable y puntual mujer de 43 años de edad, es una persona casada muy madura y correcta en sus cosas, tiene dos hijos ambos mayores de edad pero que aún depende de ella y con su negocio de salón de belleza ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
Los altos costos de insumos, la fuerte competencia en el sector han llevado a la señora Adriana a solicitar un préstamo, para la compra de tinturas, shampos, gel para el cabello, una mejor plancha para el cabello, la razón de la necesidad de este crédito radica en que ya tiene pocas existencia y comprar en unidad le sale muy costoso, por lo que busca comprar en cantidad. 
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá abastecer su salón de belleza con surtido suficiente pata un trimestre donde espera impulsar y mejorar su negocio en ganancias y clientes.
texts.en:
Buying a home has become Adriana's obsession. She is charismatic, responsible and punctual. At 43-years-old she is married, very mature, and she knows what is right. Adriana has two children; they are both adults but still depend on her. With her beauty salon business, Adriana has been able to improve her family's living conditions.

The high cost of supplies as well as strong competition in the area have brought Adriana to apply for a loan in order to buy dyes, shampoos, hair gel, and better straighteners. She needs this loan to buy in bulk as buying retail is very expensive.

With the help of this loan, Adriana can stock up her beauty salon with enough stock for the next quarter when she hopes to drive forward her business and increase her number of customers and her profits.

loans.use: to buy dyes, shampoos, hair gel, and better straighteners.

loans.name: Jaime Alberto

texts.es:
Jaime es un inteligente hombre de 26 años de edad, que sueña y añora poder comprar un hogar propio, vive junto con su pareja con la que tiene dos hijos de 3 y 5 años de edad, su idea para mantener a su familia y espera que no solo encontrar apoyo en interactuar si no en los miles de usuarios de buen corazón del Portal Kiva para iniciar un negocio que será un restaurante, en la foto se puede ver el motivo por el cual Jaime está solicitando un crédito y es para comprar ese espacio con esos activos fijos.
Para Jaime será un sueño hecho realidad tener este espacio para trabajarlo y comprometerse a ser un restaurante reconocido por su calidad humana y excelente sabor de sus alimentos y además que representara de su hogar por eso apóyalo en la creación de su empresa.
texts.en:
Jaime is an intelligent 26-year-old and wants to buy his own home to live with his partner, with whom he has two children, ages five and three years old. Jaime wants to support his family and hopes not just to find help from Interactuar but from the millions of good-hearted Kiva lenders to start a restaurant. In the photo you can see Jaime's motivation: he wants to use this buy this space and all the fixed assets contained within.

For Jaime, it would be a dream-come-true to have this space to work and build up a restaurant known for good service and delicious dishes. This would mean a lot for Jaime's so household so do help him to open this business.

loans.use: to start his own business (a restaurant) and one day own his own home.

loans.name: Leila Del Socorro

texts.es:
Adriana es una madre soltera y cabeza de familia que con la preocupación de no tener un empleo y como mantener a su pequeño hijo de 6 años, opto por Acudir a su amigo llamado Interactuar para que la asesoran y solicitar un crédito para iniciar su empresa de venta de mercancía que será principalmente ropa para dama y caballero, su idea es distribuirla a familiares, amigos, en su zona y barrios cercanos, pues no debe olvidar que tiene un pequeño que cuidar. 
Con la ayuda de este préstamo tendrá una actividad económica para llevar alimento a su hogar, pagar las deudas y lo más importante, matricular a su pequeño en una escuela para que se eduque y comparta con niños de su edad.
texts.en:
Adriana is single and the head of her family. Worried about being unemployed and having no means to support her six-year-old son, she decided to come to Interactuar for an assessment and to apply for a loan and start a business selling mainly men's and women's clothing. Adriana's idea is to sell to relatives and friends, and in the local and nearby areas. At the same time, Adriana must not forget that she has a little one to look after.

With the help of this loan, Adriana will have a source of income to bring home food, to pay off debts and, most important, to enroll her son at school so that he can have an education and spend time with people his own age.

loans.use: to start a business selling men's and women's clothing; Leila is a single mother who wants to support her household.

loans.name: Osvaldo Enrique

texts.es:
Osvaldo es un hombre de 49 años de edad, padre de dos mujeres de 18 y 20 años de edad, se encuentra separado de su esposa pero sigue dando el dinero para mantener a sus hijas. 
Su negocio nace en el año 1994, en su pueblo de Santa Elena el cual es transporte de personas, una actividad muy común y solicitada en este sector ya que el transporte es difícil y no es constante. 
El carro que se ve en la foto ha acompañado muchos años, aguantando los difíciles caminos rocosos y pantanosos y es pensando tanto en su carro, como en la seguridad de las personas que quiere solicitar un crédito para realizar algunas reparaciones a su vehículo, principalmente en el motor y que este le permita seguir pagando la educación de sus hijos, y mejorar su condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Osvaldo is 49 years old and a father to two daughters, ages 18 and 20 years old. Osvaldo is separated but continues to support his daughters financially.

Osvaldo opened his business in 1994 in his local town of Santa Elena. There he works as a driver, a common job, and much solicited service in the area owing to the lack of consistent public transport.

Osvaldo has been using his car (shown in the photo) for a number of years and it has withstood the difficult and rocky and boggy roads. Now, thinking as much about his car as his passengers' safety, Osvaldo is applying for a loan in order to carry out repairs to his vehicles, particularly the engine. This would allow Osvaldo to continue paying for his children's education and to improve his and their quality of life.

loans.use: to carry out urgent repairs to his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ladies shoes for reselling by her husband.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
“When women come together, they are powerful,” says Jane, a 45-year-old farmer who has two children and lives in the village of Kagumo in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. As a girl, she watched women in her village mobilize to replace traditional thatched roofs with waterproof corrugated iron. The memory of this collective effort led her to join Gakui self-help group. For the past year, Jane has been actively involved in mixed farming. Because she is from rural Kenya, gender roles still apply and women do the heavy work of fetching and carrying water and wood, in addition to household chores, childcare and tending crops. Many are left to run farms alone while their husbands migrate in search of paid employment. This has not been a setback because Jane has been making great profits in farming. Kerugoya is one of the places with conditions that favor horticulture farming: good climate, soils, transport system, and market. Jane has always wanted to diversify and start horticultural farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is lack of funds. She is therefore requesting a loan to start horticultural farming.
