Through the Gakui self-help group, whose members co-guarantee each other to secure a loan, Jane joined Juhudi Kilimo, a micro-finance organization that supports young and enterprising farmers. With your loan Jane intends to buy good quality vegetable seeds, flowers and potatoes. Proximity to an airstrip will allow her to transport the produce faster to an international market, hence enabling her to make more money. This loan will improve Jane's living conditions and secure the future of her children.
Jane’s hopes and dreams for the future are to improve and climb the success ladder a step at a time as her family prospers.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a water source at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for the family

loans.name: Al- Shahd 4 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Shahd 4. It consists of five women from Hodeidah City, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Huda is the leader of the group. She is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of one child, who lives with her family in a poor area in Hodeidah. Her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family and his income was not enough to cover the needs of the family. Huda decided to help him by selling incense door to door. Over time, she earned a good amount of money and improved her business by starting to make traditional incense and sell it in her area. 

Unfortunately, most of what she earns goes towards the needs of the family and she wants to expand her business. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase incense materials to make traditional incense to sell to the local people.

Huda hopes to improve her business more by opening a small shop selling incense and perfumes.

loans.use: to purchase incense materials to make traditional incense to sell to the local people.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 38 years old. He is married with four children aged between six and 18 years, all of whom go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for five years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertiliser for the corn he sells. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertiliser for his corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase aluminium doors for the rooms in his house.

loans.name: Songa Mbele Group

texts.en:
Christine is aged 40, and is married and with five school-aged children. She is from Tujijenge, Tanzania. She has a business selling 'genge-duka stocks' -  fruits, vegetables, rice, beans and other shop items. She has been in this business for five years now, working from 6am to 8pm daily, and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This is her sixth loan request. Christine has used previous loans, all of which have been paid back successfully, to buy genge-duka stocks. Christine managed to earn extra income which she used to buy a plot of land and to cover part of her home expenses. Her dream is to manage a big shop selling more products. She will invest this loan in more genge-duka stock (fruits and vegetables). 

She is so happy and thankful to everyone who has supported her family and business. Christine and her group members will hold each other responsible for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy genge stocks (fruits and vegetables).

loans.name: Mt Sinai A Group

texts.en:
Magreth is in her late 50s and and is a widow with two grown children. She has been supporting herself by running a local restaurant for three years now. She starts working at 7:30am until night and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This is her seventh loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, to be apportioned among her group Mt Sinai A, which consists of four members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. With her previous loans, all of which have been paid back successfully, she improved her restaurant by replenishing the rice, beans, sugar, maize and baking flour. She managed to earn extra income which she used to pay her living expenses. Magreth will use this loan to restock her restaurant again with cooking ingredients.

She really appreciates your support.  In the coming days, Magreth would like to run a good restaurant.

loans.use: to restock her restaurant with cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Mt Sinai B Group

texts.en:
Jonathan is 61 years old. He is the father of six children - two are in school and the rest are grown. He works hard to improve his family's living conditions. He has had a pharmacy selling medicine for 16 years now, working from 7.30am to 10pm daily. Jonathan also provides consultations for people on health issues. He is able to make a good profit per month.

This is his fifth loan request, to be apportioned among the three members of the Mt Sinai B group. The three members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. Jonathan used his previous loans to purchase more medicine for his business, and earned extra income which he used to cover school fees and part of his home expenses. 

With his new credit request, Jonathan will invest in more stock to resell in his pharmacy. His dream is to be able to manage a pharmacy with more types of medicines.

loans.use: to buy stocks of medicine to resell in his pharmacy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes and perfume to enlarge his business.

loans.name: Eliso

texts.en:
Eliso is a 47-year-old married woman from the Kaspi district in Georgia. She lives with her two sons and their wives, husband and mother-in-law. Eliso and her daughter-in-law were unable to find stable jobs and started working as a cleaners, where they earn 160 GEL monthly. Her husband and sons have stable jobs and get a fixed salary. 

In order to generate more income herself, Eliso decided to do something more and requested a loan. She couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institutions because of their requirements to have business experience or stable revenue. However, the Start Up program, which is a partnership between Kiva and Credo, allows poor people like Eliso to have the chance to start or restart a business. She needs financial support to purchase a stock of clothing and to have money for working capital to start trading as a business. 

She will sell the clothing at increased prices and will be able to generate additional income. The loan will greatly assist Eliso and she will be able to improve her economic situation and give her family a better style of life.

loans.use: to start a business selling clothing.

loans.name: Shefki

texts.en:
This is Shefki scattering corn for the chickens. He is married with three children and earns a living through farming. Shefki has sheep, goats and chickens, and cultivates grains like wheat and corn as well as potatoes and beans. He has also focused on orchard fruits such as apples, plums, peaches, berries and grapevines.

Shefki wants to buy a multi-purpose soil tillage machine that is used with low powered farm and garden tractors. The amount he is requesting is 100,000 Albanian Lek.

loans.use: to buy a multi-purpose soil tillage machine.

loans.name: Haziz

texts.en:
Haziz is 59 years old. He is married and is a father of five children at the moment, since he had another daughter who was born paralyzed and who sadly passed away about a year ago. 

Haziz has been earning an income through agriculture/livestock for a very long time. He sells a baby calf each year and also some baby sheep; he also sells homemade dairy products such as cottage cheese and butter, as well as dried beans. In addition to all the above, he’s got orchards containing apples, plums and peaches. 

In the little land he owns he plants beans, onions, potatoes, corn and wheat. He not only sells the corn and wheat, but uses the straw for his animals. Haziz would like to buy a dairy cow with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Virginio

texts.es:
Virginio es un joven que está estudiando la carrera de análisis de sistemas, está trabajando y de esa forma lucha por poder cubrir sus gastos de estudios. Es una persona muy luchadora y sacrificada.
Está superándose cada día y comenta que una de sus aspiraciones es terminar su carrera y conseguir un trabajo para así poder  ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Virginio is a young man who is studying the career of "Systems Analysis". He works, and in this way he struggles to pay for his educational expenses. He is a very hardworking person. He is progressing day by day, and he comments that one of his wishes is to finish his job and get a job in order to help his family. He is requesting this loan to be able to pay for his educational tuition fess and to keep on studying as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition fees.

loans.name: Khanha

texts.en:
Khanha is an 18-year-old university student who is studying marketing in the first year at university in a city. She is from Prey Veng province in Cambodia. 

Due to the fact that she is short of finances to pay for her university fees for four years, Khanha would like to apply for a loan. With this loan, she will be able to graduate successfully and earn skills to build a good future. 

After graduation, she hopes to have a proper job with a decent salary to improve her family’s living.

loans.use: to pay for her university fees

loans.name: Merita

texts.en:
Merita is 45 years old and is married with two children, 20 and 15. She will use the loan that she is requesting from Kiva lenders to buy feed for her animals such as Lucerne, maize, barley, bran and beets.

She has been practicing agriculture (wheat, beans, potatoes and fodder)/livestock (dairy cows) to earn a living. Her husband works in the directorate of fishing services. 

They live in a village that is situated at the foot of a mountain. Villagers consider themselves blessed due to the fact that the soil of their agricultural land  supports almost all kinds of plants and also some red apple orchards called ‘starkinga’.

loans.use: to buy winter feed such as lucerne, maize, barley, bran and beets for her animals

loans.name: Fazlli

texts.en:
Fazlli is a 34-year-old married father of two, 15 and 12 years old, and they are members of the Egyptian Albanian ethnic community. He is seeking your financial help to buy a mule and a horse. The amount he is requesting is 100,000 Albanian Lek.

Fazlli does agriculture to earn a living planting/selling mainly beets, barley and wheat; he also raises little mules and horses and sells them. Fazlli’s village is known for its arboriculture and straddles the mountainous border between southwestern Macedonia and eastern Albania.

loans.use: to buy a mule and a horse; after less then a year he then sells them

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.en: Nilufar is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1987. She lives in a rural area. She is married and has two children. Her husband is an entrepreneur. Nilufar is a sewer. It is her new startup business. She wants to start her business well. She has satisfied clients already. She is responsive with clients and does her best in modern conditions. Nilufar is in need of financial support to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Amridin

texts.en: Amridin is a strong man. He was born in 1986. He is from the eastern part of Tajikistan. He lives in a rural area. He is married and has two children. His wife is a housekeeper. Amridin has had a business for about five years. He is a taxi driver. His income is from this activity. He has his own clients. He works serving people and gets enough financial gain to feed his family. Amridin needs to repair his car. He needs financial support to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en: Mavluda is a hardworking woman. She is from the northern part of the country. She is married and has adult children. She has had a business for 7 years now. Her daughter-in-law helps her to do this business. She is a retailer, where she buys and sells traditional shawls. She has permanent clients. She is planning to do commodity circulation of her product. She needs financial support to buy a new collection of shawls.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of shawls

loans.name: He Muong 7 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Loan, 22, is from a Thai minority and lives in a remote village where it's difficult to access. She has been married and is the mother of two small girls. The family of four people live happily in a small temporary house and rely on agricultural production for a living. Rice cultivation is the most important production in her family but the income from this doesn't cover completely all of the living expenses of her family. For that reason, Mrs. Loan steps up other production, such as growing corn, cassava as well as raising pigs and chickens. To have enough capital to expand animal husbandry, she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program. This is the second loan she has received and she will use it to buy piglets and food for the pigs. Mrs. Loan hopes that her experience in breeding pigs, together with the knowledge she has collected from the training and the counselling of this program will make her investment go smoothly and improve her family's income significantly. She dreams that a more abundant life will soon knock her home's door and her children will have bright future. In the picture, she stands on the first from right.

loans.use: to buy piglets and food for the pigs

loans.name: Rohbar

texts.en: Rohbar is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1973. She lives in a rural area. She is married and has five children. Her husband is an emigrant. She has had a business for about 15 years now. She buys and sells cattle as well as plants agriculture products. She feeds her cattle and then sells them in a market. She wants to enlarge her business in the future. Now she needs to buy winter clothes for her son. Rohbar is asking for financial support to buy clothes.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes for her son

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en: Romeo is a hardworking father of three children aged 18, 15 and 9. He engages in a hog raising business. He grows and sells hogs to earn a living. He is a 48-year-old married man from Dulag, Leyte. Romeo is asking for a loan to purchase piglets and pig feed. These are very important for the operations of his livelihood. He can raise and sell healthy pigs in the coming months. These will help to improve his income and probably start to provide his family with good food. In the future, Romeo dreams to expand his business to make it productive and profitable for him to continue send his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new TV for the house.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a married woman with three kids. She hails from Mayorga, Leyte. She raises and sells hogs to earn a living. She has been engaged in the hog raising business for five years already. Her husband is a jeepney driver. 

She is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and pig feed. In this way, her way of raising hogs will show a great improvement in terms of the hog's growth, which is very fast, and in the few months to come, she will be able to sell healthy pigs. This could lead her on her way to recovery. She will be earning more, and she will set aside some profit to venture into another business to augment her income.

Joy hopes that she will be expanding her business to continue support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en: Glenda operates a bargain store that sells second hand goods like shoes and jewellery. She is a 37-year-old single woman from Dulag, Leyte. It has been 3 years now that she runs the bargain store. Glenda has requested a loan to buy more supplies of shoes and jewellery. These materials are very helpful in augmenting her daily income. She can start to pay her expenses and other obligations. She can now also start to pay her loan and start to save for emergency purposes. Glenda would like to expand her business to make it successful and hopefully this is the start of the recovery of her business to have stable income in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more supplies of shoes and jewellery

loans.name: Rokia

texts.en: Rokia is a 45-years-old married woman with five children, living with her family in a humble house in Taiz, Yemen. Her husband is the breadwinner of the house and his income is very small. The house where Rokia lives with her family lacks of a lot of furniture and most of the furniture are very old. Rokia came to Al- Amal Microfinance bank and asked for a loan of 80,000 YER to buy new furniture for her house. Rokia hopes to make a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy new furniture for her house.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expenses are food and household consumables.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling goat meat. She faces a major challenges of diseases and competition in her business. 

With the loan of 30,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase more goats for slaughter. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for slaughter

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is hardworking married woman with seven children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. 

Rani has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo, to inflate her sales to generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales to generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Mokhtar Al-Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Mokhtar Al-Hodeidah. It consists of four women who live in the same area in Hodiedah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB.

Ghariba is the leader of the group, a married woman and a mother of five children living with her family in their humble house. Her husband is an immigrant outside of the country, working for a small salary and what he sends for his family in Yemen is not enough to cover their necessary needs.  Ghariba decided to start her own business to help him in that responsibility. In order to do that, she decided to sell women's clothes door-to-door in her area. The income from this business is small, and she wants to increase it. 

For this reason, she applied for a loan of 20,000 YER From AMB to purchase ready-made women's clothes and sell them.

Ghariba hopes to open a small shop to sell women's clothes.

loans.use: To purchase ready-made women's clothes

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia, 39 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Razia needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. 

She has requested a loan of PKR 50,000  to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en: Nicolas engages in operating a habal-habal (is a motorcycle modified to seat more than two persons). It is used to travel in remote areas. He is  a married man with five children from Dulag, Leyte. To have an additional source of income, he also engages in a food vending business. He sells bread to the locals in his community. He is asking for a loan to purchase more bread to resell, and for motorcycle maintenance such as tyres, bolts and fuel. These tools are very important in operating his motorcycle transport services. He can now sell more bread to his customers. With this loan, he can now start to pay his obligations and other household expenses. In the future, Nicolas dreams to expand both his businesses to support the needs of his growing children.

loans.use: to purchase more bread to resell and for motorcycle maintenance such as tyres, bolts and fuel

loans.name: Esmira

texts.en: Esmira is 38 years old with 3 kids. She works hard to support her family and improve their economy. They are IDP (internally displaced person) and live in Bilasuvar region. Her husband is a worker but his salary is not enough to cover their family needs. Because of that, she also works in agriculture, specifically growing crops and animal husbandry. Esmira is a very kind and responsible woman, very social and hardworking. She has four milking cows with calves, while her fresh milk and dairy products are in great demand among the local residents to whom she sells them. Her customer base increases every day and therefore she has decided to develop her business. Esmira has turned to Aqroinvest CU for a loan of 1500 AZN to buy mineral fertilizers and two milking cows. She plans to build a big barn with profits from the loan .

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and two milking cows

loans.name: Ishara Group

texts.fr: Maman TAKUBUSOGA, vice-présidente du groupe ISHARA est mariée et mère de 6 enfants tous scolarisés. Agée de 44 ans, elle est vendeuse des boissons dans un kiosque situé à bord de la rue grâce au premier fonds reçu de HEKIMA. Elle vient de sollicité un autre prêt pour acheter 10 cartons de MALTI (boisson non alcoolisée). Elle compte ouvrir un magasin dans l’avenir. Elle remercie HEKIMA pour ce grand soutien.
texts.en: Takubusoga, who is vice-president of the Ishara group, is married and mother to six children who are all at school. She is 44 years old and, thanks to funds from her Hekima, sells drinks on a stand on the side of the road. She has just requested another loan so she can buy ten cartons of Malti (a non-alcoholic drink). She is planning to open a shop in the future. She is grateful to Hekima for this great support.

loans.use: to buy ten cartons of Malti (a non-alcoholic drink).

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Forty-five year old Marissa earns a living by raising and selling hogs. She is a married woman with five children from Dulag, Leyte. She has been engaged in this hog raising business for more than 10 years now. Aside from raising hogs, she engages in farming. She grows and sells rice. She  is asking a loan to buy additional pigs, and farm supplies such as fertilizers. With these, she can now start to raise more pigs and slowly improve her farming business. In the coming few months, Marissa will sells more hogs and harvest the yield of her farm. Marisa hopes that someday, she will do her best to expand both her businesses to support the education of all her children.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and farm supplies such as fertilizers

loans.name: Linda Group

texts.fr: Madame NAWEZA est marié à un sans emploi, mère de 9 enfants, et présidente du groupe LINDA. Agée de 55 ans, elle s’occupe de la vente de fretin au marché central depuis 2002 grâce à une aide reçu de la famille de sa maman. Elle vient de solliciter un prêt qui lui permettra de s’approvisionner en 5 sacs de fretin. Le revenu de son commerce l’aidera à  payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants et agrandir son entreprise. Elle remercie HEKIMA pour le soutien qu’elle apporte aux mamans.
texts.en: Naweza, who is married to an unemployed man and has nine children, is president of the Linda group. She is 55 years old and has been selling small fish at the central market since 2002 thanks to help from her family and her mother. She has just requested a loan which will enable her to stock up with five sacks of small fish. The income from her business will help her to pay her children's school fees and expand her business. She is grateful to Hekima for the support it provides to mothers.

loans.use: to stock up with five sacks of small fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new chair for his barber shop.

loans.name: Suriya's Group

texts.en:
Suriya requested a loan for her husband; he offers Aloo Chaat (a Pakistani food) at evening to the common people of his area. For this purpose he has better needs for potatoes, tomatoes, yogurt, onions, spices, etc in large quantity. She helps her husband during the preparation of Aloo Chaat at noon. He wants to offer more Aloo Chaat to his customers, because the demand has been increasing time to time. 

She is the age of 38, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She hopes that through this loan her husband would be able to generate more income than before. 

She thanks Kiva and field partner, the BRAC Pakistan team.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for Aloo Chaat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her horticulture farm

loans.name: Aelita

texts.en:
The sunny woman in the photo is Aelita, who lives in Vorotan village, in the Sisian region of Armenia. 
Aelita lives with her husband and three school-age children. Her husband works as a driver in a local copper factory, while Aelita's main jobs are taking care of the children and at the same time managing the farm. 
She skilfully raises her livestock, which includes two cows, three calves, a pig, piglets and thirty colonies of bees. She sells the milk and meat locally, and the income she gets helps her to meet the daily needs of her family. 
This loan is very important so Aelita can buy three more cows and food for them (300 packages).
Your support will bring big changes to Aelita’s farm and she is relying on your support.

loans.use: to buy three more cows and cow feed

loans.name: Laeliyah

texts.en:
Laeliyah is 28 years old and married. She lives with her husband and her children, and is shown in this picture with her husband. She has four children. 

She and her husband have a processed fish business. She was pleased to be able to help her husband to improve a better life.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 6,000,000 rupiah. This loan will be used to buy and build a bathroom, a septic tank, and a closet at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family. She wants to have access to safe sanitation for families. 

Her family income is still not enough to build toilets and water resources with cash, but they are able to repay the loans received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of lenders.

loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, a septic tank, and a closet at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Alice is a 50-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, is often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 14 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Alice has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Alice described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Alice’s Group will be able to plant a total of 8.5 acres of land and purchase a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a resident in the town of Dulag, Leyte. She is a married woman with three children ages 18, 17 and 6 years old. She raises hogs to earn a living. Almost 3 years now, she has been engaged in this kind of business. Her husband earns a living by farming. Maria is asking for a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional pigs and pig feed. With these, she can improve her hog raising business. She will be raising healthy pigs and in a few months, thus augment her income. She can now afford to buy a nutritious diet for the whole family. She hopes that someday, Maria could maintain and manage her business successfully and hopefully, these will then lead to a sustainable livelihood in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Uwezo Group

texts.fr: Madame MAZAMBI,est vice-présidente du groupe UWEZO. A  l’âge de 28 ans, elle est mariée à un vendeur et mère de 3 enfants, tous empruntant le chemin de l’école.Elle s’occupe de la vente des produits divers au marché central. Elle sollicite un nouveau pret qui lui servira d’acheter 2 cartons des boîtes des conserves des tomates, 2 douzaines de lait de beauté, des savons de toilette et de savon de lessive. Son vœu est de construire une maison et d’agrandir son entreprise. Elle remercie HEKIMA pour son soutien.
texts.en: Mazambi is vice-president of the Uwezo group. She is 28 years old, married to a salesman and mother to three children, all at school. She sells a variety of products in the central market and is requesting a new loan which will be used to buy two cartons of canned tomatoes, two dozen beauty lotions, soaps and detergents. She would like to be able to build a house and expand her business, and she thanks Hekima for its support.

loans.use: to buy two cartons of canned tomatoes, two dozen beauty lotions, soaps and detergent.

loans.name: Ep Nidunga Group

texts.fr: Monsieur RAMAZANI est président du groupe de crédit EP NIDUNGA. Enseignant de formation, il est agé de 52 ans, marié et père de 8 enfants tous étudiants. Il vient de solliciter un crédit pour lui permettre de réhabiliter sa maison. Il remercie IMF HEKIMA pour ce produit innovant qui intègre toute catégorie confondue de la population ; même les enseignants confrontés à la modicité salariale.
texts.en: Ramazani is president of the EP Nidunga loan group. A trained teacher, he is 52 years old, married and father to eight children who are all students. He has just requested a loan so that he can renovate his house. He is grateful to IMF Hekima for this innovative product which integrates all classes of the population, including teachers who have modest salaries.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en:
Nargiz lives in Antaramut village, Lori region with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and three grandchildren. The family runs a farm. It includes six cows and twelve calves. Near the house where family live, they own arable land where a large variety of vegetables and fruits are cultivated (potatoes, cabbages, grass, plums, nuts, apples and pears). Each member of the family works on the farm: Nargiz takes care of the livestock, milks cows and gets dairy products; her husband sells the gathered harvest and dairy products in local markets, and their daughter-in-law takes care of the land cultivation. 
Nargiz’s son works at the village municipality and also helps the family with farming activities. To sustain the farm and make it more profitable, Nargiz needs to make some financial investments. Specifically, Nargiz needs to purchase six tires for the tractor, and forage (grass and barley) for feeding the livestock during the winter season. The requested loan will be a huge support for this hard working family to make those purchases and develop their farm. Nargiz relies on the lenders’ goodwill and support.

loans.use: to purchase six tires for her tractor, and forage (grass and barley) for feeding the livestock during the winter season

loans.name: Khalji 20 Group

texts.en: This group is called Khalji 20. It consists of six women, living in Hodeidah city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 280,000 YER from AMB. Najma is the leader of the group. She is a 35-years-old married woman with three daughters, living in a poor area of Hodeidah. Her husband is the breadwinner of the family. Over time, he has become unable to look after the family. Najma decided to help him by covering some of the necessary family expenses. From this side, she decided to distribute phone recharge cards to call centers and shops in her area. Najma has decided to enlarge her business. For this reason, she has applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase an amount of phone recharge cards and then sell them to call centers and shops. Najma hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase an amount of phone recharge cards and then sell them to call centers and shops.

loans.name: Ulezi Group

texts.fr: Madame NANKAFU est présidente de l'association d'affaire ULEZI, mère de 2 enfants tous étudiants à l'age de 45 ans. Elle est vendeuse des matières précieuses depuis 1998 suite au premier fonds reçus de son mari qui est chauffeur de taxi. Elle vient de solliciter un prêt qui lui permettra de prendre en location  10m2 de carrière à exploiter. Elle compte construire une maison, renforcer son système d’épargne, agrandir son entreprise et payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en: Nankafu is president of the Ulezi business association and, at 45 years old, is mother to two children who are both studying. She has been selling precious materials since 1998 when she was given her first capital by her husband who is a taxi driver. She has just requested a loan which will enable her to rent ten square meters of a quarry which she will exploit. She is planning to build a house, boost her savings, expand her business and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to rent ten square meters of a quarry to exploit.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, her husband, mother-in-law and two children live in Karnut village. Both her husband and her mother-in-law work in the private sector. As for Mariam, she takes care of the children and also manages to run the family farm. 
She has cows, calves, pigs and hens, as well as growing a big variety of fruits and vegetables on the arable land near the house. 
Realizing how important agricultural income is for the family’s living, Mariam has requested this loan to buy potato seeds and livestock feed. 
This loan will greatly help her to sustain her farming business and she hopes for lenders’ support.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and livestock feed

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José, tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a su madre y hermanos, reside en una aldea del municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. José, desde pequeño aprendió su oficio de mecánica automotriz junto a su padre, ahora el administra el taller donde presta el servicio de reparación de motocicletas, mecánica y también realiza trabajos de soldadura en vehículos. El taller lo tiene instalado en su casa. Decidió solicitar un préstamo por 10,000 lempiras para comprar repuestos, aceites, baterías y otros materiales para brindar mantenimiento a las motocicletas. Su sueño es obtener mas ingresos para ampliar el local y que el cliente se sienta cómodo, y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 27 years old, is single and lives with his mother and siblings in a village in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. 

José learnt his trade as a motor mechanic from his father at a young age. Now he runs the work-shop and the following services are provided: motorcycle repairs, mechanics and vehicle welding. The work-shop is located in José's home. 

Jose decided to request a loan of 10,000 lempiras to buy spare parts, oil, batteries and other materials in order to offer motorcycle maintenance. His dream is to generate more profit and expand the business, in order to ensure his clients feel welcomed and so he can improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy spare parts, oil, batteries and other materials in order to offer motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is engaged in a rice retailing business. She sells rice to the people in her community. In order to have another source of income, she raises and sells hogs. She is a 46-year-old married woman. Together with her husband, she has a 14-year-old daughter. She lives in Dulag, Leyte.

Margarita is asking for a loan to buy additional sacks of rice to resell. These will help her to sell more rice and roll back her capital. In this way, she will increase her earnings, allowing her to pay for household expenses and school fees.

Margarita is determined to improve and expand both of her sources of income to be able to finance the education of her child and to provide better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to resell

loans.name: Nurana

texts.en:
Nurana is a 26-year-old married woman, and she has a 1-year-old daughter. She never went to school because of her parents' financial situation and the war. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her family in Bilasuvar region. They are living in hard conditions, and because of that she is working everyday without rest. 

Nurana has worked growing fruits and vegetables. She learned this from her father. This has allowed her to move her family ahead. Her day starts at 6:00 a.m. because she wakes up very early to milk a cow. She is requesting a loan to Aqroinvest CU to buy seeds, manure and poison. Her dream in the future is to see her child graduate with a college career, because she was not able to do it. Please support Nurana.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure and poison.

loans.name: Alida

texts.en:
Alida and her husband have been involved in sheep breeding for many years. They currently own livestock of sixteen sheep and are working hard to keep their business profitable. They have been involved in this business for 10 years, and over those years they were able to gain a lot of experience in the agribusiness field. Alida’s husband also works at private company as a driver, and the salary he gets is also very important for family’s living. 

To enlarge her livestock by 15 more sheep, and to purchase forage (200 packages) for feeding the livestock, Alida has applied for this loan. She asks lenders to support her loan to be funded and hopes for their support.

This is Alida’s first loan request, and it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative by Kiva and SEF. This first-chance loan program provides loans to people who have not had access to credit products because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to purchase 15 sheep and forage (200 packages) for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Azizali

texts.en:
Azizali is 37 years old; he is married with two children. The elder of his children is going to second class  of school; the other child will go to school in the next year. His family are IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city and now live in Fuzuli region. 

Azizali has been in the animal breeding business for 12 years. He buys little calves, fattens them and sells them. His wife helps Azizali in his business. Azizali has applied to Komak company for a loan in the amount of 900 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan he wants to buy calves. For the help he says he is thankful for Kiva organization and its lenders. In the future he wants to help his children in education.

loans.use: to buy calves to expand his business; in future he wants to help his children in education

loans.name: Familia Capilla De San Jorge Group

texts.es:
Don Roberto es un hombre muy alegre pero sobretodo trabajador siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de su familia, tiene 37 años de edad y está casado con la señora Jacqueline desde hace 17 años. Juntos han formado una familia con cinco hijos que actualmente están estudiando. 

Roberto proviene de una generación de panaderos, desde pequeño convivió con el horno, azúcar, leña, harina, etc.  Cuando decidió formar una familia también emprendió su propio negocio, aunque al inicio no tenía nada, su papá lo apoyó prestándole un horno, algunas charolas y un pequeño puesto para comenzar a vender el pan de feria. Roberto trabajó arduamente y en medio año logro regresarle todo el material a su papá; su negocio marchaba muy bien, en un solo año logró establecer dos puestos de pan de feria y actualmente ya cuenta con cuatro, en cada uno de ellos trabajan dos empleados.

Don Roberto está muy contento por darles trabajo a algunas personas, sin embargo, aunque tiene a sus empleados debe ausentarse de casa durante varios días porque los puestos son parte de las ferias de los pueblos y que tardan algunos días en finalizar. Roberto aprovecha al máximo estos periodos para obtener las mejores ganancias. Durante las vacaciones, afortunadamente sus hijos y esposa lo acompañan en los viajes. 

La única dificultad que enfrenta Roberto es la competencia en las distintas ferias donde trabaja, “Ya hay muchos panaderos y es muy difícil obtener buenas ganancias aunque ya también son muchos años de experiencia y el buen sabor es el que nos identifica de los demás”  comentó Don Roberto. Anteriormente el pan de los abuelos era horneado solo con leña y en casa pero el sabor era único, actualmente el pan es cocinado a gas y en el mismo lugar de la feria, el sabor ha cambiado pero Don Roberto siempre ha tratado de mantener un sabor único.

Con el préstamo que ha solicitado comprará harina, huevos, levadura, azúcar etc. para seguir trabajando y hacer su sueño realidad: expandir el negocio para poder seguir apoyando económicamente a sus hijos ya que quieren estudiar una carrera profesional. Su hijo mayor quien está estudiando la preparatoria quiere ser dentista; otro, doctor; una de sus hijas, asistente de vuelo; la otra niña, aún no lo decide y únicamente el más pequeño dice que quiere continuar con el negocio de su papá. 

Los demás integrantes del grupo son Yeny quien invertirá en un cibercafé mientras que Mayte y Ofelia también invertirán en pan de feria. Ellos están muy agradecidos y contentos por la oportunidad de recibir un préstamo.

*La foto fue tomada en el jardín del municipio aparecen los cuatro integrantes*
texts.en:
Don Roberto is a very content person, industrious and always concerned with the welfare of his family. He is 37, and has been married to his wife, Señora Jacqueline, for 17 years. The couple has five children, who all attend school. 

Roberto is the son of bakers, and from an early age was always working with the oven and firewood, and mixing sugar, flour, and other ingredients. He set up his own bakery when he started a family. Roberto had nothing back then, but his father provided an oven, some pans, and a small space where Roberto could begin selling bread at markets. Roberto worked diligently and within six months had returned everything his father had lent him. His business was off to a strong start, and in just a year he was selling bread at two markets. He now has spaces at four markets, each staffed by two employees.    

Don Roberto is very pleased that he's able to provide jobs to a small group of people. But he still needs to be away from home for several days at a time, preparing to meet the demand from customers at the markets. Roberto takes advantage of these busy periods to boost his income, and is fortunate that the family can take vacations together. 

The only problem for Roberto is competition at the various markets where he sells his bread. He observed, "There are many bakers and it's tough to achieve good sales. Our years of experience and the great taste of our bread is what sets us apart from the competition." Roberto's grandparents had a wood-fired oven in their home, and their bread had a distinct taste. Bakers today use gas-fired ovens at the market site, and the flavor of their bread has changed. But Don Roberto has always striven to preserve the distinct flavor that has become a family tradition.  

Roberto plans to use the funds from this loan to purchase flour, eggs, yeast, sugar, and other ingredients so he can sustain his market bakeries and achieve his goal: expanding the business and providing for his children, who want to study and prepare for professional careers. The oldest son is studying dentistry, while one of his younger brothers plans to be a doctor. One of Roberto's daughters wants to be a flight attendant, while the other girl hasn't yet decided on a career. Only the youngest child says he wants to follow his father's example and take over the bakery business. 

The other group members are Yeny, who will invest in a cybercafe, Mayte and Ofelia, who also will invest in market bakeries. The members are all very pleased and very grateful for the opportunity to receive a loan. 

*The photo was taken at a city park and includes all four group members*

loans.use: to purchase flour, eggs, yeast, sugar, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Elena Patricia

texts.es:
Elena es una mujer de 30 años madre soltera de 4 hijos de 12, 9, 5 y 3 años de edad, lo más preocupante es que ella no cuenta con un empleo, lo único que tenía era trabajos por días donde conseguía algún capital para comprar comida para sus hijos.
Estando en su casa sin hacer nada se le ocurrió la idea de iniciar su propio negocio de venta de ropa, blusas, camisetas, jean, ambulantemente, tocando puerta a puerta ya que este negocio significara para su familia la oportunidad de salir adelante, de que sus hijos vuelan a estudiar, de siquiera tener un palto de comida, por eso apóyala ella te necesita y mucho, quiere pelear y sacar a sus hijos de la pobreza.
texts.en:
Elena is a 30-year-old woman, a single mother of 4 children, ages 12, 9, 5, and 3. Most worrying for her is that she doesn't have a job, the only thing she had was some day jobs where she got some capital to buy food for her children.

Being in her house without doing anything, the idea occurred to her that she could start her own business selling clothing, blouses, shirts, jeans, as a street vendor, going door-to-door, since this business would mean the opportunity to get ahead for her family. Her children could go back to school, and even have an avocado to eat. For this reason, help her, she needs you a lot, she wants to fight and get her children out of poverty.

loans.use: to start her own clothing business, selling blouses, shirts, jeans, as a street vendor.

loans.name: Anderson

texts.es:
Anderson es un joven soltero de 22 años, noble y responsable con gran sentido de pertenencia, al ver que él y su familia necesitan dinero decidió acercarse a las oficinas de interactuar contar su proyecto para iniciar lo más pronto posible.
Anderson desea iniciar su venta de frutas y verduras y ahora necesita tu apoyo para poder comprar estantería, alquilar el local, y surtido.
Tu apoyo significara para Anderson la oportunidad de ganarse su propio sustento honradamente, de soñar con que puede estudiar y apoyar a sus padres con cualquier monto de dinero para los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Anderson is a single, 22-year-old man, courteous and responsible, with a strong sense of belonging. Seeing that he and his family need money, he decided to approach the Interactuar offices and explain his project, to be able to start as soon as possible.

Anderson wants to begin his fruit and vegetable sales and now he needs your support to be able to purchase shelving, rent a retail space, and stock it.

Your help will mean to Anderson the opportunity to earn his own sustenance honestly, to dream that he could go to school, and help his parents with whatever amount of money for the family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase shelving, rent a retail space, and purchase an assortment of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo runs a sari-sari (variety) store.  He sells various household merchandise like sugar, eggs, candles, toothpaste, cooking oil, shampoo, soap and other goods. He has been running the store for two years already. Aside from operating a store, he is a barber. He is a 38-year-old, married man from Dulag, Leyte. He has two young children.

Danilo is asking for a loan to buy stock like canned goods, soft drinks, beverages and toiletries. This stock is essential in his daily earnings. This is the main fuel in operating his store back again. In this way, he would start to pay his expenses including his loan. He is hoping that he could properly handle his business, to be successful for the welfare of his growing children.

loans.use: to buy stock like canned goods, soft drinks, beverages and toiletries.

loans.name: Floretta

texts.en:
Floretta has been producing safety address books for children and parents for 14 years, since 2000. Her books help parents to record important information in one book that both parents and kids have access to in case of emergency.  She is passionate about children’s safely and has helped countless families with her books.  

She was very successful for a few years, but slowed down due to changes in technology.  

Floretta will use her Kiva loan to start video production of her book and re-start sales to her contacts who keep requesting them.

loans.use: to start video production of her book and re-start sales

loans.name: Narmin

texts.en:
Narmin is an 18-year-old student. She is from Baku, city of wind, and lives with her parents. She studies at the university for teachers and doesn't work anywhere yet. The main income of the family comes from her father who earns 600 AZN monthly. Her brother also works but earns only 250 AZN. This income isn't enough to provide for the family because the capital of Azerbaijan is a very expensive city.
						
Education in Azerbaijan is also expensive. Narmin studies in the first course and has to pay the education fee for the university yearly. She wants to be a teacher in kindergarten because she likes children very much. She wants help children to be clever and smart. Unfortunately her father's income isn't enough to pay for her study fees. 

Narmin applied for a 1200 AZN loan in order to be able to pay the education fee. Narmin is a very positive girl and hopes to make her future bright. Let's help Narmin to reach her aims.

loans.use: to pay yearly education fee

loans.name: Kellin Viviana

texts.es:
Kellin una joven soltera de 27 años de edad que se desempeña como vendedora de artículos de decoración, bolsas de regalo, accesorios y variedad de cosas muy enfocado para mujer, monto su negocio gracias a que anteriormente se desempeñaba en trabajos similares donde trabaja largas horas por un salario muy básico, cansada de eso decidió montar su propio negocio y, ahora que lo tiene busca alternativas para hacer de este almacén un negocio estable y sostenible en el tiempo.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de artículos de juguetería, ropa para mujer, blusas, jeans, camisas, camisetas, pijamas, y exhibidores para tener sus nuevos artículos.
Tu apoyo significara para Kellin un impulso emocional pues sabe que está haciendo las cosas bien y que cada que necesite un apoyo puede contar con la ayuda de miles de personas que darán su voto de confianza por el emprendimiento y la reducción del desempleo en el mundo.
texts.en:
Kellin is a single young woman, 27 years old, who works as a saleswoman of decorative items, gift bags, accessories, and an variety of things very focused on women.  She opened her business thanks to having previously worked in similar jobs where she worked for long hours for a very basic wage. Tired of this, she decided to open her own business, and now that she has it, she is looking for alternatives to make this shop a stable business and sustainable over time.

She asks for a loan to purchase toys, women's clothing, blouses, jeans, shirts, t-shirts, pajamas and a display case to hold her new items.

Your help will mean for Kellin an emotional boost since she knows that she is doing things well and each time she needs support she can count on the help of thousands of people who will give her their vote of confidence for her undertaking and reducing the unemployment in the world.

loans.use: to purchase toys, women's clothing, blouses, jeans, shirts, t-shirts and pajamas.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur lives in Yerevan city with his mother. He is 30 years old. Artur is divorced and he has a son, who lives with Artur’s ex-wife. Artur’s father died several years ago and now he lives with his lovely mother, who is retired and she is a housewife. Artur has no higher education, but he manages both to take care of his son and also his mother. He has a minibus on which he manages passenger transfers to different directions; to Nagorno Karabakh, to Georgia and etc. 

Artur is requesting a loan of 450,000 AMD in order to solve his dental problem, and also to pass a course of treatment connected with his teeth.

loans.use: to solve his dental problem and to also pass a course of treatment connected with his teeth.

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
Jhonny es un hombre de 26 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es la confección de prendas de vestir. 
Él es independiente, emprendedor, contante, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona de ‘Bajo san Antonio’ un área caracterizada por encontrarse en una ladera de la ciudad, donde las calles son empinadas, la mayoría de los habitantes son ex fabriles, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-14 grados centígrados.
Jhonny es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro corto, ojos obscuros, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia para el comercio habla español. Su vida la comparte con sus padres que se dedica al comercio. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de prendas de vestir a medida, como; chamarras para varón, pantalones, trajes, sacos y otros; él se encarga de comprar telas de todo tipo como; lisas. Impermeable, de colores enteros y otras con diseños para luego confeccionarlas como chaquetas o pantalones en todo modelo y de toda talla. Labor que realiza en una habitación habilitada como taller en su domicilio. “la confección de ropa es consumida constantemente con mayor frecuencia, es por esa razón que confecciono en cantidad…” comenta. Su sueño es realizar confecciones por mayor. El desea realizar la compra de una máquina de coser overlock para contar con mejores diseños. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que viene realizando esta actividad de manera continua.
Es por esos motivos que Jhonny solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser overlock para contar con mejores diseños y satisfacer la demanda del mercado.
texts.en: Jhonny is a 26 year old man. He is single and does not have children, and his business is making clothing items. He is independent, enterprising, constant, responsible and hardworking. He has his business in the area of ‘Bajo San Antonio’ an area found on the foothills of the city, where the streets are steep. Most of the inhabitants are industrial. The weather is cold and dry, and the temperature varies during the day between 2-14 degrees Celsius. Jhonny is dark skinned, short, and has black short hair and dark eyes. His native language is Aymará that he speaks with his family; for the business he speaks Spanish. He shares his life with his parents who work in commerce. They live in their own house, built in brick that has running water, electricity and sewerage. His business is to make customized clothing items such as: men jackets, pants, suits, blazers and others. He buys fabrics of all types such as: plain, waterproof, of one color, and others with designs in order to use them to make jackets and pants in all styles and sizes. He works in a room in his house that serves as his workshop. "The production of clothes is constantly consumed; therefore, I produce a large amount", he comments. His dream is to produce in large amounts. He wants to buy an overlock sewing machine in order to have more designs. This is his first loan cycle with the institution in 15 years working in this job continuously. This is the reason why Jhonny is requesting a loan to buy an overlock sewing machine with better designs and satisfy market demand.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine in order to have better designs and satisfy market demand.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores toils the land and does farming. She grows and sells rice. She also engages in a hog raising business. During her leisure time, she sells pancit (a Filipino noodle dish with different vegetables or meats and seafood). She is a married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 9 and the youngest is 2.

Dolores has requested a loan to buy farm supplies like  rice seedlings and fertilizers. With these, she will be able to prepare her field to start growing rice, and she will harvest it in the coming months. Thus she could repay her loan and cover other expenses.

 Dolores would like to expand her sources of income to become sustainable and productive to improve their status of living and to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like  rice seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Luz Nedy

texts.es:
Luz, una amorosa mujer casada que se dedica a la confección, actividad que inicio por gusto y vocación al trabajo independiente y pro primera necesidad ante la falta de recursos para cubrir la totalidad de gastos que tienen en su hogar que lo completan su esposo y su hijo de 11 años de edad.
Luz inicio con la actividad con la intención de poder darle a su hijo las herramientas necesarias para que pueda triunfar en la vida, como lo es una buena educación entre otros y para realizar algunas reformas a su casa que como pueden ver esta en adobe, sin revocar y tiene muchas falencias.
Solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos, una maquina recubridora y un motor ahorrar de energía pues al ser maquinaria que funcionan todo el día la cuenta de servicios llega muy alta, con tu ayuda esta mujer bajara sus gastos y optimizara sus tiempos de confección
texts.en:
Luz, a loving married woman, who works sewing, which she began with pleasure and a vocation for the work, independently and for necessity facing a lack of resources to cover all the expenses they had in her household, which is formed of her husband and their 11-year-old son.

Luz began with her work with the intention of begin able to give her son the tools necessary to be able to triumph in life, such as a good education among others, and to make some changes to her house, which as can be seen, is adobe, without taking away or lacking much.

She asks for a loan to purchase supplies, an overlock machine, and an energy-conserving motor since with the machines working all day, the utility bill gets very high. With your support, this woman will reduce her expenses and optimize her time sewing.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, an overlock machine, and an energy-conserving motor.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is a teacher working at the village secondary school.  After her work as a teacher, Maya runs her family farm. Maya lives with her two sons who help her with the farming work. She keeps their two piglets and hens, and cultivates wheat, emmer wheat, onions, and watermelon, and also grows apricot and cherry trees. 

To be able to enlarge cultivation of vegetables, Maya needs funds to renovate her old greenhouse. The requested loan will help her to renovate it, to purchase polyethylene to cover the greenhouse and pipes. Maya now asks lenders to support her loan to be funded ensuring responsible monthly payments.

loans.use: to purchase polyethylene cover and pipes to renovate her greenhouse.

loans.name: Gaza  Al-Hodeida Group

texts.en:
This is the same group which applied for a first loan from Kiva lenders. They have now applied for a second loan of 110,000 YER from Kiva lenders.

Lolah is the same leader of the group. She applied for a second loan to buy clothes for expanding her business more. That first loan helped her very much to enlarge her business, and she became able to attract a lot of customers. She is very thankful to Kiva lenders for their first loan. 

After she finished the repayment of all the installments of the first loan, Lolah applied for a second loan of 30,000 YER from Kiva lenders in order to buy more clothes to resell to her customers, hoping to expand her business more. She hopes to be financed in this loan, too.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell to her customers

loans.name: David Leonardo

texts.es:
David es un hombre de 31 años de edad, vive con su pareja, sin hijos, y su negocio es la fabricación de adhesivos.
Él es emprendedor, independiente, constante, creativo, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona central, un área caracterizada por el comercio en todas las áreas, y que alberga a universidades, oficinas públicas y empresas privadas que conviven lado a lado, de clima templado durante todo el año, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 14-24 grados centígrados.
David es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Quechua que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que trabaja atendiendo el negocio, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es el diseño, elaboración y venta de adhesivos para negocios, autos, cuadernos y otros. Él se ocupa de diseñar mediante el uso de software; adhesivos de todo tamaño, con textos que describen el nombre del negocio, nombres de grupos de música, figuras infantiles, etc., para imprimirlos y ponerlos a la venta. Labor que realiza durante la semana en un cuarto habilitado como taller y puesto de venta ubicado en a su domicilio. “la creatividad es importante en el diseño, también se debe estar informado de marcas, grupos musicales actuales, programas televisivos de moda, para diseñarlos e imprimirlos, todo es importante en el negocio…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un negocio grande y muchas ventas. Él desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de un plotter para trabajar constantemente. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que David solicita un préstamo para la compra de un plotter para ampliar su negocio y contar con trabajo constante
texts.en:
David is a 31-year-old man, who lives with his partner, without children, and his business is making stickers. 

He is enterprising, independent, steady, creative, responsible and hard-working. His business is in the central zone, an area characterized by commerce of all sorts, and which houses universities, public offices, and private businesses which exist side-by-side. The climate is temperate throughout the year, with a temperature that varies during the day between 14-24 degrees centigrade. 

David has tanned skin, short black hair, is short, his native language is Quechua, which he speaks with his family, and he speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the business he does. He shares his live with his wife who works taking care of the business. They live in a rented house made of bricks that has drinking water, electricity, and sewer services. His business is the design, production and sale of stickers for businesses, cars, notebooks, and others. He takes care of the design with the use of software, and makes stickers of all sizes, with text that describes the business, names of musical groups, images for children, etc., to sell them. He does the work during the week in a room fixed up as a workshop and sales space in his house. "Creativity is important in the design, and also one should be aware of brands, current musical groups, popular television programs, to design and print them, everything is important in the business..." he says. His dream is to have a large business with a lot of sales. He wants to expand the business through the purchase of a plotter to work continuously. This is his first loan cycle with the institution in the 1 year he has been doing this work.

It is for these reasons that David is asking for a loan to purchase a plotter to expand his business and have steady work.

loans.use: to purchase a plotter to expand his business and have more steady work.
